Servillano aims to continue his business and to make it more profitable. He is therefore asking for additional capital in the amount of PhP 10,000, which he will use to buy tires, oil, and other much-needed materials for the maintenance of his vehicle. 

He believes that this loan will enable him to improve the business. His goal for the future is to improve the family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy tires, oil, and other much-needed materials for the maintenance of his vehicle

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda, age 57, owns and manages a dressmaking and shoe repair business in her local community to earn a living. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns PhP 15,000 every month.

She and her husband have three children and live in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. 

Erlinda has been a member of GDMPC since 2010. She is presently requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 20,000, which she will use to purchase additional materials for her business. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her dressmaking and shoe repair business

loans.name: Edison

texts.en: Edison is a 38-year-old married man with one child living in Kagadi, Uganda. After assessing the lucrative nature of the agriculture sector, he decided to venture into the produce business and within four years his business is steadily growing. He dreams of building a residential house for his growing family and trading in wholesale despite the challenges of unpredictable weather and bad roads that affect his business. Edison intends to use the loan to buy coffee and maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy coffee and maize to sell.

loans.name: Besik

texts.en:
Besik is 45 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and son in the Bolnisi District. Besik is an artisan who earns a small daily income based on the orders he receives. Besik has requested a small-business loan from local financial institutions several times but he has not had success. His loan request was rejected because of his low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

According to Credo estimations, the family belongs in the subsistence poor category. 

Besik has requested a loan from Credo to start a new business. His loan request was approved as a result of a new loan program that grants loans to those who are considered "high risk borrowers" due to their low incomes. This program is a new initiative of Kiva and Credo. 

With the received credit, Besik will buy materials to build a shed. After building the shed, he plans to buy milk cows and start an animal-husbandry business. His wife will milk the cows and produce dairy products to sell. This will increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to build a shed and buy milk cows to start an animal-husbandry business.

loans.name: Samira

texts.en:
Samira, age 48, sells home products and kitchen tools from her home to earn an income. She and her husband have two daughters and a son.

Samira is applying for a loan in order to increase her quantity of goods on hand so that she can better meet customer demand.

loans.use: to increase the quantity of goods that she has on hand to offer for sale

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia, age 54 and widowed, is a tailor. She has six children, for whom she is the sole provider. She tells us that she began learning the clothing trade at a young age through family tradition, and since taking charge of the family obligations, she decided to hire third parties to work with her in her clothing shop. She is recognized in her neighborhood for possessing great charisma and for being concerned for the well-being of her community.  

Currently, Nelia is requesting a loan which she will invest in the purchase of a one-needle sewing machine. This will allow her to optimize her work during times of high production and thereby increase her revenue.

Her greatest dream is to see her clothing shop grow so that she can increase sales and generate new sources of employment, especially for mothers like herself who are heads of the family and who do not presently have job opportunities. Furthermore, she hopes that her children will have a better quality of life and a economic conditions.

loans.use: to buy a one-needle sewing machine

loans.name: Ronilo

texts.en:
Ronilo is a farmer from Talibon, Bohol. He is engaged in a banana plantation and has been in the business for more than 10 years now. This is the source of his income.

Ronilo is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for the farm. With this, he will be able to improve his farm and his yield.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the farm

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel, age 31, raises pigs to earn a living. She has been engaged in this agricultural business for the past two years. Over that time, she has taken out and repaid three loans from NWTF to help sustain her enterprise. 

She and her husband have two children, both of whom are enrolled in school.

Maricel is requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 11,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. 

In the future, Maricel would like to save enough money to allow her to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is 44 years old and married with two children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Cynthia has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Cynthia has requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Cynthia has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, Cynthia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy grocery items for grocery selling business

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en:
Augustine is a 36-year-old married man with three children living in Kagadi, Uganda. He is a politician who is a local council leader.

Due to his passion for agriculture, he started a produce business two years ago to supplement his salary and also has continued to do farming. He dreams of educating his children up to the university level and setting up a food store.  Augustine intends to use the loan to buy maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell

loans.name: Jinky

texts.en: This time Jinky is borrowing 25,000 PHP to buy grocery products to sell in her store.  The rice retailing business that she previously funded through NWTF and Kiva continues to provide her and her family with income that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari (convenience) store

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba is a 41-year-old ambitious married woman living in the Binguang province of Isabela. Melba decided to venture into the transport business. She started as a vendor, but, through hard work, she has been able to buy her own motorcycle and to buy land.

She now wants to ask for a loan amounting 20,000 PHP to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of her business. Melba hopes that her business expands so that she can give the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of cabbage and tomato seeds

loans.name: Anatosi

texts.en:
Anatosi, age 34, is a teacher. He has been teaching for six years. His salary, though very low, has enabled him to pay school fees for his children. The urge to work with young people drove him into the profession and he feels inspired every time one of his students excels.

He lives with his wife and their four children in Kasese.

Like most government workers, he is challenged by the low salary pay. His dream is to diversify into agriculture.

Anatosi intends to use the loan funds to pay school fees and to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to pay school fees and to buy a plot of land

loans.name: Edmund

texts.en:
Edmund, age 31, is a rice farmer. Upon harvesting his crop, he sells the produce to traders, and he earns approximately PhP 10,000 each harvest season, which comes twice a year. He has been engaged in his business for over 10 years. He uses his income to sustain his family and as revolving capital in the business. He and his wife have one child.

Edmund would like to increase his income, which is why he is now asking for a loan in the amount of PhP 25,000. He will use the loan funds to buy pesticides and fertilizers needed in his farming enterprise. This will help sustain crops and ensure a healthier growth.

Edmund aims to continue ensuring a fruitful harvest in his farming business. His goal is to build up a savings fund for his child's education and to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizers for his farm

loans.name: Faustino

texts.en:
Faustino is a farmer from Alcala. He is 51 years old and has four children. He plants and harvests rice to sell to traders. He gain about 20,000 PHP each harvest season twice a year. His wife is a vegetable vendor. The couple generates income for family's sustenance. 

Faustino is now asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to invest in maintaining healthy crops. He will buy fertilizers and insecticides use in farming.

Someday, Faustino hopes to gain more income to improve his harvest and save for family's future expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticides to use in farming.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase plastic sheeting and drip hosing

loans.name: Siti

texts.en:
Siti runs small stall that sells soft drinks, snacks, coffee, cigarettes, cell phone accessories, and mobile phone airtime credits. Recently, she worked as a fabric laborer and has four persons living in her house. 

She joined Ruma seven months ago. The reason she joined is because she wanted to help increase her family income. When she got introduced to Ruma the first time, she felt satisfied with the terms that Ruma offers. 

Now, she feels really excited to expand her business of selling mobile phone airtime credits and facilitating bill payments for customers. For the last three months, she has had around $190 to $250 a day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business grows, she needs more working capital in order to be able to do transaction on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Ira

texts.en:
Ira runs small stall that sells mobile phone airtime credits. Recently, she worked as a fabric laborer and has three persons living in her house. 

She joined Ruma six months ago and still feels really excited to expand her business of selling mobile phone airtime credits and facilitating bill payments for customers. For the last three months, she has had around $50 to $60 a day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business grows, she needs more working capital in order to be able to do transaction on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Encih

texts.en:
Encih runs small stall that sells mobile phone airtime credits. Recently, she worked as a private employee and has five persons living in her house. 

She joined Ruma six months ago because she intended to increase her income and still is really excited to expand her business of selling mobile phone airtime credits and facilitating bill payments for customers. 

For the last three months, she has had around $115 to $170 a day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business runs, she needs more working capital in order to be able to do transaction on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 29-year-old government employee who works as a primary school teacher. She is married, a mother to two children, and they live in Kagadi, Uganda. She was inspired to enter the teaching profession by her urge to serve the nation, and she felt there was no better way but to teach the children of her nation. 

She does farming to supplement the low pay from her salary. Her dreams are to upgrade her studies and venture into modern farming. Rose is requesting a loan to pay school fees for herself.

loans.use: to pay school fees for herself.

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy, age 20 and the mother of a baby, reports that she believes that "success is the fruit of sacrifice." Due to financial hardship, she has started a business selling fruits and vegetables in order to supplement her husband's income. 

She would like to acquire another stock of fruits and vegetables to offer for sale, but she does not have enough capital to do so at present. For this reason, she is requesting an additional loan in the amount of PhP 10,000, which she will use to buy bananas, tomatoes, squash, onions, potatoes, pomelos, beans, eggplant, cabbages, and sweet potatoes to offer for sale. 

She is hoping that the loan will be a great help to her in improving the business.

loans.use: to buy bananas, tomatoes, squash, onions, potatoes, pomelos, beans, eggplant, cabbages, and sweet potatoes to offer for sale

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia, age 38 and widowed, works hard to provide for her two children. She runs a general store business where she sells such items as soft drinks and soap. She has been running the store for five years. She earns an additional income from offering tricycle transportation.

She is requesting a PhP 10,000 loan through NWTF, which she will use to purchase grocery items to offer for sale in her store. She has borrowed and successfully repaid two previous loans from NWTF. 

Sonia's goal is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items like soft drinks and soap to offer for sale

loans.name: Margarit

texts.en:
Margarit, age 42, works in a local fabric venture(the photo is taken in the workplace), but she also is involved in agriculture. She grows peaches, apricots, cherries, and apples, and she sells the gathered harvest at local markets. She lives with her husband and their two sons in the village of Lanjazat. The whole family works hard to gather a good harvest to cover the family's basic needs. Margarit's work at a soft drink factory helps her to get additional income and sustain her family.

As agriculture helps Margarit to have a stable income during the month, she would like to expand her enterprise. She has therefore applied for a loan, which she will use to buy two cows and to renovate her greenhouse. With the milk from the cows, Margarit plans to start up cheese production. The loan will also enable Margarit to renovate their old greenhouse, where they can then cultivate more fruits and vegetables.

The loan is very important for Margarit and her family, as it will allow them to gather a higher income and improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to buy two cows and renovate her old greenhouse

loans.name: Metaksia

texts.en:
Metaksia is from Pokr Vedi village of Ararat region. She grows 50 apricot trees and cultivates corn and watermelon. She works hard to get a good harvest and sell it in the local retail markets. Selling the agricultural products is the only source of income for Metaksia , so it is very important for her to gather good harvest and cover her family's basic expenses. 

Metaksia lives with her husband Norik, who is a constructor and her son Sasun who is 28 years old and helps his mother with agriculture. Metaksia has been involved in agriculture for more than 15 years and she dreams of having a big farm.

She has applied for this loan to purchase two heifers and seeds for cultivation. This will enable Metaksia to cultivate more fruit and vegetables and gather more harvest.

Metaksia waits for your support

loans.use: to pay for two heifers and seeds for cultivation

loans.name: Samia

texts.en: Samia is a 51-year-old married woman and the mother of four boys and girls. To help in supporting the family Samia sells clothes and kitchen products to friends and neighbors. Now Samia is applying for a loan to increase the quantity of goods she has.

loans.use: to increase the quantity of goods she has.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is 55 years old and married with 4 children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a retail business in the local community to earn a living. She has been with her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP every month. 

She has been with GDMPC since the year 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 12,500 PHP to purchase additional products to sell, like canned goods, shampoo, soap, sugar and coffee. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods, shampoo, soap, sugar and coffee.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a 29-year-old married woman and a mother of six young children from Talibon, Bohol. She has been engaged in a fishing business together with her husband for more than 12 years now.

She is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets and to pay for the repair of the fishing boat. In the future, Alma hopes to make their fishing business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and to pay for the repair of the fishing boat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials such as sand and bricks.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred and her husband are farmers. The couple's primary source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice to sell to traders. They have been engaged in this business for almost 10 years now and earn about PhP 20,000 each harvest season, which comes twice a year. Mildred and her husband  support two children, both of whom are enrolled in school.

Mildred would like to keep improving her harvest, which is why she is requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 25,000. She will use her loan funds to buy fertilizers and pesticides used in farming. This will help nourish her crops and ensure a healthier growth. 

Her goal is to continue to educate her children, and hopes for them eventually to achieve degrees and good employment.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her rice farm

loans.name: Neneth

texts.en:
Neneth operates a bakery business to earn an income. She has been engaged in this venture for four years and works hard to support her family. She is married and lives with her family in Cadiz.

Neneth has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 10,500 loan through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy ingredients for her baked food production business.
 
In the future, Neneth would like to save enough money to start up a bakery at the public market.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her bakery business

loans.name: Burmakan

texts.ru:
Бурмакан родилась в г. Жалал-Абад (Жалал-Абадской области), ей 60 лет, вдова, проживает со своей семьей в селе. Заемщица после окончания средней школы в г. Жалал-Абад вышла замуж. Муж скоропостижно скончался. Мать троих детей. 

Заемщица в настоящее время занимается животноводством, в этой сфере занимается с 1983 года. Бизнес начинала с 1,000 KGS. Постепенно развиваясь и увеличивая оборотные средства построила дом. Ежемесячный доход от бизнеса составляет 20,000 KGS. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бурмакан обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 135,000 сом (KGS) На всю сумму полученного кредита планирует купить скот для разведения и реализации. Заемщица планирует в будущем создать большую ферму для разведения КРС. После получения прибыли от данной деятельности заемщица планирует перестроить дом и сарай. За период подготовки необходимых документов и проведения финансового анализа заемщица показала себя с положительной стороны, как человек ответственный, порядочный, добросовестный, предприимчивый, умеющий правильно вести хозяйство и вкладывать денежные средства в нужное направление.
texts.en:
Burmakan was born in the city of Jalal-Abad (in the Jalal-Abad region), she is 60 years old, she is a widow and lives with her family in a small village.  The borrower after finishing high school in Jalal-Abad got married.  Her husband suddenly passed away.  She is the mother of three children.  

The borrower raises livestock and has been doing this since 1983.  She started her business from 1,000 KGS.  By slowly growing and expanding her working capital she built a house.  Her monthly income from the business is 20,000 KGS.  In order to further grow her business Burmakan turned to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 135,000 som (KGS).  She plans to use the entire loan sum to purchase livestock to raise and sell.  The borrower plans to build a big farm in the future to grow cattle.  After receiving the profits from this business the borrower plans to remodel her home and barn.  During the document preparation and financial analysis period the borrower showed herself to be responsible, decent, honest, entrepreneurial, able to run her farm and to invest monetary resources in the right way.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to raise and sell

loans.name: Renante

texts.en:
Renante is a  married man and the father of two young children. He and his family live in Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. He is engaged in maintaining and servicing a mango-tree plantation for fruit-bearing purposes. 

His work includes spraying mango trees with pesticides to improve the productivity of the mango trees.

Renante has been in this business for several years now.

Renante is asking for a loan to buy more pesticides for the mango trees. In the future, Renante hopes to make his business sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy more pesticides for his mango trees.

loans.name: Salim

texts.en:
Salim, who is 41 years old, is a married Iraqi client, with three children. Salim is the only provider in the family.

Salim is a grocer and he owns a small store where he sells soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents, and snacks. He established his business in 2007. Being the only grocer in the area helped Salim to grow his business and gain a good reputation.

Salim is requesting a USD 1,800 loan to buy two new refrigerators and to increase his food inventory. He is aiming to increase his profits, so he will be able to give his best for his children by providing them with a good education and satisfaction of their needs.

loans.use: to buy two new refrigerators and to increase his food inventory for his store.

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
Mirasol, age 34, operates a general store business. She has been engaged in this venture for four years and is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She and her husband have two children.

Mirasol has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 17,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to purchase canned goods, noodles, sugar, soft drinks, and school supplies.

In the future, Mirasol would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, noodles, sugar, soft drinks, and school supplies

loans.name: Daygie

texts.en:
Daygie and her husband have been engaged in a fishing business for more than three years. Her husband catches the fish and she sells the catch at market. This business is the sole source of their income. They live in Getafe, Bohol, with their five-month-old baby.
 
Daygie is requesting a loan in order to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, and fuel for the boat. With this investment, her husband will be able to improve his catch, thus providing her with more fish to sell at the market.

In the future, Daygie hopes to make their fishing business a success.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights and fuel for the boat

loans.name: Amiran

texts.en:
Amiran is a 56-year-old, married man. He lives in Zestafoni district with his family. He has a wife, age 52, two sons, a daughter-in-law, who is working as a pharmacist, and two infant grandchildren. His family owns a plot of land, where they have a vineyard. They also have one milk cow, two calves, and two pigs. They sell their agricultural products at the local markets in Zestafoni and Kutaisi districts, which brings them a small monthly income. Amiran also has a truck (lorry), and he works as a driver. He is a very hard-working man, who has been doing this business for 15 years, to provide for his big family.

Before deciding to take a loan, Amiran had planned to sell cattle, to obtain cash for purchasing more vine saplings and buying new tires for his truck. With this loan, Amiran will instead keep the cattle and develop his business. He will buy vine saplings and new tires with the loan money, and will be able to continue working as a truck driver and to increase the harvest from the vineyard. Amiran will reinvest the profits in his agricultural business. This will increase the family's income and give them a chance to have better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more vine saplings, and new tires for his truck

loans.name: Sandro

texts.en:
Sandro is 27 years old. He lives with his parents and sister in Telavi District. Several times, Sandro requested a loan from local financial institutions for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected each time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have seven milk cows and 11 calves. They produce dairy products to sell locally in an open market, at a good price. Sometimes, they slaughter a cow and sell the meat. But, the income is too small and it is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the 'subsistence poor' category. 

Sandro's loan request was approved in the framework of new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as 'high risk borrowers' because of low income. 

With the received credit, Sandro will purchase calves. After purchasing additional calves, he will be able to expand the cattle herd and increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase calves and expand the cattle herd.

loans.name: Alisher

texts.ru: Алишер житель района Файзабад. Ему 34 года. У него жена и двое детей. Алишер единственный кормилец в семье. Он обеспечивает семью занимаясь куплей и продажей крупно-рогатого скота. Алишер обычно покупает бычков, откармливает их несколько месяцев и затем продает их с наценкой на скотном рынке. Он занимается животноводческой деятельностью уже два года. Сейчас он намерен расширить свой бизнес. С этой целью он берет кредит для купли и продажи скота. За счет прибыли он хочет улучшить финансовое положение в семье.
texts.en: Alisher lives in the Fayzabad district of Tajikistan.  He is 34 years old, married, and has two children.  He is the only breadwinner in his family.  In order to provide for his family, he buys and sells cattle.  He usually buys young bulls, feeds them for a few months and then sells them for a profit at the cattle market.  He has been involved in animal husbandry for two years already and now wants to expand his business.  For this reason, he is taking a loan to purchase some livestock that he will resell.  He intends to use his profits to improve his family's financial situation.

loans.use: to buy and sell livestock in order to improve his family's financial situation.

loans.name: Sultonmurod

texts.ru: Султонмурод житель города Вахдат. Он женатый человек с тремя детьми. Ему 42 года. У Султонмурод высшее экономическое образование. Он работал бухгалтером 6 лет. Однако последние 4 года он занимается торговой деятельностью. Султонмурод на рынке города арендует торговую точку, где продает такие виды фрукты, как яблоко, груша, гранат, мандарин, банан и т.д. Чтобы увеличить товарооборот Султонмурод запрашивает кредит для приобретения ассортимента товара (фруктов). За счет прибыли с продажи он намерен расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Sultonmurod is a resident of the city of Vahdat. He is a married man with three children. He is 42 years old. Sultonmurod has higher economical education. He worked as an accountant for six years. However, the last four years he has worked with trade. 

Sultonmurod rents a sales stall at the market, where he sells fruit like apples, pears, pomegranate, bananas and so on. In order to increase the turnover Sultonmurod requests a loan for the purchase of an assortment of goods (fruits). He intends to expand his business with the help of the income.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of goods (fruit) with an aim to increase the turnover

loans.name: Guldasta

texts.ru: Гулдаста замужняя женщина с четырьмя детьми. Ей 45 лет. Она проживает в районе Файзабад. Гулдаста трудолюбивая женщина. Она наравне с мужем трудится и обеспечивает семью. Гулдаста занимается животноводством уже два года. Она покупает телят, откармливает их 1,5-2 месяца и затем продает с наценкой. Гулдаста запрашивает кредит для купли и продажи скота. За счет прибыли она планирует расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Guldasta is a married woman with four children. She is 45 years old. She lives in the Fayzabad region. Guldasta is a hardworking woman. She works along with her husband and provides for her family. 

Guldasta has worked with livestock breeding for two years already. She purchases bulls, fattens them for 1.5-2 months and then sells them with a margin. Guldasta requests a loan to purchase and resell livestock. With the income, she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase and resell cattle with an aim to expand her business

loans.name: Rustambek

texts.ru: Рустамбеку 32 года. У него жена и четверо детей. Он со своей семьей проживает в районе Дж.Руми. Рустамбек опытный дехканин. Он занимается земледелием более 9 лет и выращивает в основном хлопок и пшеницу. Чтобы получить богатый урожай, Рустамбек запрашивает кредит для приобретения минеральных удобрений. За счет прибыли с урожая хлопка и пшеницы он хочет улучшить финансовое положение семьи.
texts.en:
Rustambek is 32 years old.  He is married and has four children.  He lives with his family in the Rumy district of Tajikistan.  Rustambek is an experienced farmer: he has been involved in agriculture for more than nine years and mostly grows cotton and wheat.

In order to get a good harvest, he is requesting a loan to buy mineral fertilizers.  He intends to use the profits from his cotton and wheat harvest to improve the financial situation of his family.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers and to sow cotton and wheat.

loans.name: Ainur

texts.ru: Айнур 60 лет, вдова, воспитала 6 детей. Дети Айнур взрослые, она живет с сыном который помогает матери по хозяйству. У Айнур есть четырнадцатилетняя внучка.  В поисках источника финансирования для своей семьи, Айнура начала свой бизнес в животноводстве еще 1990 году в период развала СССР, использовав для этого стартовую сумму 10,000 сом (KGS). Успешно работая в сфере животноводства и полеводства добилась очень хороших результатов, Айнура также выращивает кормовые культуры, что позволяет ей обеспечивать кормами свой скот и иметь дополнительный доход от продажи кормов.Помимо кормовых на своём участке Айнур выращивает картофель. Айнур имеет 3,0 га земли и три голов КРС. Ежемесячно семья имеет до 15,000 KGS. Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айнура обратилась в компанию «Бай - Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян картофеля и кормовых. На прибыль от кредита Айнур планирует увеличить своё хозяйство. Айнур поделилась, что в будущем она планирует выдать обучить внучку.
texts.en:
Ainur is 60 years old and a widow. She has raised six children. Ainur's children are grown up, and she lives with her son who helps his mother in the household. Ainur has fourteen grandchildren. 

In search of a source of funding for her family, Ainur started her business of livestock breeding already in 1990, in the period of the collapse of the Soviet Union, after having used a starting sum of 10,000 som (KGS). Successfully working within the sphere of livestock breeding and field crop cultivation has given very good results. Ainur also grows fodder, which lets her provide fodder for her livestock and gives and additional income from the sale. Ainur grows potatoes on her field too, next to the fodder. She owns 3.0 hectares of land and three heads of cattle. The family has up to 15,000 som (KGS) per month. 

To further develop her business, Ainur turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of potato seeds and fodder seeds. Ainur plans to improve her business through the income from the loan. Ainur shared with us that she plans to give her grandchild an education.

loans.use: To purchase seeds for potatoes

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 60 years old and married with seven children. 

Angelina is in the agricultural business. She raises pigs in the Philippines. Angelina has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Angelina has been raising pigs for three years now. She has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Angelina would like to save enough money to provide financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en:
Abbas is a married Iraqi client, who is 36 years old and has two wives and two children. Abbas is the only provider in his family. 

Abbas owns a small internet café and he specializes in providing video games for his customers. He used to be employed in a shop which provided similar service, but he had a dream of establishing his own career. In 2011, Abbas successfully established his business and has gained good experience in this field. He is well-known in the surrounding area and has an excellent reputation.

Abbas is requesting a USD 2,000 loan which he will use to renovate his shop by installing a new floor and to buy some televisions and video games. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits, so he will be able to provide better living standards for his family.

loans.use: to renovate his shop by installing a new floor and to buy some televisions and video games.

loans.name: Mengnikul

texts.ru: Счастливый отец и любящий муж, кормилец семьи и хороший педагог Менгникул родился в отдалённом от города кишлаке. С  детство хотел стать учителем. Тогда с отцом ходил выгуливать овец и коров, он их подсчитывал, умножал и делил. Таким образом,  детские игры и считалки превратились в специальность. Менгникул смог воплотить свою мечту в реальность и стал учителем. Менгникул имеет 8 детей. В связи с тем, что он не смог прожить и прокормить свою семью одной  только заработной платой учителя, ему пришлось взяться за дело отца и приобрести коров, разводить их и получать дополнительный доход. Менгникул говорит, "если бы не это занятие и подходящее местность, мои дети и семья голодали и я бы не смог пережить это". Но к его большой удачи несколько лет тому назад он обратился за кредитом в МДО "Арванд" и используя кредит с умом и во благо смог выйти с "замкнутого круга" и дела потихонечку пошли на лад. Теперь Менгникул имеет несколько голов крупно рогатого скота. Он нуждается в дополнительных средствах, чтобы закупить корм и дополнительно одну корову. Его дети подросли,с года в год нужда в больших средствах увеличивается, ведь он хочет, чтобы его дети росли грамотными, поступили в ВУЗ после окончания школы  и у них было светлое будущее. С этими намерениями Менгникул и на этот раз обратился в МДО "Арванд" за кредитом для покупки корма для скота и коровы. Он очень надеется, что МДО "Арванд" и на этот раз помогут ему в трудную минуту и содействуют в осуществлении его планов. Он как педагог знает, что такое труд.  Менгникул также не забывает своих учеников и преподаёт им. Можно сказать, что Менгникул подаёт хороший пример своим ученикам и детям.
texts.en:
A happy father, loving husband, breadwinner and good teacher, Mengnikul was born in a remote town outside of Kishlak. Even during his childhood he wanted to become a teacher. At that time, he walked sheep and cows with his father. He counted, multiplied, and divided out the livestock. Hence, his childhood games and rhymes turned into a profession. Mengnikul was able to realize his dream and become a teacher. 

Mengnikul has eight children. He would not have been able to survive and provide for them with only a teacher's salary. So, he had to start raising cows for extra income. He says, "If it weren't for this occupation and the suitable location, my family would have starved and I would not have survived that." To his good fortune, he received a loan from MDO "Arvand" a few years ago. By using the loan wisely, he was able to escape the endless circle of problems and the matter gradually worked itself out. 

Mengnikul now has a few heads of cattle, but he needs one more cow and additional sources of income to purchase feed. His children have grown and as the years go by he needs to increase his income. He really wants his children to enroll in university after high school so that they will have a bright future. With such intentions in mind, Mengnikul again turned to MDO "Arvand" for a loan to purchase livestock. He hopes that MDO "Arvand" will help him again during a difficult moment so that he can realize his current plans. As a teacher, he knows what hard work means. Mengnikul never forgets about his students and teaches them well. You could say that he is a role model for his students and children.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Habibulo

texts.ru: Хабибулло молодой, активный и опытный пастух. Несмотря на свои годы, он уже смог создать свою маленькую ферму. У него около 25 овец и 7 коров. Хабибулло имеет 17 летний стаж в сфере животноводство. Он женат и имеет 5 детей. Занятие животноводством его основное дело. Его коровы и овцы дают не только молоко, но и «хлеб» для  его семьи. Хабибуло очень серьезно относится к своему делу. Большая  часть его  времени проходит на пастбище, где выводит  пасти своих овец. У него большие планы на будущее. Хочет построить дом, отправить сына в город учиться.. Но его финансовая возможность не позволяет дать жизнь его мыслям и воплощать планы. Тем более в прошлом году его постигла неудача. Из-за ливни и болезни часть его овец померли. Но Хабибуло взяв себя в руки, продолжил своё дело. Его жена очень помогала ему. Доила корову, продавала молоко и на заработанные деньги покупала продукты. Сейчас Хабибулло копит и экономит накопленные деньги. Отец пятерых детей старается, чтобы его дети и семья не нуждались и не голодали. Узнав об кредитовании Хабибулло захотел обратиться в МДО «Арванд». Он хочет получить кредит и пользуясь удобным моментом закупить корм и мелко рогатый скот. Хабибулло очень надеется, что  организации Арванд его поддержит и поможет в его восстановлении и от имени себя, детей и жены заранее  благодарит за содействие и понимание.
texts.en:
Habibulo is a young, active, and experienced shepherd. Despite his age, he has already managed to create his own small farm. He has about 25 sheep and seven cows. He has 17 years of experience in animal husbandry. He is married and has five children. Animal husbandry is his main source of income. His cows and sheep provide his family not only with milk, but also with their "daily bread". 

Habibulo takes his profession very seriously. He spends a large portion of his time in the pasture where he takes his sheep to graze. He has big plans for the future. He wants to build a home and send his son to the city to study. However, his financial circumstances don't allow him to bring his dreams and plans to fruition. 

Additionally, last year an unfortunate event occurred - some of his sheep died due to flooding and disease. Habibulo pulled himself together and continued on with his work. His wife helped him a lot. She milked the cow, sold the milk, and did the shopping with the income they earned. Now Habibulo is saving and being economical. As the father of five children, he tries to ensure that his family does not go hungry. 

Upon finding out about loans, Habibulo turned to MDO "Advand". He would like a loan to purchase livestock and livestock feed at the right moment. He hopes that Arvand will support and help him to recover from his loss. Habibulo, his children, and his wife thank you in advance for your help and understanding.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and livestock feed

loans.name: Anastasia

texts.en:
Anastasia, age 39, owns a kiosk business where she sells household items such as detergent, coffee, sugar, cigarettes, snacks, cooking oil, mosquito repellent, stationery, gasoline, and kerosene. She started the business in 1995, using her own capital in the amount of IDR 250,000.

Anastasia and her husband Elias, age 43, have been blessed with six children. Gaudensia, age 16, and Kristanis, age 14, are senior high school students. Ludgardis, age nine, and Maris, age seven, attend elementary school. Sisco, age six, and Prili, age four, are as yet too young to attend school.
  
Customer demand for more household items and the need to pay education fees for her children have led her to seek a loan in the amount of IDR 4,000,000 from TLM. 

She is optimistic that the loan from TLM will make a positive difference in her business.

loans.use: to buy such items as detergent, coffee, sugar, cigarettes, snacks, cooking oil, mosquito repellent, stationery, gasoline, and kerosene to offer for sale

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de Alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz, se dedica al flete de instrumentos musicales, parlantes, y otros para conjuntos musicales y tambien toca en una banda. 

Luis solicita el crédito para compra de un par de amplificadores para continuar con su negocio de flete de los mismos y de esta manera generar más ingresos para su familia.

El sueño de Luis es poder independizarse de la casa de sus padres y poder formar su propia orquesta musical.
texts.en:
Luis lives with his parents in La Paz’s Alto San Pedro area. He earns his living renting out musical instruments, speakers, etc. for musical groups, and he also plays in a band.

Luis is seeking a loan to buy a pair of amplifiers so he can continue to build his musical instrument rental business and earn more money for his family.

His dream is to be able to leave home and form his own orchestra.

loans.use: to buy amplifiers for his musical instrument rental business

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel has since employed a staff to manage electronic shop and has embarked on a farming business. 

He has used part of the business proceeds to prepare his piece of land and requested KES 50,000 from Kadet which will help him buy seedlings and fertilizers.

He hopes to diversify to animal rearing in the future.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a 34-year-old man from Kaimosi, Kenya. He is married to Eunice and they are blessed with two children aged three and five years old.

Stephen owns a retail shop where he sells small basic commodities. He was introduced to KADET LTD by group members, he repaid his previous loan and is applying for his second loan with KADET LTD which he will use to purchase more stock of sugar, sweets, and bread for his retail shop.

He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business and acquire a piece of land for tea growing. He has a dream of running a successful business and providing for his family.

loans.use: to increase his stock by purchasing sugar, soap, bread  and sweets.

loans.name: Mwende

texts.en:
Mwende is now 52 years old, still married and her children are still growing. She is still running her retail shop, which includes green grocery and other retail shop items, and her income has improved to about 10,000 Kenyan shillings per month. This amount is able to cater for her family’s needs, and she is happy about it.

She is taking a third loan and wants to use it to buy additional stock of fruits and vegetables for the shop. She hopes to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Franco

texts.en:
Franco has been in business for almost his entire life. He has been doing this business for the past 18 years and makes a monthly income of KES 39,500.

Now he is taking his seventh loan from KADET LTD. He will use it to add more stock of cooking oil, maize flour, packets of salt, and soft drinks to his inventory, to resell. He will use the anticipated profit to open up another outlet. 

His dream is to become a large-scale businessman and better provide for his family. 
,

loans.use: to add more stock of cooking oil, maize flour, packets of salt, and soft drinks to resell

loans.name: Mercy G.

texts.en:
Mercy lives in Sinkor in Montserrado County the area where there is the capital city of Liberia. It is well known as the commercial city of Liberia. She is 28 years old, married and has two children aged two and six who are in school. 

Since 1992 she has been running a table market where she sells rice, pepper, bitter ball, vita, and other items. She started this business with the help of her mother and learned this way of selling from her. She likes her business because it allows her to make profits and makes her popular.

She is requesting a loan to buy more pepper, bitter ball, rice, vita, and other items for her business. She wants to get more money to build her house and buy a car.

loans.use: to buy more pepper, bitter ball, rice, vita, and other items for her business.

loans.name: Haji

texts.en:
Haji runs small stall which sells groceries and mobile phone airtime credits. He is an entrepreneur who has two persons living in his house. He joined Ruma  six months ago because he feels secure about building his business with Ruma and is still really excited to expand his business selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments for customers. 

For the last three months, he has around $5/day sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business runs, he needs a loan for more working capital in order to be able to do transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is a 26-year-old a business lady. She is married to Peter. She has been selling secondhand clothes for the past two years with a monthly income of 5,000 KES, which she uses to support her family. She is applying for her first loan term with KADET LTD after being introduced by KADET staff. 

Everlyne will use the loan to buy secondhand shirts, trousers, blouses and skirts to sell. With the anticipated income from the business, she intends to reinvest it back into the business. 

Everlyne’s hopes and dreams are to expand her clothes selling business and improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to buy secondhand shirts, trousers, blouses and skirts

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a 33-year-old service provider dealing in calling cards from different service providers in Mwembe Tayari, Mombasa, Kenya. She is married and her husband earns additional income; together they support two people. She has been in this business for the last ten years with a good income.

This marks her first loan from KADET LTD, to purchase calling cards from different service providers to sell, and the anticipated profit is to be used in venturing into a second business and repaying the loan. 

She hopes to own a mobile phone services bureau in future.

loans.use: to purchase calling cards from different service providers

loans.name: One Word United Group

texts.en:
Idrissa is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Idrissa was born in Yele village, in northern Sierra Leone 28 years ago. She is married to a trader and the couple have 3 children, 2 of whom are attending primary schools. Idrissa sells used clothes and has been doing this type of work for 10 years now.

With the help of this loan, Idrissa and her group members will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Idrissa will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to buy a bale of used-clothes to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used-clothes to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Sorry For We Group

texts.en:
Sento is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Sento was born in Sanda Loko village, in northern Sierra Leone, 39 years ago. She is married to a trader and the couple has 5 children, 4 of whom are attending primary and secondary schools. For many years now, Sento has been selling market-food – palm-oil (the country’s most popular cooking oil), rice, pepper, onions, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), etc.

This is the first loan that Sento and her group members have applied for from SMT and Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Sento will use her share of the loan (SLL 1,200,000) to expand her business; she will buy palm-oil, rice, pepper, onions, margi, etc. at wholesale to add to her current inventory.

loans.use: to buy palm-oil, rice, pepper, onions, margi, etc. at wholesale to add to her current inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food products ( manioc/cassava, plantains, macabo tubers,  potatoes, yams.....)

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Reyna, de 57 años de edad, es una mujer muy alegre y amable. Está casada con Juan , quien es padre de sus 4 hijos.  Vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y su nieto a quien quiere brindarle una buena educación y calidad de vida. Reyna se dedica a la confección, cuenta con un pequeño taller el cual instalo en su casa , ahí hace trabajos por encargo o hace sus propios diseños y creaciones para poder satisfacer a sus clientes . 
Lleva haciendo este trabajo desde muy joven, siempre tuvo curiosidad  y  su madre le enseño todo lo que sabe razón por la cual decidio dedicarse a esta actividad .Considera rentable su negocio por las buenas ganancias que le deja.A ella le gusta  su trabajo, siempre está alegre ya que gana dinero haciendo lo que le gusta, además que siempre tiene clientes.Este es el crédito número 04 con MFP, por tanto espera contar con su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos, por otro lado se compromete a seguir siendo una socia puntual y cumplida con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado de 1600 soles, comprará materiales para continuar con su trabajo como telas, hilos, elásticos, entre otros, además comprará una maquina de coser.
texts.en:
Reyna is 57 years old and is very happy and friendly.  She is married to Juan, who is the father of her four children.  She lives in her own house with her husband and grandson, whom she wants to provide with a good upbringing and a good quality of life.  Reyna makes a living as a dressmaker.  She has her own workshop in her home and it is there that she does work on commission as well as making her own designs and creations to keep her customers satisfied.

She has been doing this work since she was very young as she was always curious about it.  Her mother taught her everything she knows and so she decided to make this work her career.  She thinks, given her good earnings, that her business is profitable.  Reyna likes her work.  She is always happy, always has clients and she is making a living doing something she enjoys.  This is her fourth loan with MFP so she hopes to count on collaboration to continue with her objectives.  At the same time, she promises to continue making her repayments on time.  With the 1600 Nuevo Soles she has applied for, she will buy materials for continuing with her work, such as material, thread, elastic and more.  In addition she will buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy dressmaking materials and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.en: Marcelo is a responsible father who is raising his family in a rural community. He is 37 years old and has three school-age children. He aims to educate his children and give them a better life. To do this, he prepares food and cooks and sells meats and snacks to people who live in his community. His goal is to make his business more profitable so that he can meet all of his family's needs. But due to insufficient capital, he is asking for loan of PHP 10,000 to buy ingredients such as meats, fish, vegetables and seasonings. Marcello is patent and determined, and believes that he can improve his business and his family's life in the future.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables and seasonings to cook and sell.

loans.name: Jonny Obied

texts.es:
Jonny tiene 27 años, es soltero, vive con su padre y hermanos en el municipio de la Másica.
Jonny hace seis años tiene una actividad que le genera los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento familiar, un taller de soldadura donde fabrica balcones, celocias, también fabrica y repara carrocería de camiones.comenta que tiene la experiencia necesaria para ofrecer este servicio en donde ya tiene sus propios clientes.
Actualmente solicita su tercer crédito de 23,000 lempiras, que lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de los balcones, celocias y las carrocería, teniendo el material necesario podrá dar a sus clientes una mejor atención.
su sueño es tener un local apropiado para el negocio y mejorar la calidad de vida personal y de su familia.
texts.en:
Jonny is 27 years old and single. He lives with his parents and siblings in the Masica municipality. For six years Jonny has had a business activity that generates the income needed for him to support his family.

He has a soldering workshop where he makes balconies for houses and latticework. He also manufactures and repairs bodywork on trucks.  He says that he has the needed experience to offer this service, where he already has his own customers.

He is now requesting his third loan for 23,000 lempiras.  He will use it to buy raw materials to make the balconies, latticework, and bodywork.  Having the necessary material, he will be able to give his customers better service.

His dream is to have a suitable place for his business.  He also dreams of improving the quality of his life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy raw material to make balconies, latticework, and bodywork.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher is a 50-year-old married man with four children who lives in Kasese, Uganda. For the last seven years, he has served as a police officer and also practiced farming. He was inspired to become a policeman by his desire for peace and he enjoys his service despite the low salary. He is a good father who wants to educate his children so they can get good jobs, and also wants to expand his farming activities. Christopher is requesting a loan to pay his children's school fees.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Samia

texts.en:
Samia is a married Iraqi client who is 52 years old and has two children. Together, Samia, her husband, and her two children provide the income of the family.

Samia owns a small farm and specializes in producing dairy products, like milk, cheese, and yoghurt. She established her business in 1995 and has gained good experience in this field. Samia is well-known in the surrounding area and has an excellent reputation.

Samia is requesting a USD 1,200 loan to buy a new cow. She is aiming to grow her business and increase her profits, so she will be able to provide her family with better life conditions.

loans.use: to buy a new cow for her farm.

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en: Jasmin is 48 years old, married and the mother of two children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, where she owns and operates a retail business in the local community. She has been in business for more than five and earns PHP 10,000 every month. She joined GDMPC in 2010, and is requesting a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy additional items to sell, including canned goods, eggs, sugar, and coffee. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by her business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, sugar and coffee.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is 39 years old, married and the mother of three children. She and her family live in Talibon, Bohol, where Erlinda earns a living by running a sari-sari or variety store where she sells various goods to people who live in her community. She is requesting a loan to buy additional items to sell to her customers, including canned goods, chips and biscuits, soda, rice, noodles, and toiletries. This loan will allow her to attract more customers and increase her business and her income. In the future, Erlinda hopes to expand her business and make it more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, such as canned goods, chips and biscuits, soda, rice, noodles, and toiletries

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: As the married mother of five children, Emma works hard to support her family. She provides computer services in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and by selling purified drinking water. She is requesting a loan for PHP 60,000 through NWTF to  buy computer supplies for her business. Emma has sustained her business activities with help from her five previous loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy computer supplies.

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon is a 41-year-old man who lives in Alcala with his wife and three children. To make a living, Solomon grows rice in his one-hectare rice field. He had been farming to supply his family's needs, especially his children's education, which was the only legacy he could pass on to them. 

Solomon aims to keep sustaining his crops, which is why he is now asking for additional capital of PHP 18,000 to buy pesticides and insecticides to use in farming. Someday, Solomon hopes to continue harvesting abundant crops for more income and to achieve economic stability.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and insecticides to use in farming

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en:
Abdallah is a 30-year-old married man and father of one child. He has been working in the transportation business since 2007 and he specializes in the transport of non-working cars. His business is going just fine but he needs to expand it.

Abdallah is applying for his third loan cycle from Kiva partner Al Majmoua. He is applying for a YOUTH LOAN in order to buy a new car that he plans to drive as a taxi during his free time. This will improve his living and increase his family's income.

Abdallah's previous loans helped him a lot in improving his business by enabling him to carry out necessary maintenance on his truck's crane, currently his only source of living. He is very anxious to have this new loan, because it will fulfill his dream of providing his family with their best living ever.

loans.use: To buy a new car that he needs to expand his business

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy is married, 37 years old, and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines where, for the last 11 years, she has earned a living by running a general store selling a variety of products such as shampoo, napkins, etc. Each month, she earns about PHP 10,000.

Juvy has requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to purchase additional products to sell such as canned goods, shampoo, soap, sugar, coffee and eggs. She has been a member of GDMPC since 2009, and her future goals are to build a house and pay for the future education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods, shampoo, soap, sugar, coffee and eggs.

loans.name: Clesi

texts.es: Clesi, de 53 años, es una mujer buena y amable, es viuda y tiene cinco hijos a quienes crió y educó hasta hacerlos personas de bien para la sociedad, ahora ella vive en su casa propia a lado de una de sus hijas con quien comparte muchos ideales y metas por cumplir. El trabajo de Clesi, consiste en la venta de golosinas, cada 2 días se dirige al mercado en busca de dulces, galletas, chupetines y demás golosinas que son solicitados en su negocio, tiene una pequeña vitrina en su casa en donde exhibe y ofrece sus diversos dulces que sirven para endulzar el día como ella menciona. Lleva 6 años en éste negocio el cual empezó a hacerlo debido a que su esposo falleció y debía tener algún ingreso económico con el cual solventar sus gastos, al transcurrir el tiempo se estableció económicamente y ahora está viendo que su actividad esta progresando.Le gusta su trabajo por que es muy relajante para ella, ya que puede conversar con las personas y debido a que sus clientes preferidos son los niños puede jugar y divertirse con ellos, espera seguir trabajando ya que desea seguir juntando su dinero para que más adelante pueda establecer una tienda de golosinas más grande.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2000 soles y está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá más segura de avanzar con su trabajo, asimismo se compromete a cumplir de manera puntual con el pago de sus cuotas .Con el monto solicitado comprará golosinas y más productos que ofrecerá a sus clientes, además comenzará a vender bebidas ya que esta segura que servira como una fuente extra de ingresos favorables para su economía.
texts.en: Clesi is 53 years old and is a good and friendly woman.  She is a widow with five children whom she raised and educated to be useful members of society.  She now lives in her own house beside one of her daughters who shares with her many aims and ideals.  Clesi's work consists in selling sweets and every two days she heads to the market to look for sweets, lollipops, biscuits and other popular sweet things for her business.  She has a small display case in her house where she shows off and sells her various goods to sweeten the the day.  She has had the business for some six years, having started it because her husband died and she needed some sort of income to cover costs.  As time went on, she became financially stable and now she is seeing her business progressing.  She likes her work because it is very relaxing for her as she can talk to people and because she can play and have fun with the children, her favourite customers.  She hopes to continue working as she would like to continue saving money so that one day she can have a bigger sweet shop.  On this occasion she is applying for a loan of 2000 Nuevo Soles and she is very happy to know that she has financial support as she will feel safer as she advances with her business.  Clesi promises to make her repayments on time.  With the loan she will buy sweets and other products to sell to customers.  In addition she will begin to sell drinks as she is sure that this will serve as an extra source of income for the family economy.

loans.use: to buy sweets and soft drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stock of pay-as-you-go solar products

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
Estela, de 63 años, es viuda y madre de seis hijos los cuales ya son independientes , actualmente ella  vive cómodamente en una casa que compro con el fruto de su esfuerzo y dedicación.
El trabajo de Estela consiste en la confección de prendas intimas (lencería), ropa para niños, además tambien se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogos, esta actividad la realiza desde su casa , normalmente  lo hace sola pero cuando tiene mucho trabajo pide la ayuda de otra persona para que le facilite el trabajo.
Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que dispone de tiempo además de mencionar que le encanta lo que hace ya que creció en este trabajo, además siente que es muy rentable ya que siempre tiene clientes y es proveedora de algunas tiendas de la ciudad, por ahora espera poder seguir creciendo en su actividad económica y desea tener un local propio para asi brindar una mejor atención a los clientes.Este es el tercer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe razón por la cual se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual .En esta oportunidad solicita 500 nuevos soles para poder comprar hilos,  blondas, telas al por mayor para asi obtener una mejor ganancia.
texts.en:
Estela is sixty-three years old, is a widow, and is the mother of six children, all of whom are now independent.  Presently, she lives comfortably in a house that she bought with the fruit of her effort and dedication.

Estela's work consists of sewing lingerie items and children's clothing.  She also makes a living in selling products through catalogs.  She does this from her home.  Normally, she works alone, but when she has a lot of work, she asks another person for help in order to make the work easier.

The thing she likes about her work is her available time.  She also says that she loves what she does, since she has grown up doing this work.  She feels that this work is very profitable; she always has clients and she is a supplier to a few stores in the city.  For the moment, she hopes to be able to continue growing in her economic activity and she wishes to have her own shop in order to offer better attention to her customers.

This is her third loan with Kiva, and she is thankful for the financial support that she receives.  Therefore, she promises to make her payments in a punctual manner.  

In this opportunity, she is requesting 500 soles in order to buy thread, lace trim, and fabrics wholesale in order to make a better profit.

loans.use: to buy fabrics wholesale and other sewing materials.

loans.name: Herbert

texts.en:
Herbert is married and has two children.  He is a fisherman from Talibon, Bohol, which he has been doing for more than 10 years.
 
Herbert is requesting a loan, which he will use to buy materials, such as wood, cement, and nails, for the renovation of his house.  In the future, Herbert hopes to improve his fishing business and to save money for the education of his children and repayment of his loan.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the renovation of his house.

loans.name: Tara

texts.en:
Tara  is a 22 year old university student in his 8th semester living in Pontianak, West Kalimantan, Indonesia. He is pursuing a degree in information technology and pays for his studies by selling Nazava water filters. This Kiva loan will help Tara to get enough stock to sell Nazava Water filters to 4 different districts in the state of West Kalimantan. 
Many rural villagers in West Kalimantan have the financial means to buy low cost Nazava filters but lack sufficient access to them. Tara will be setting up demonstrations on rural markets in multiple villages to raise product awareness and sell the water filters. A Kiva loan for Tara truly means a win-win situation for Tara and the communities that buy them: Villagers get clean, affordable drinking water, and Tara makes enough money to continue his university studies.

loans.use: to expand water filter sales and increase the access to safe and affordable drinking water in four districts on West Kalimantan, Indonesia.

loans.name: Eva Maria

texts.es: Eva María, está casada, tiene la edad de 24 años y vive con su esposo y 4 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. Ella con el crédito pretende comprar los materiales para la construcción de un agregado y terminar una parte de su casa. Ella quiere darle a su casa uno de los últimos acabados y así poder brindarle a sus pertenecías mayor seguridad con la casa más cerrada. Ella también piensa en sus hijos y por lo cual es que opto por sacar el crédito, quiere que sus hijos tengan un ambiente seguro y un hogar con comodidades para su bienestar. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Eva María is a 24-year old married woman and lives with her husband and their four children, who are her biggest priority. She's requesting a loan to buy construction materials to build an annex and finish part of her house. She wants to give a finishing touch to it and have it more protected and secured. She's also requesting the loan thinking about her children, as she wants them to live in a safe environment and a comfortable home. 

This is her first loan with FUDECOSUR. She hasn't had any loans with national banks in the past, but FUDECOSUR has offered better conditions and much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds, and agricultural technologies to increase maize yields

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds, and agricultural technologies to increase maize yields

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en: Elvira is 47 years old, married, and has four children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. To earn a living, she owns and operates a business raising pigs, which she sells in the local community. She has had her business for more than five years and earns 10,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2009, and now she has requested a loan of 12,500 PHP to purchase feed for her pigs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed for pigs

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: La Sra. Isabel sigue con la misma actividad de la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su tienda de barrio, tambien se dedica   a la venta de ropa,  cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la construcción de su tienda ya que la amplio,  en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería como abarrotes por mayor y ropa ya que incremento sus ventas y desea surtir su tienda, se siente feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le dan para crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Isabel continues in the same line of work, selling basic necessity products and clothing from her neighborhood store.  She did very well with her previous loan since the money was used to pay the construction costs of expanding her store.  

On this occasion, she is requesting a loan in order to buy merchandise, such as grocery in bulk and clothing, because she wants to restock her store and increase her sales.  She is happy and appreciative of the opportunity given to her so that she can grow her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for restocking her store.

loans.name: Los Del Huaycho Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento  LOS DEL HUAYCHO Está compuesto por ocho integrantes, seis mujeres y dos varones, el Presidente del banco es el Sr. Fredy tiene 31 años tiene dos hijos, el se dedica al servicio de transporte público, el se dedica a esta actividad hace ya varios años, este préstamo es su primera  secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Fredy  utilizara este préstamo para el mantenimiento de su movilidad, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es falta de capital para el arreglo de su movilidad ya que está presentando algunas fallas y esto no le permite realizar un buen trabajo, el Sr. Fredy se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado a él y a sus compañeras de grupo ya que en muchos caso son personas que sacan adelante solas a sus familias.
texts.en:
Los del Huayacho Communal Bank is made up of eight members, six women and two men.  The president of the bank is Fredy, 31.  He has two children and makes a living in public transportation, work he has done for several years.

This is Fredy's first loan with the institution; he'll use it to maintain his vehicle.  He's requesting the loan because he lacks the capital to fix his vehicle, which has a few defects that keep him from doing a good job.

Fredy's happy and grateful to the institution for the help for him and his fellow group members because in many cases they're people who get their families ahead alone.

loans.use: maintain his vehicle

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a dry goods business in the Philippines. She is requesting her ninth loan from NWTF for 20000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more dry goods to sell.  NWTF is re-listing Erlinda's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more dry goods to sell.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: Rocío, de 44 años, es una mujer muy responsable y trabajadora , es madre de 2 menores hijas con quienes vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo con quien lleva varios años de casada.Rocío se dedica a la venta de  golosinas y postres en la puerta de su hogar ,además ella tiene varios cuartos en su hogar los cuales alquila para tener un ingreso más a su económia familiar.  Lleva en el negocio de los postres más de 10 años y lo hace con ayuda de sus hijas, aunque por el momento la ventano realiza la venta de dulces y raspadillas de manera seguida, pues el clima en la zona está muy cambiante y eso no le permite completar exitosamente su venta, pero como es una mujer de negocios ya está viendo la manera de poder generar ganancias con otro tipo de inversión.Lo que mas le gusta de su trabajo es que le da buenos ingresos, además de poder estar en su casa con sus hijas, espera mas adelante mejorar las condiciones de su casa para así alquilar los cuartos a un buen precio.Este es el préstamo número 05 con Kiva, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que le permitirá estar tranquila y avanzar con sus planes de su negocio, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.Con el monto solicitado de 500 soles, comprará materiales para construcción ya que comenzará con la ampliación de sus cuartos y mejorará las condiciones de los mismos, para brindar un mejor servicio a sus inquilinos.
texts.en: Rocío, 44 years old, is a very responsible and hardworking woman. She is a mother of 2 young daughters with whom she lives in her own house together with her husband of many years. Rocío sells candy and pastries for a living from the door of her home. Additionally she has various rooms in her home which she rents to have more income. She has been in the pastry business for more than 10 years and does it with the help of her children. The window works for the sale of sweets, which was followed by snow cones, but the climate in the zone is very changing and that does not help for the successful completion of sales. As a business woman she is already seeing the way of being able to generate income with another type of investment. What she likes about her job is that it provides good income and she is able to be at home with her children. She hopes to move forward with improving the conditions of her home to rent rooms at a good price. This is her 5th Kiva loan. She is very happy to know that she has financial help that will allow her to be calm and advance with her business plans. Additionally she promises to make her payments in a punctual manner. With the amount requested, 500 soles, she will buy construction materials so that she can begin with the expansion of her rooms and to improve the condition of them, to provide a better service to her renters.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en:
Abbas is an Iraqi youth client. He is 24 years old, single, and lives with his parents. Abbas is the only provider for his family.

Abbas owns a small shop and sells clothes for children. He buys various types of clothes from wholesalers and sells them in his neighborhood with affordable prices that help encourage citizens to buy clothes regardless of the economic difficulties in the area. He established his business in 2009 and gained good experience in what he does. Abbas is well-known in the area and has an excellent reputation.

Abbas is requesting a 2,400 USD youth loan, which he will use to pay the annual rent for his shop. His goal for the future is to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his shop

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.en:
Lorenza is married and from Talibon, Bohol. She and her husband have a fishing business, which they have been doing for several years. 

Lorenza is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy additional fishing nets, lead weights, and floaters. With this loan, her husband will be able to improve his catch, giving them more fish to sell in the market.  In the future, Lorenza hopes to make their fishing business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, lead weights, and floaters.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr: Jeanne est une mère de famille agée de 49 ans qui vend des vivres secs dans un quartier de la place depuis plus de 20 ans.elle nous sollicite actuellement pour un credit qui lui permettra d'augmenter son stock de marchandises et de livrer son pistache à plusieurs clients.les bénéfices obtenus seront reinvesti dans son activité et serviront à améliorer ses conditions de vie.
texts.en: Jeanne is a 49-year-old mother. She has been selling dried foods in a local district for over 20 years. She is currently requesting a loan which will enable her to increase her inventory of merchandise and to deliver pistachios to several customers. The profits earned will be reinvested in her business and used to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy merchandise including dried foods, groundnuts and pistachios.

loans.name: Ma Famille Group

texts.fr:
Mme BOUSSIRATOU  est la responsable du groupe MA FAMILLE. Elle est célibataire  sans  enfant et  elle n’a  personne  à sa charge.

Mme vend des mèches  et des sacs à main depuis 15ans elle fait aussi la coiffure. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de secteur 10 en ville. Ses clients sont ses voisins  et les clientes qui viennent de partout.

Mme veut  s’acheter  20 paquets de mèche  et 30 sacs à main.

Elle veut épargner ses bénéfices afin de construire une maison d’habitation. Mme ambitionne  ouvrir sa propre boutique et voyager à Lomé pour acheter en gros.
texts.en: Boussiratou is the leader of the "Ma Famille" group. She is single and has no children or other dependents. She has been selling hair extensions and handbags for 15 years and is also a hairdresser. She gets her supplies at the Sector 10 market in town.
