Her customers are neighbours and people who come from all around. She would like to buy 20 packets of hair extensions and 30 handbags. She wants to save her profits so that she can build a home. She aims to open her own shop and to travel to Lomé to buy wholesale.

loans.use: to buy 20 packets of hair extensions and 30 handbags.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: 3.9.248.07.thiệu Dương Group

texts.en:
Thảo works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby livestock cattle to raise and sell in the future.

Thảo is 59 years old and she is married, with three children. She is the group leader of the 3.9.248.07.Thiệu Dương solidarity group, which consists of three members. Her children are grown up, so Thảo supports no dependents with her business in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Thảo joined the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women to improve her business. Thảo has successfully repaid three loans from the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women. 

Thảo has been involved in this business for more than ten years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

In the future, Thảo hopes to buy land of her own, to maintain a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock cattle to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Halim Cwg Group

texts.en: Elise, 31 years old, is married to Crisjayadi. They have been blessed with two children: one is in elementary school and the other is a toddler. She also has additional dependents, her parents who live with her family. Elise has a business selling electronic minutes and vouchers, and electronic goods. Elise has been operating this business for four years and is requesting her seventh loan from VisionFund Indonesia. She runs her business from her home. Sometimes she gets orders from her husband's officemates also. She earns 300,000 – 400,000 IDR every month. She already has 20 customers. Elise will use this loan to buy minutes and vouchers, which she buys every two weeks. She will also use 2,000,000 IDR to buy electronic goods.

loans.use: to buy minutes and vouchers, as well as electronic goods

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a 36-year-old married father of two. His children are six and three years respectively. He is an industrious gentleman who rears poultry to earn a living while his wife makes some additional income from milk sales. 

Julius has been in the poultry business for the last two years earning a monthly income of 13,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES). He learned about KADET LTD from a group of women in his area who are registered members. 

Julius has acquired his first loan of 10,000 KES which will assist him in the purchase of chicken feed. He plans to use the anticipated proceed to enlarge the chicken house. His dream is to grow the business to a large-scale commercial venture.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed.

loans.name: Eddy Alfredo

texts.es: Eddy de 57 años, casado, padre de un hijo. Vive en el departamento de Chinandega en un barrio de éste ubicado en el occidente del país, es un hombre trabajador, responsable, honrado y que da todo lo que puede pensando en el futuro de su familia, él tiene 31 años de  haber iniciado un taller de soldadura con mucho esfuerzo,  empezó a trabajar como ayudante de taller pero como todo persona emprendedora decidió ser su propio jefe y poner un taller negocio que al principio costo esfuerzo, dedicación y sacrificios, su único hijo estudia en la universidad donde él le da su apoyo incondicional para que el tengo un muy buen futuro y sea un profesional. Eddy solicita este crédito para invertir en su negocio (comprar equipos de soldadura, mesas de trabajos, hierro entre otros) y mejorar sus ingresos y así poder seguir ayudando a su hijo para que logre coronar su carrera y ser un verdadero profesional. Eddy está agradecido con los inversionistas Kiva ya que ha podido mejorar y agrandar su negocio.as ya que ha podido mejorar y agrandar su negocio.
texts.en:
Eddy is a 57-year old man who is married and has a son. He lives in the department of Chinandega in a neighborhood located on the west side of the country. He's a hard-working, responsible and honest man who gives everything in his power for his family's future, and has worked in a welding garage for 31 years. He started to work as an assistant but, following his entrepreneurial spirit, decided to become his own boss and started his business with a lot of effort, dedication and sacrifice. His only child attends university and receives his unconditional support so that he'll have a good future and become a good professional. 

Eddy is requesting a loan to invest in his business (purchase of welding machinery, working tables and iron, among others) and improve his income, so that he'll be able to keep helping his son to finish his degree and become a real professional. Eddy is grateful to Kiva lenders for allowing him to improve and grow his business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for his garage, such as iron, wires and grease, among others.

loans.name: 3.9.247.14.04.thiệu Dương Group

texts.en:
Dung is the group leader of the 3.9.247.14.04.Thiệu Dương solidarity group, which consists of three members. She is 21 years old and is married with two children. Dung  works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby cattle livestock to raise and sell in the future. She supports two dependents with her business in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Dung has been involved in this business for three years. One of her most critical business difficulties is the lack of capital.

In 2010, Dung  joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Dung  hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to maintain a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Kafi

texts.en:
Kafi is a married Iraqi client who is 33 years old and has two children. Kafi and her husband assist each other in providing the income for the family. Kafi works from her own house and specializes in tailoring women's outfits. She has been practicing tailoring since her childhood. Due to the harsh economical conditions in the area, Kafi established her own small business in 2001, in order to provide extra income for her family. Kafi is well known in the surrounding area and has an excellent reputation.

Kafi is requesting a loan of $2,400, which she will use to buy a motor generator and two new tailoring machines. She is aiming to grow her business and increase her profits so she will be able to provide her children better living standards.

loans.use: to buy a motor generator and two new tailoring machines.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy buffalo for her family's livestock business.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a 47-year-old married man and the father of four children. He has been working in satellite and internet business for fifteen years. He was an employee in the electricity company, but his family's increasing needs forced him to think of a business that could improve his living and increase his income.

Omar is a hard worker who is well known in his region. He is applying for his first loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to buy new satellite needs in addition to Internet connection hardware.

Omar is planning to expand his working region, to cover as many customers as he can in a well managed way, and to provide high technical service support to keep his customers pleased and satisfied.

loans.use: to buy new satellite needs in addition to Internet connection hardware

loans.name: Dúo Mariposas De Magdalenas Group

texts.es:
Dúo mariposas de magdalena
Este dúo está conformado por doña Marta Julia, ella tiene 49 años de edad, y tiene un hijo a su cargo, ella se dedica a la venta de regalos, para boda , 15 años, bautizos, así como venta de calzado para dama, y niños, de la misma manera venta de ropa como blusas, pantalones, playeras camisas. ella esta solicitando el crédito para la compra de ollas, calzado y regalos, su propósito es seguir creciendo el negocio, ya que desde que enviudo trabaja fuertemente para sacar adelante a su familia y ella dice que sigue trabajando fuerte, porque aún tiene la responsabilidad con su hijo, porque sus hijas ya se casaron, espera que le puedan brindar ese apoyo que ella nececita para salir adelante.
texts.en: This duo includes Marta Julia.  She is 49 years old, has a son, and sells girts for weddings, 15th birthday celebrations, and also women’s and children’s shoes and clothing such as blouses, pants, and pullover shirts. She is asking for this loan in order to buy pots, shoes, and gifts to continue growing her business.  She has been working hard since she widowed and wants to get her family ahead because she has a responsibility to her son.  Her daughters are fully grown and she hopes to receive the support this needs to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena is a merchant from San Jose, Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. She is a married woman and is engaged in the charcoal-selling business. She also runs a sari-sari or variety store that sells various goods to the people in her area.

Lucena is asking for a loan to buy more wood for making charcoal and additional stock for her store, like rice, dry goods, soda, soap, shampoo, and other toiletries. With this, she will be able to attract more buyers and customers in her store. She can also sell more charcoal to the market.

loans.use: to buy more wood for making charcoal and additional stock for the store, like rice, dry goods, soda, soap, shampoo, and other toiletries.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 57 years old and married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Judith has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more items like rice, canned goods, noodles, soft drinks and other groceries.

Judith has been in this business for 22 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like rice, canned goods, noodles, soft drinks and other groceries.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a 39-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. They live in Getafe, Bohol, Philippines. Lydia has been engaged in the retail business for more than ten years now. She sells various goods and household items to the people in her area.

Lydia is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell, like kitchenware, baskets, and other items. With this, she will be able to sell more to the people in her area, thus augmenting her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like wares, kitchenware, baskets, etc.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 33 years old, married, and has three children who are all in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Melanie has a shoe repair business in the Philippines. Melanie requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase materials needed for her shoe repair business.

Melanie has been in this business for four years. In the future, Melanie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed for her shoe repair business.

loans.name: Levan

texts.en:
Levan is 42 years old. He is married and lives with his wife in Bolnisi District. Levan has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for his family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected every time because of his low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

The main source of income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have a plot of agricultural land, where haricot beans and potatoes are grown. Besides that, Levan works as an artisan in the wood workshop and gets small monthly income. It is hardly enough to feed for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the 'subsistence poor' category. 

Levan requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. His loan request was approved as one from a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan programme envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products as they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” due to their low income. 

With the received credit, Levan plans to open his own workshop, where he will prepare different kinds of wooden furniture. To open a new workshop will enable him to get more orders and increase his sales of wood products. This will increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of Levan's family.

loans.use: to open a wood workshop and prepare different kinds of wooden furniture.

loans.name: Cristian

texts.es: Cristian, es un hombre de 22 años, muy jovial y con el ímpetu que caracteriza a los jóvenes emprendedores, es soltero y no tiene hijos, actualmente vive en la casa de sus padres y día a día se esfuerza para salir adelante. Cristian se dedica es al transporte público de personas por la ciudad ya que cuenta con un mototaxi por esta razón trabaja según sus horas programadas. Recorre todas las calles de la ciudad en busca de pasajeros que requieran ser trasladados a algún lugar en específico y el se encarga de que lleguen a su destino sin ningún inconveniente. Tiene su mototaxi desde hace 8 años, y desde esa fecha viene desempeñando esa actividad y por su gran habilidad para convencer a los pasajeros consigue buenas ganancias durante toda su jornada de trabajo y asi obtener el dinero necesario para los gastos familiares.Sin embargo, ahora tiene la necesidad de empezar a estudiar una carrera tecnica, es por eso que desea comprar otro mototaxi para alquilarlo y de esta forma asegurar otro ingreso económico que le permita sobrellevar sus futuros gastos académicos, por lo pronto desea refaccionar su mototaxi y con el dinero que obtiene de ello ir ahorrando para comprarse otro vehículo de trabajo y continuar en su lucha por el progreso de su familia.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000 soles para la compra de llantas nuevas , remodelar el tapizado y algunas otras piezas de su mototaxi a su vez se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera responsable y esta muy contento por el apoyo que le están brindando para multiplicar su inversión.
texts.en:
Cristian is a 22-year-old man, is very friendly and has the vigor that identifies enterprising young people.  He is single and without children.  He currently lives in his parents' home and he strives to get ahead every day.

Christian works in public transportation, taking people throughout the city.  He has a motorcycle taxi and for this reason works according to scheduled hours.  He traverses all the city streets looking for passengers that need to be taken somewhere specific.  He makes sure that they arrive at their destination without inconvenience.

He has had his taxi for 8 years and since then he has been carrying out this work.  Due to his great ability to convince passengers to ride with him, he has gotten good profits during his whole work journey and in this way obtains what he needs to cover the family expenses.

However, he now has the need to begin studying a technical career.  For this reason, he wants to buy another mototaxi to rent.  In this way, he can secure another form of income that will allow him to handle his future school expenses.  For now, he wants to repair his taxi and use the money he gets to save up to buy another work vehicle.  In this way, he will continue in his struggle to help his family progress.

In this occasion, he is asking for 1,000 sols (US$400) to buy new tires, redo the upholstery, and buy a few other mototaxi parts.  In turn, he promises to make his payments in a responsible way.  He is very glad for the support that is being offered to him so he can increase his investments.

loans.use: buy parts for his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Shiseso Sokoni Group

texts.en:
Peter’s group has ten farmers and is located in the Kakamega South District of Kenya. Peter is pictured on the far right of the Shiseso Sokoni Group wearing a white shirt. He is pictured among the six men and four women of his group. Peter will receive loans for farm inputs capable of planting half an acre with sorghum, millet, and maize. Peter first enrolled with the One Acre Fund during the 2009 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Peter joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and the best input prices. 

Peter reports that before One Acre Fund, he was able to grow about 2.5 bags of maize per acre, but with his One Acre Fund input loan during Long Rains 2012, he harvested 24 bags per acre! He hopes that his profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send his children to school and save for the future. Peter’s group members will each receive input loans for half an acre during the 2013 Long Rains season. In total they will receive inputs for five acres of maize and sorghum.

The field officer is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Niña

texts.en: Niña is 48 years old and married with one child. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She owns and operates a pedicab to earn a living. She has been with her business for over five years and earns 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) every month. She joined GDMPC in 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase a new tire and repair for her pedicab. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a new tire and repair for her pedicab.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a 41-year-old married woman and a mother of six, from Talibon, Bohol. She has been engaged in the hog raising business for almost ten years now. Marilou is asking for a loan to buy feed for her pigs.

In the future, Marilou hopes to make her business a success and to make it sustainable.  Furthermore, Marilou hopes to expand her business and save money for the future schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Mouna

texts.en:
Mouna, who is 36 years old, is Iraqi and is married with three children. Mouna and her husband provide the family income together.

Mouna owns a beauty salon and provides various services for her clients like hair-cuts and make-overs. After gaining enough experience in this field, which exceeds fifteen years, Mouna established her own business in 2009, which started to grow fast and has gained a good reputation in her surrounding area.

Mouna is requesting a loan of $2,700. She will use this loan to pay the annual rent of her beauty salon so it may continue to grow and so she will be able to provide her children with a good education and better living standards.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent of her beauty salon.

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
Haydar, who is 23 years old, is an Iraqi youth client who is married and has a single child. He is the only provider in the family.

Haydar owns a small shop selling mobile phones and their accessories. In his shop, he has a wide collection of all known mobiles in the market and also all their accessories, like headsets and covers. He also provides services like downloading music and ringtones as well as selling charging cards. He established his business in 2006, and since then, he has been well known in the market and has gained a good reputation.

Haydar is requesting a $3,000 youth loan. This loan will be used to pay the annual rent of his shop. Haydar aims to grow his business and increase his assets so he may provide more services and make more income so he will be able to provide his family a better standard of living.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent of his shop

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 40 años, es una mujer honesta y trabajadora, esta casada y tiene un hijo de 10 años con quienes vive en la casa propia que edificó con ayuda de su esposo .Rosa tiene como actividad de negocio la venta de bebidas energizantes y gaseosas por esta razón tiene una refrigeradora y una congeladora que es utilizada desde muy temprano para que las bebidas se encuentren en  su punto ideal de congelación . Realiza la venta directa a personas mayores de edad. Trabaja en esta actividad generalmente por las tardes, durante las mañanas recibe el apoyo de su cuñada o su hijo en la atención mientras ella trabaja brindando servicio de lavandería en un conocido hospedaje de la ciudad. Lleva en esta actividad más de 10 años y la rentabilidad que le brinda le ha servido para obtener algunas cosas materiales que siempre anheló además de que le ha permitido hasta ahora solventar los gastos básicos de su hogar colaborando de esta forma con su esposo.  Le gusta su trabajo ya que tiene tiempo a su disposición para desarrollar cómodamente otras actividades en su hogar. Tiene muchos planes a futuro pero por el momento le gustaría agrandar su negocio en su hogar y acondicionarlo para recepcionar y atender de manera más cómoda a sus clientes.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 3000 soles , por tanto agradece la oportunidad y confianza que ponen en ella para recibir éste financiamiento, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual . Con el monto solicitado comprará más gaseosas y bebidas energizantes para continuar con sus ventas.
texts.en:
Rosa, 40 years old, is an honest and hard-working woman.  She is married and has a 10-year old son.  They live in their own house, which she built with her husband's help.  

Rosa has as her business activity the sale of energy drinks and sodas.  This is why she has a refrigerator and a freezer, which is used from very early so that the drinks reach their ideal chilling point. 

She sells directly to elderly people, and she generally works in the afternoons.  During the mornings, she gets help from her sister-in-law or her son in attending to customers, while she works washing clothes in a well-known inn in the city.

She has been in this business for more than 10 years, and the profits she has earned have helped her acquire some material things she has always wanted in addition to allowing her to cover basic household expenses in collaboration with her husband.

She likes her work, since she has time available to comfortably carry out other activities at home.  She has many future plans, but for the moment, she would like to expand her home business and set it up in order to receive and serve her customers more comfortably.

In this instance, she will apply for 3000 soles.  She appreciates the opportunity and trust that is being placed in her to receive this financing.  On the other side, she is committed to making her payments on time.  With the requested amount, she will buy more sodas and energy drinks in order to continue with her sales.

loans.use: to buy sodas and energy drinks.

loans.name: Evelyn Nohemi

texts.es: Evelyn tiene 31 años de edad, ella es madre de 3 niñas las cuales aun se encuetran estudiando, Evelyn tiene grandes sueños y metas por los que con mucho esfuerzo y dedicacion a salido adelante con su esposo, ella tiene un sueño grande a corto plazo y es el de poder abastecer aun mas su aceitera ella se dedica a atender de tiempo completo a atender su negocio y tambien al cuidado de sus hijas, el credito lo esta solicitando para la compra de mas mercaderia en aceites para automoviles y asi poder seguir con su negocio.
texts.en:
Evelyn is thirty-one years old and is the mother of three daughters, all of whom are still studying.  Evelyn has big dreams and goals, and with a lot of effort and dedication, she has moved forward with her husband.  She has a big short-term dream, and that is to be able to supply more merchandise to her oil supply business.  

She dedicates herself to attending her business full-time, and also to taking care of her daughters.  The loan that she is requesting is to buy more car oil merchandise.  In doing this, she will be able to continue with her business.

loans.use: to buy car oil.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Alma successfully paid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Alma's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Jonelyn

texts.en: Jonelyn is a responsible housewife who supports her husband in managing their rice farming business to ensure a high production. She and her husband aim to increase their rice production and income to satisfy their necessities and support the education of their child. For this reason, she is asking for additional capital of PHP 6,000 to buy fertilizers and herbicides needed to sustain their rice production. She is hoping that this loan will help them improve their farming business and increase their production this coming harvest season.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides needed to sustain their rice production

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 49-year-old carpenter. He is married and a father of two school-going children. He has been running his carpentry business for the past ten years successfully. Daniel earns a monthly income of KES 25,000 which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his first business loan from KADET LTD to finance his business. He will use the loan to purchase timber which he will use to make chairs and beds for sell. 

He anticipates profit from the sales, which he will use to educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to have an established carpentry business.

loans.use: to purchase timber which he will use to make chairs.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Concepcion requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy a fishing net and other equipment.

She has been in this business for six years.

In the future, Concepcion  would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net and other equipment.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 63 years old and is married with five children. She is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. For the past six years, she has run a retail store where she sells personal products in the local community. She earns 15,000 PHP each month. 

Lourdes joined GDMPC in 2006 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lourdes is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan to purchase new items to expand her product offering. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with her loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth, 43 years old, is married to a farmer and they were blessed with three children. They are currently residing in the village of Marabulig 1. She has managed a piggery business for almost 15 years and she earns a net income of PHP 9,000 when she sells one hog. She would like to avail herself of a loan amounting to PHP 15,000 to purchase hogs to raise. She's hoping that her loan will be granted to sustain the needs of her pigs and to have a profitable business someday.

loans.use: To purchase hogs to raise

loans.name: Celestina

texts.es:
La señora Celestina tiene una tienda de barrio en su domicilio, su nivel de educación es  secundaria, vive en casa propia ocupando 3  habitaciones en un acabado fino  y piso de machimbre. Ella vive en la zona de Pasanakeri de la ciudad de La Paz y tiene cuatro hijos y está casada.
Celestina atiende su tienda más de  8 horas al día, para cubrir sus gastos de alimentación, luz, agua, educación de sus hijos y otros.

El crédito lo requiere para la compra de cemento, arena, estuco, para refacción de un baño y paredes de su vivienda y así mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y sus hijos.

El sueño de Celestina es terminar de construir su casa.

Es la décima vez que solicita un crédito con IMPRO y la primera con Kiva.
texts.en:
Celestina has a neighborhood store in her home. Her level of education is high school. She lives in her own house made up of 3 finished rooms and panel flooring. She lives in the Pasanakeri zone in the city of La Paz and has 4 children and is married. Celestina tends to her store more than 8 hours a day to cover her expenses of food, light, water, education and education of her children and others.

The loan she is requesting is to purchase cement, sand, and plaster to renovate her bathroom and the walls of her house and therefore improve the quality of life for herself and her children.

Celestina's dream is to finish the construction on her house. This is her 10th loan she is requesting from IMPRO and her first loan with Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, and plaster to rennovate the bathroom and walls of her home.

loans.name: Alma Ligia

texts.es:
La Señora Alma Ligia es madre de 4 hijos,  posee un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa de diferentes tipos y estilos en el departamento de León desde hace 8 años siendo este negocio el sustento de su familia.

la demanda ha aumentado por aproximarse el ingreso de clases,  y para aprovechar la venta  está solicitando un crédito para la compra de  uniformes escolares y ropa interior de diferentes estilos y así satisfacer la necesidad de su clientela.

Este trabajo lo realiza para aumentar sus ingresos y así mejorar el nivel de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Alma Ligia is the mother of four children.  She has a small business in selling different types and styles of clothing in the department of León.  She has been doing this for eight years, feeling that this business sustains her family.  

The demand has grown since classes are going to be starting up again soon.  In order to take advantage of this, she is requesting a loan to buy school uniforms and undergarments of different styles to thereby satisfy the needs of her customers.

She performs this work in order to grow her income and to thereby improve the level of living for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy school uniforms and undergarments.

loans.name: Maria

texts.pt:
Casada maritalmente mãe de filhos dos quais dois são estudantes, não possui outros dependentes.
É trabalhador da Bananalândia e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar materiais de construção (cimento, varões e barrotes) e pagar a mão de obra para a construção da sua casa, uma vez já tendo armazenado blocos, chapas.
No futuro pretende solicitar um outro empréstimo para ampliar a sua residência uma vez que actualmente o projecto que tem é de uma dependência.
O seu maior desafio é iniciar a obra até a sua conclusão
texts.en:
Maria is married and the mother of children, two of whom are students. She doesn't have any other dependents.

Maria works at Bananalândia and with this loan she plans to buy construction materials (cements, rods and beams) and pay for the labour to build her house as she has already purchased blocks and metal sheets.

In future she intends to solicit another loan to expand her residence as the project she has at the moment is for one dependent.

Her greatest challenge is to start and finish the building work.

loans.use: buy construction materials (cements, rods and beams) and pay for the labour to build her house

loans.name: Tisir

texts.en:
Tisir is an Iraqi youth client. He is 23 years old, single, and lives with five family members, two of whom are employed.

Tisir owns a barber shop. In order to gain some experience, he worked as an employee in another barber shop. After gaining enough experience, Tisir established his own business in 2008, and now he has an employee. He has gained good experience in this field and is well known in the surrounding area and has an excellent reputation.

Tisir is requesting a youth loan of $2700, which he will use to install a new display window, a new ceiling and signage for his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide himself better living conditions.

loans.use: to install a new display window, a new ceiling and  signage for his shop

loans.name: Pithon

texts.en:
Pithon is a 23-year-old single businessman. He hawks assorted goods. He has been selling the assorted goods for the past three years, earning a monthly income of 8,000 KES. He is applying for his first loan term with KADET LTD after he was recently introduced by KADET staff. 

Pithon will use the loan to purchase more watches, torches, padlocks and sunglasses to sell. He intends to open a retail shop with the anticipated profits. His hopes and dreams are to do well in the business.

loans.use: to purchase more watches, torches, padlocks and sunglasses to sell

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is an Iraqi youth client, who is 23 years old, and married. Mahmoud lives with five of his family members, of whom two assist him in providing the family income.
Mahmoud owns a small shop for selling household electronics such as irons, hairdryers, remote controls and heaters. He established his business in 2009. He now has an employee and has gained good experience in this field. Mahmoud is well-known in the surrounding area and has an excellent reputation.
Mahmoud is requesting a $2,500 youth loan which he will use to rent another shop to use as a storage room. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide a better standard of living for his family.

loans.use: to rent another shop to use it as a storage room

loans.name: Amélia

texts.pt:
Casada mãe de 3 filhos e vivendo em casa própria em Mahanhane a cerca de 7 anos
É operária e com o empréstimo pretende adquirir material de construção (chapas, portas e janelas) para acabamento da sua residência.
No futuro e como forma de incrementar a renda familiar graceja abrir uma mercearia e construir um aviário para criação de frangos de corte
O maior desafio são os fundos para o investimento na medida em que o salário é insignificante
texts.en:
Amélia is married and the mother of 3 children. She has lived in her own house in Mahanhane for around 7 years.

She's a factory worker and with this loan she plans to buy construction material (metal sheets, doors and windows) to put the finishing touches on her house.

In future - and so as to increase her family's income - she'd like to open a grocery store and build an aviary to raise hens for slaughter. 

Her greatest challenge is to obtain the funds for investment as her salary is insignificant.

loans.use: buy construction material (metal sheets, doors and windows) to put the finishing touches on her house.

loans.name: Florinda

texts.pt:
Casada mãe de 3 filhos e residente em campoane na sua própria casa
É operadora de telecomunicações mas também dedica se ao negócio, com o empréstimo pretende comprar roupa na Africa do Sul para a revenda.
Futuramente gostaria de construir uma Boutique de modo a ter um local fixo de venda pois actualmente o seu negócio é ambulatório.
A dificuldade de financiamento é o maior desafio que enfrenta
texts.en:
Florinda is married and the mother of 3 children. She lives in her own house in Campoane.

She's a telecommunications operator and also has her own business. With this loan she plans to buy clothes in South Africa for resale.

In future she'd like to build a Boutique so as to have a fixed location for her sales as she currently has a mobile business.

Her greatest challenge and difficulty is financing.

loans.use: buy clothes in South Africa for resale

loans.name: Tengku

texts.en:
Tengku has a salon that she started in 1984. She lives with her spouse, who worked in a travel company and only has the average of income 1,000,000 IDR per month. She still has one child in college. 

Tengku's salon is located in her house. At the beginning, she offered her service just for treatment, but now she does treatments and bridal makeup. She will use this loan to increase the size of her salon and buy some additional equipment. She dreams of increasing her business with good, complete equipment and finding a strategic place for her business.

loans.use: to expand her shop and buy salon equipment.

loans.name: Segundo

texts.es: Segundo, de 42 años de edad, es soltero y tiene 4 hijos a quienes cuida desde que eran pequeños. Viven juntos en su casa de material noble ,el cual construyo con el fruto de su esfuerzo .La actividad que realiza Segundo es el transporte de pasajeros en su mototaxi.Le gusta su negocio pues le permite tener un ingreso económico con el cual poder solventar sus gastos familiares. Se inició por la necesidad de contar con un trabajo estable, ya que no podía conseguir un empleo, ahora se siente con mayor seguridad pues puede manejar sus horarios y además de ser su propio jefe. Por lo contrario comenta que no le gusta cuando su mototaxi se malogra o sufre algunos daños de manera continúa pues le ocasiona muchos gastos que si no los soluciona a tiempo no puede trabajar con tranquilidad, pero aun así logra ver buenos resultados, por eso tiene planes de hacer crecer su actividad de transporte comprándose un vehículo de carga pesada ya que el pago en este tipo de transporte es mayor.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000 soles y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que viene recibiendo para poder alcanzar sus objetivos.Con el monto solicitado refaccionará su mototaxi comprando espejos, llantas y aros que necesita para que pueda seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Segundo, 42, is single and has four children for whom he has cared since they were young.  They live together in his house built of quality materials, which he built with the fruit of his labor.

Segundo's work is transporting passengers in his motorcycle taxi.  He likes his business because it allows him to have an income to pay his family expenses.  He started because he needed to have a stable job because he couldn't find work.

Now he feels more secure because he can arrange his hours and also be his own boss.  On the other hand, he says he doesn't like it when his motorcycle taxi breaks down or constantly gets damaged because it's very expensive for him.  If he can't resolve the problems quickly he can't work in peace.

Even so he manages to get good results.  This is why he plans to expand his transportation business by buying himself a heavy transport vehicle because the pay is better for this type of transportation.

Currently he'll request 1000 soles [PEN] and he's grateful for this financial support he's receiving to be able to realize his goals.  With the requested amount he'll refurbish his motorcycle taxi buying mirrors, tires, and wheels that he needs so he can continue working.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle taxi parts

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es:
Alba es una mujer joven de 21 años de edad casada, emprendedora, luchadora que de su matrimonio procrearon 2 hijos los cuales son menores de edad y viven bajo el mismo techo como una gran familia. Ella tiene un grado de educación cursado hasta el quinto grado de educación primaria ya que ella no pudo continuar estudiando debido a que sus padres son de bajos recursos económicos eso imposibilito la oportunidad de ser preparada. En compañía de su esposo trabajan la agricultura especialmente en la siembra y cultivo de café pero fueron sus padres los que le enseñaron la actividad desde muy temprana edad. Ella cuenta con una maquina (molino) para moler el café mismo que es producido por sus tierras y vendido como un valor agregado para generar un poco más de ingresos a su hogar y ayudar a su esposo con los gastos diarios como ser alimentación, vestimenta, medicinas, etc. Sus cultivos están ubicados a una distancia de 100 metros de su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan a pie diariamente y agradecen a DIOS por el terreno que hoy en día es propio eso les permite tener un poco más de ingresos.    

Actualmente ella solicita ayuda para la compra de fertilizantes, abono, bombas de fumigación para su cultivo de café ya que ellos quieren dar un mejor mantenimiento a sus cultivos y evitar el contagio de plagas y enfermedades como la roya que destruyen una producción completa de ser contaminada.

Su sueño es que sus cultivos sean los más productivos para obtener un mejor ingreso de parte del café y así poder sacar a sus hijos adelante, sacando una carrera profesional preparan doce de tal forma que ellos puedan ser mejores cada día sean jóvenes emprendedores.
texts.en:
Alba, a young woman of 21, is married, an entrepreneur and a fighter who has two children from her marriage who are both of minor age.  They all live  under the same roof as one big family. She completed primary education until the fifth grade and could not continue studying because her parents have limited financial resources that made it impossible for her to be trained. 

Along with her husband, she works in agriculture, especially in the planting and cultivation of coffee; but it was her parents who taught her the business from an early age. She has a machine (grinder) to grind the coffee they produce on their land and sell it at ahigher value to generate a little more income to their home and help her husband with daily expenses such as food, clothing, medicines, etc. Every day, they travel to their crops on foot, which are located at a distance of 100 meters from their house. They are thankful that the land is their own, which gives them a little more income.

Right now, she is requesting assistance for the purchase of fertilizer, manure and insecticide spray for the cultivation of coffee since they want to better maintain their crops and prevent the spread of pests and diseases such as plant rust that can destroy an entire crop if contaminated.

Her dream is that their crops are the most productive so they can obtain a better income from coffee so they can get their children ahead with professional degrees so they can be better every day as young entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, insecticide spray for coffee growing.

loans.name: Jessy

texts.en:
Jessy is a 20-year old recent high-school graduate who lives with her family in the Chongwe district of Zambia, about 45 miles east of Lusaka. She has lived in Chongwe all her life, which helps her feel a strong sense of community with her neighbors and friends. As a Zamsolar solar distribution agent, she has enjoyed helping her community by providing safe, clean and affordable alternative energy products to replace candles and paraffin. Her work with Zamsolar also provides a source of income for herself and her family, and she feels that she gains valuable entrepreneurial experience that a recent graduate would not normally be able to find. 

A $400 loan will allow Jessy to stock additional inventory of the Angaza Pay-As-You-Go SoLite3 to sell to wait-listed customers in Chongwe. She is happy that the SoLite3 lets her sell clean energy to people in her community who normally wouldn’t be able to afford a high-quality solar product.

Note: This loan is being re-posted because the original loan contained an error in the repayment schedule.

loans.use: to purchase stock of pay-as-you-go solar products

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana is a 56 year old  woman from Talibon, Bohol. She is engaged in a fishing business. She also runs a sari-sari, which is a variety store business. She has had the store for more than five years now. 
Luciana is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, floaters, and lead weights and additional stocks for the store like canned goods, candies, rice, soap and toiletries.
In the future, Luciana dreams of making her businesses a success.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, floaters, and lead weights and additional stocks for her store like canned goods, candies, rice, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Mamuka

texts.en:
Mamuka is 35 years old. He lives in Kutaisi, West Georgia with his 26-year-old wife. Several times, Mamuka requested a loan from local financial institutions for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected each time because of low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

Mamuka is a car artisan and has his own workshop. He installs gas systems in cars and gets a small monthly income which is rarely enough to feed the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the 'subsistence poor' category. 

Mamuka requested a loan from Credo for his business. His loan request was approved in the framework of new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits, with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as 'high risk borrowers' because of low income. 

With the received credit, Mamuka will purchase gas containers and a special system for installing the gas in cars, and to have this in stock since he already has orders. Mamuka hopes the business will be successful as he is experienced in his business and has a large number of satisfied clients. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will give Mamuka the chance to develop his business and to provide better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase gas containers and a special system for installing the gas in cars.

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel, a 51-year-old married man supporting seven members of his family, has been operating a motor spare parts shop in Kaiboi for a period of 25 years. He earns a monthly income of KES. 60,000.

He is now requesting his eighth loan of KES. 60,000 with KADET LTD to pay school fees for his children who are in secondary school. Samwel's dream is to be a spare parts wholesaler dealer.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Dúo Mariposas De San Bartolo Group

texts.es:
Dúo mariposas de san Bartolo
Este dúo está conformado por doña Mirna Patricia, ella tiene 37 años de edad y tres hijos dos varones y su hija mayor de 12 años, ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes tales como, azúcar, fideos, cereales, arroz, aceite, golosinas, gaseosas, harinas, jabón, detérgete, papel higiénico, helados de fruta que ella misma elabora, choco bananos choco fresas, choco piñas etc. En su tienda  llamada los guachipilines ubicado en san Bartolomé milpas altas, Esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos comestibles de consumo diario,esperando que por medio de ustedes ella pueda seguir luchando en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mirna Patricia, 37, is a member of Dúo Mariposas de San Bartolo.  She has three children, two boys and her oldest daughter, 12.

She earns a living selling groceries such as sugar, pasta, cereal, rice, oil, sweets, soda, flour, soap, detergent, toilet paper, fruit ice cream she makes herself, chocolate bananas, chocolate strawberries, chocolate pineapple, etc.  Her store, Los Guachipilines, is located in San Bartolomé Milpas Altas.

She's requesting this loan to buy food products, hoping that through the lenders she can continue striving in her business.

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Orlando

texts.en:
Orlando is 41 years old, married and has two school-aged children. He aims to become financially stable to give his children a bright future. In this regard, he operates his motorcycle transport to generate additional income. 
Due to financial difficulty, he is asking for additional capital of 10,000 PHP (Philippine pesos) to buy wheels, sprockets, gasoline and other accessories needed for the maintenance of his motorcycle. Orlando believes that this financial assistance will be a great help for him to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy wheels, sprockets, gasoline and other accessories needed for the maintenance of his motorcycle

loans.name: Enelita

texts.en:
Enelita, a married woman who works hard to support her family, has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other equipment for fishing.

Enelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment for fishing.

loans.name: Alexei

texts.ru:
Алексей занимается выращиванием помидоров, огурцов и редиса в теплицах в с Водяное уже 9 лет. Он живет с женой и двумя детьми в своем доме. Как человек, Алексей трудолюбивый, спокойный, неторопливый, хороший фермер.

В этом регионе выращивание овощей в теплицах - основной бизнес у многих и летом большая конкуренция. Алексей сделал отопление в теплицах, чтобы получать урожай и торговать пораньше.

Недавно, Алексей приобрел участок земли неподалеку и решил построить там две теплицы. Одну поставил, а на вторую не хватает собственных средств. Алексей просит предоставить ему кредит 24,000 гривен.

У Алексея есть планы на развитие. Он планирует поставить еще две теплицы и сделать там отопление. Затем хотел бы приобрести еще землю для развития.
texts.en:
Alexei has been growing tomatoes, cucumbers and radishes in greenhouses in the village of Vodyanoye since he was 9 years old.  He lives with his wife and two children in his house.  Alexei is a hardworking, calm, steady person and a good farmer.

In this area, growing vegetables in greenhouses is the main type of business for many and in the summer there is a lot of competition.  Alexei installed heating in his greenhouses in order to get an earlier harvest and to start selling earlier.  

Recently Alexei bought a plot of land nearby and decided to build two greenhouses there.  He built one but does not have enough personal funds for the other.  Alexei is asking for a loan of 24,000 hryvnia.

Alexei has expansion plans.  He plans to build two more greenhouses and install heating there.  Then he would like to purchase more land for expansion.

loans.use: to build a new greenhouse

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa is 44 years old, married with three children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates an agricultural plot where she is planting and harvesting coconuts to earn a living. She has been with her business for over five years and earns 3,000 PHP (Philippine pesos) every month.

She has joined GDMPC in the year 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 4,500 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Luisa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 53-year-old business man. He is married.  He has been operating a taxi transport business for the past five years with a monthly income of 53,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) which he uses to support his family. 

Charles is applying for his first loan term with KADET LTD after being introduced by an existing client. He will use the loan to purchase spare parts for his taxi repairs. With the anticipated profits from the business, he will purchase another vehicle. 

Charles's hopes and dreams are to own many vehicles for business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his taxi repairs

loans.name: Dúo San Antonio Group

texts.es:
DUO SAN ANTONIO DE SAN RAYMUNDO
El grupo está conformado por la señora quien es  Clara Luz de 35 años de edad ella se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno y gallinas desde  hace 15 años  necesita otro crédito para poder comprar alimentos para ganados como también lo utilizara  para la compra de materiales  para poder hacer un corral para los animales, y así no tenerlos sueltos su deseo es seguir creciendo en su crianza de ganado vacuno y gallina y poder ser   el sustento para su familia y de esas ganancias obtenidas poder darle estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en: Clara Luz, 35 years old, is a member of the Duo San Antonio de San Raymundo group. She makes a living raising cattle and chickens. Clara Luz has worked in this business for 15 years. She is requesting a loan in order to buy feed for her animals and materials to make a bigger pen for them. That way she won't have to let them wander around freely. Her goal is to keep growing her business and be able to provide for her family, especially to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to buy feed for her animals and materials to build bigger pens.

loans.name: El Eden Group

texts.es: Saludos  desde Perú,  Un grupo conformado por 10 personas emprendedores    y con mucha creatividad para los negocios. Así son los integrantes del grupo comunal “EL EDEN”.  La Sra. Rosa de 67 años de edad soltera y madre de  3 hijos, ella se dedica hace 8 años  a la venta de gaseosas, golosinas, leches, azúcar.  la Sra. rosa  nos cuenta que ha llegado a fidelizar  a sus clientes   el cual le ha generado ganancias para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar,  En el futuro le gustaría tener un local propio donde poder vender sus productos y obtener mayores ganancias económicas. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá   en una pequeña bodega  y así poder salir adelante. A la vez  la Sra. rosa y todos los integrantes se encuentran  agradecidos   con Kiva y Edaprospo por el préstamo otorgado    y por la confianza que se  les ha sido brindada. Se despide  Dejando la promesa  que cumplirá todas sus metas propuestas.
texts.en: Greetings from Peru! Our group is made up 10 enterprising people who have a lot of creativity when it comes to doing business. We are members of the group "El Eden." Rosa is 67 years old, single, and has three children. For the last eight years, she has been selling sodas, candy, milk, and sugar. Rosa says that she has managed to build up a loyal client base which has generated profits which she has used to pay household expenses. In the future, she would like to have her own premises to sell her products from to be able to make more money. She will invest the loan she has requested in setting up a small grocery store so that she can get ahead. Rosa and all of the members of her group are grateful to Kiva and Edaprospo for the loan and for putting their trust in them. She bids you farewell promising that she will fulfill all of the goals she has set for herself.

loans.use: to buy stock for their grocery store.

loans.name: Enith

texts.es:
Enith, de 52 años, es una mujer empeñosa y trabajadora, está casada y tiene 4 hijos, pero actualmente solo vive con su esposo y su último hijo en la casa propia que construyeron con mucho esfuerzo.El trabajo de Enith consiste en la confección de prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños, a diario realiza ésta actividad en su hogar,  lugar a donde  acuden todos los clientes que requieren de alguna prenda ya elaborada o que solicitan un diseño único y personalizado que ella no duda en realizarlas es una mujer muy creativa y desde luego muy detallista, cualidades que se pueden ver reflejadas en el acabado final que da a todas las prendas que elabora. Realiza este oficio por más de 10 años y lo complementa con otros oficios como la venta de postres que vende en mercados y la venta de cosméticos que ejerce generalmente por las tardes.
Lleva trabajando como costurera desde hace mucho tiempo, se inició desde muy joven, lo que le ha permitido lograr muchas cosas en su vida, espera seguir progresando y establecer más adelante un local de ventas en donde pueda exhibir y vender todos sus productos. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500 soles, está contenta y agradecida con las personas que hacen posible su crédito ya que le servirá para continuar con sus planes. Con el monto solicitado comprará materiales para continuar con su trabajo de costura como telas, hilos, elásticos, botones, cierres, blondas entre otros.
texts.en:
Enith is 52 years old and is a determined, hardworking woman.  She is married and has 4 children, but currently she only lives with her husband and their youngest son in their own house, which they built through great effort.

Enith's work involves making clothing for women, men, and children.  She does her work every day from her home, a place where customers turn to when they need clothes that are already made.  Some also ask for unique, personalized designs that she doesn't hesitate to make.  She is a very creative woman and of course very detailed.  These qualities are reflected in the finished work of all the clothing that she sews.

She has been with this business for more than 10 years and complements it with other services such as selling desserts and makeup in street markets.  She usually sells these things in the afternoon.

She has been working as a seamstress for a long time, starting when she was very young.  This has allowed her to accomplish many things in her life.  She hopes to keep progressing and establish, later on, her own shop where she can show and sell her goods.

At this time, she is asking for 1500 sols (US$600).  She is glad and thankful for the people that make her loan possible, since it will help her continue with her plans.  With the amount asked for, she will buy materials to continue her sewing work, including fabric, thread, elastic thread, buttons, zippers, lace, etc.

loans.use: buy sewing supplies such as fabric, thread, needles, etc.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en: Herminia is 40 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her store. Herminia has been in this business for four years and has previously received funds through Kiva. She aspires to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Dúo Perseverancia Group

texts.es:
Dúo Perseverancia.
Elida es madre soltera,  su hija  de nueve meses de edad, ella inicio su negocio hace un año y medio  vendiendo tortillas en su domicilio ubicado en Bárcenas, actualmente alquila un local en el cual tiene dos tipos de negocio la venta de tortillas y venta de artículos de consumo diario, pero por la falta de capital no ha podido surtir bien su negocio y no tiene mucho maíz para la elaboración de  tortillas, ya que es el producto que mas ganancia le genera, ella por el momento solo le pide a Dios que le de fuerzas para  poder darle a su hija todo lo necesario ya que no es fácil ser madre y padre al mismo tiempo, agradece a su familia el apoyo que le brindan, por el momento su mayor sueño es que su negocio sea mas grande y productivo, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de Maiz para la elaboracion de toritllas, y tambien para la compra de productos de consumo diario.
texts.en:
Dúo Perseverancia (Duo of Persistence).

Elida is a single mother.  Her daughter is 9 months old.  She started her business a year and a half ago selling tortillas in her home, which is located in Barcenas.  Currently, she rents a store in which she does two types of business: selling tortillas and selling everyday groceries.  However, due to a lack of capital she hasn't been able to stock her business very well and she doesn't have a lot of corn to make tortillas, which is the product that gets her the most profit.  For the time being she can only ask God to give her strength to be able to give her daughter all that she needs, for it's hard playing the roles of  mother and father at the same time.

She is thankful to her family for the support that they give her.  At the moment, her greatest dream is that her business gets bigger and more productive.  She is asking for this loan to buy corn to make tortillas and also to buy everyday groceries.

loans.use: buy everyday groceries and also corn to make tortillas.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en: As a married parent of 2 children, Mary Ann works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from E-loading, pig fattening and tricycle transportation businesses. Mary Ann is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase more items  like bread, soft drinks, sugar, soap and other groceries for her general store. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items like bread, soft drinks, sugar, soap and other groceries.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en: Sylvia is married and works hard to provide for her family. She runs a variety store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to purchase more items to sell like shampoo, soap, sardines, powdered milk, cooking oil and other miscellaneous items. Sylvia has been in this business for six years and has previously received funds through Kiva. She aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like shampoo, soap, sardines, powdered milk, cooking oil and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Rosalia Leticia

texts.es: Doña Rosalia de 42 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos, es trabajadora, responable y honesta, tiene un puesto de antojitos que le produce buenos ingresos solicita un credito para poder comprar mas productos para la elaboracion de sus antojitos y poder ayudar en los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en:
Doña Rosalia is 42 years old and lives with her husband and three children. She is hardworking, responsible, and honest.

Rosalia has a snack stand that generates a good income. She is requesting a loan so that she can buy more supplies for preparing her snacks. This will help her with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy more supplies for making snacks.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en: Mildred is 44 years old, and married with 2 children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a vegetable business to earn a living. She has been with her business for over 3 years and earns 2,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in the year 2011 and now she has requested a loan of 3,000 PHP every to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Roderick

texts.en: Roderick, 29 years old, is married and blessed with 1 child. He has been managing a piggery business for almost 3 years, and earns a net income of PHP 2,000 per hog. He would like to avail himself of a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase hog feed and hogs to raise. His income usually goes to the allowances of his children when going to school, therefore he wants to gain more income for his children. He hopes that generous lenders will be able to help him to build a profitable business.

loans.use: To purchase hog feed and hogs to raise

loans.name: Griselda Raquel

texts.es:
La Señora Griselda Raquel es profesora docente de un colegios  de una ONG que ayuda a los niños de Bajos Recursos hijos de comerciantes de los mercados  de la ciudad de león desde hace mas de 5 años dando el pan del saber a sus alumnos,  siendo este trabajo  el sustento de su familia por mucho tiempo.

La Señora Griselda Raquel es madre soltera de dos hijos uno de  ellos estudia y por sus bajos ingresos se ha complicado comprar los útiles escolares y la matricula en el colegio siendo ya cliente, se acercó a ceprodel  para solicitar  apoyo y así  sufragar estos gastos.
texts.en:
Griselda Raquel is a professor in the high school of a non-governmental organization that helps children from low-income families. Most of the students' parents work as vendors in the city markets of León. Griselda has spent over five years giving her students the bread of knowledge and providing for her family from this job. 

Griselda Raquel is a single mother of two school-aged children. She is struggling to buy the necessary school supplies and pay enrollment fees for her children. She came to Ceprodel to request a loan to help defray the cost of these expenses.

loans.use: to buy clothing and school supplies as well as pay enrollment fees.

loans.name: Seneyda Antonieta

texts.es:
La Señora Seneyda Antonieta  es enfermera profesional  de unos de los centro de salud de la ciudad de león desde hace más de 20 años siendo este trabajo el sustento de su familia.

La Señora Seneyda Antonieta esta necesitando un crédito para la compra de útiles escolares y matricula para el ingreso de su hijo a clases por lo que se acercó a ceprodel a solicitar apoyo para resolver su necesidad.
texts.en:
Seneyda Antonieta is a professional nurse who works in one of the public health centers in the city of León.  She has done this work for 20 years to support her family.

She currently needs a loan to help cover school expenses for her son.  She has approached Ceprodel seeking financial support for this purpose.

loans.use: to buy school supplies and clothing and to cover other related expenses.

loans.name: Steven

texts.en: Steven is a 29-year-old man from Gatsibo District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. He is seeking a loan of USD 50 (30,000 RWF) to purchase ten rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just USD 0.20. Steven started selling lights in December 2012 and he has sold 20 lights to date, providing clean energy to 100 people. He is also a farmer and will reinvest the money he makes to expand his other business, to earn more money for himself and his wife, Chantal.

loans.use: to pay for ten low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Rogelio José

texts.es:
El Señor Rogelio José  posee un pequeño negocio de venta de relojes y accesorios de diferentes tipos y estilos en el departamento de León desde hace 15 años el realiza esta labor para llevar el sustento a su familia, tiene dos hijos menores que están bajo su responsabilidad.

Don Rogelio se presentó a Ceprodel a solicitar crédito para Compra de billeteras, relojes y accesorios, lentes de lujos, y así aprovechar la temporada de la semana. 

El Sueña con la preparación de sus hijos y realizar mejoras en su vivienda para tener un mejor nivel de vida junto  a su familia.
texts.en:
Rogelio José has a small business selling watches and accessories of different types and styles in the district of León.  He has done this work for 15 years in order to support his family.  He has two young children under his care.

He came to Ceprodel to seek a loan in order to buy sunglasses, wallets, watches and accessories, so that he can take advantage of the season.

His dream is to prepare his children for adulthood and to make improvements to his home so that his family can have a higher standard of living.

loans.use: to buy sunglasses, wallets, watches and accessories.

loans.name: Aferdita

texts.en:
Aferdita is a 58-year-old Egyptian mother of only one daughter, who was married and had one daughter of her own. About two years ago, Aferdita's daughter got divorced and unfortunately became paralyzed at the same time. Thus, Aferdita has been left to care for both her daughter and granddaughter. 

“It’s a blessing for me, they are not a burden at all,” said Aferdita. “When my daughter and granddaughter came home, I knew that I had to do something extra to earn more money to support them. At that time I had only one job. I had been working in a local hospital as a janitor for long time. With some savings I had, I bought a sewing machine and some fabric, raw material,” she added.  

“I need to buy some more fabric though,” Aferdita continued.

loans.use: To buy fabic/raw material for sewing

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 60 years old.  She is married and has four children.  Teresita works very hard to provide for them.

Teresita runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase more items to stock and sell.  Teresita has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items including sugar, soap, sardines, eggs and other groceries. 

In the future Teresita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to stock and sell.

loans.name: Rukshana

texts.en:
Ms. Rukshana is a 40-year-old married woman.  She is the mother of three children, two of whom attend school.  Her husband’s income is not enough to meet the household expenses so she started a business, buying and selling animals.  She buys animals such as small goats, brings them up and then sells them in the local market. She makes enough through her business to provide basic necessities to her children. 

She currently has three goats and wants to purchase two more goats.  For this purpose, she has requested a loan of 20,000 PKR from the Kashf Foundation.  She hopes to increase her earnings and dreams to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Erika

texts.es:
Erika, de 32 años,esta divorciada y tiene 3 hijos de 17, 8 y 5 años respectivamente, comparte su día a día junto a ellos en su casa propia, la cual es fruto de su esfuerzo y dedicación.El trabajo de Erika consiste en la venta de pescado fresco, esta labor lo realiza de forma diaria en el puesto de ventas de una mercado muy concurrido de la ciudad. Lleva en éste negocio más de 10 años y los ingresos económicos que le produce son muy beneficiosos ya que en muchas oportunidades a logrado triplicar su inversión inicial. Le gusta mucho lo que hace por que adora estar en contacto con los clientes, ya que en el mercado conoce a muchas personas con quienes logra enlazar una buena amistad o relación laboral. Erika es una mujer que contribuye a la conservación de las especies, es por ello que no le agrada ver que otros vendedores ofrecen a la venta de especies no permitidas y a su vez espera seguir trabajando de la misma manera y continuar mejorando su economía.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000 soles, por tanto agradece a quienes hacen posible su crédito para continuar con sus objetivos y por otro lado se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
El monto solicitado lo invertirá en su negocio de pesca con la compra de gran cantidad de pescados de las especies de mayor demanda y espera obtener nuevamente buenas ganancias.
texts.en: Erika is 32 years old and is a divorced mother of three children aged 5, 8 and 17. She shares her days with them in her own house, which is the fruit of her effort and dedication. Her work consists of selling fresh fish. She works daily at her stall in a very busy market in the city. She has had this business for over 10 years, and the income has been very beneficial. Many times she has been able to triple her initial investment. She very much likes what she does, since she loves being in contact with her customers. She has gotten to know many people at the market with whom she has built solid friendships or working relationships. Erika is a woman who contributes to the conservation of species of fish. For this reason, she does not like to see other vendors selling species of fish that are not allowed to be sold. She intends to continue working in the same manner and to keep improving her financial conditions. She is currently seeking a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles. She wishes to thank those who are making this loan possible so that she can continue toward her goals. She promises to make her monthly repayments in a punctual manner. She will use the funds to buy a large quantity of the species of fish that are in high demand, and she hopes to make a good profit again.

loans.use: to buy fish for resale.

loans.name: Gloria Esperanza

texts.es:
Gloria tiene 38 años de edad, tiene dos hijos. Ella siempre se ha dedicado a los oficios domésticos, lo aprendió de su madre y hoy se dedica al cuido de sus hijos. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar materiales de construcción; para mejorar su vivienda y que esta más segura junto a sus hijos; para que se sientan felices como familia.
texts.en:
Gloria is 38, has two children.  She has always worked as a housekeeper, she learned this activity from her mom and she now focuses on taking care of her children.

The loan requested to Fundacion Campo, is to buy construction materials, to make betterments to her home and make it safer for her children, so they feel happy as a family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials, to make betterments to her home and make it safer for her children, so they feel happy as a family.

loans.name: Sixta Tulia

texts.es: Sixta se dedica a confeccionar ropa y a la venta de mercancía en un barrio del suroccidente de la ciudad, donde habita con sus 3 hijos adultos; su mercado lo conforman conductores  y una clientela de vecinos que desde el año 1986 son fieles a su negocio. Las ventas de sus productos  las realiza a crédito, mientras sus compras las hace de contado en el centro de la ciudad y a empresas a las que está afiliada y le entregan catálogos, para que Sixta promocione sus artículos. En la actualidad ha recibido 11 financiamientos de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará telas para aumentar su producción, cremas, perfumería, ropa de cama, artículos domésticos etc. Productos que ya han sido encargados por su clientela y ella como siempre, intenta responderle de manera oportuna, para hacer de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Sixta makes her living making clothes and selling merchandise in a neighborhood in the southwest of the city, where she lives with her 3 adult children.  Her market is made up of drivers and a clientele of neighbors who have been loyal customers since 1986.

She sells her products on credit, while she makes her purchases with cash in the center of the city and from businesses that she is affiliated with and who give her catalogs so that she can promote their items.

Until now, she has received 11 loans from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use this one to buy cloth to increase her production, creams, perfumes, bed linens, domestic items, etc. -- products that have been ordered by her customers and that she tries to fulfill promptly, so that her Kiva loan is a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy cloth, creams, perfumes, bed linens, domestic items, etc.

loans.name: Cristina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Cristina, se ha decido por un nuevo crédito, por su buen desempeño en el negocio, ella quiere comprar comida como el concentrado para la gallinas, conejos, además comprarse verduras frescas como plátanos, papas, güisquiles, chiles, entre otros productos.
Con el préstamo anterior considera que su negocio se ha mantenido, ha logrado atender a los clientes, con sus ingresos a cubierto lo más necesario en su hogar.
texts.en:
Cristina has decided to get another loan.  Because of her good performance in her business, she wants to buy food such as concentrate for the chickens and rabbits.  She also wants to buy fresh vegetables such as plantains, potatoes, pear squash, and chili peppers, among other products.

She thinks that with the previous loan she supported her business and managed to tend to her customers.  With her income she has covered the most necessary things for her household.

loans.use: to buy concentrated feed and fresh vegetables

loans.name: Mariela Yasmín

texts.es:
Mariela tiene 28 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene tres hijos. Desde hace tres años se dedica a la elaboración y venta de antojitos, ella sale a venderlos casa por casa en toda la comunidad hasta terminarlos; sino puede ella salir a venderlos envía  a sus hijos mayores. De esa manera ella ayuda a su esposo con los gastos del hogar; ya que es una persona muy responsable con todos sus compromisos. Los insumos que necesita para elaborar su ventas, los compra en una ciudad que esta a ocho kilómetros de su casa, el transporte en la zona en donde vive es muy escaso por lo que debe estar atenta cuando pasa un autobús; sino tiene que caminar todo ese trayecto y cargar los insumos en su espalda.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar una camionada de arena, 20 bolsas de cemento y pago de mano de obra. Para terminar de construir su casa antes de que llegue el invierno, no tendrán que mojarse y su familia tendrá más armonía y seguridad.  Su deseo, es que sus hijos asistan a la escuela y estudien para que puedan ser unos profesionales.
texts.en:
Mariela, 28, lives with her common-law husband and three children.  For three years she has been making and selling snack foods which she sells door-to-door in her community.  If she is unable to go out she sends her oldest children.  This is how she helps her husband cover household expenses, since she is very responsible with all her commitments.  She buys her food supplies in the city which is eight kilometers from home.  Since there is not much transportation in the area she must be alert to the bus schedule  so she does not have to walk a long way carrrying the supplies on her back.

The loan she is requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy a truckload of sand, 20 bags of cement and to hire workers.  She wants to finish construction on her home before the winter arrives.  This is so her family can live more comfortably without the dampness.  Her goal is for her children to get an education so they can become professionals.

loans.use: para comprar una camionada de arena, 20 bolsas de cemento y pago de mano de obra.

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es:
Evangelina es una mujer joven de 23 años de edad emprendedora, luchadora, que junto a su esposo se dedican exclusivamente a la agricultura (cultivo de maíz y frijoles). También cultivan café en forma de vivero donde una parte la venden para el mantenimiento del mismo y la otra parte la dejan para el consumo de su hogar. Ella pudo cursar la primaria completa pero no pudo continuar. Sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra desde muy pequeña y junto a su esposo con los años de trabajo y ahorro de sus ganancias y pensaron algún día tener su propia tierra la cual les permitiera trabajar de forma propia sin necesidad de alquilar.
