Restringiéndose de muchas cosas hoy en día cumplieron su meta y compraron un pedazo de tierra el cual esta a una distancia de 15 minutos de su casa de habitación a la cual  diariamente se trasladan a pie esto le permite estar al pendiente de sus cultivos y poder cuidarlo de los diferentes animales, aves y plagas.

Actualmente está solicitando ayuda para la compra de fertilizante, abonos y otros productos para el mantenimiento de sus cultivos (maíz y frijoles) y vivero de café ya que están en una buena temporada y no cuentan con el efectivo suficiente para el mantenimiento del mismo debido a que estos productos son caros y no se les puede aplicar cualquier cosa ya que podría perder su cosecha.     

Sus sueños son poder educar a su hijo menor para que tenga una mejor calidad de vida una mejor educación y también poder aumentar su tierra para poder sembrar café ya que ella cuenta con un vivero que posteriormente la sembrara y espera que en un futuro sean muy productivas para que su familia tengan donde trabajar.
texts.en:
Evangelina, 23, is a young, hard-working entrepreneur who, together with her husband, earns a living in agriculture (corn and bean cultivation).  They also have a coffee nursery and sell part of the crop to cover maintenance costs and use the other part for home consumption.  She was able to get an elementary education but could not continue.  Her parents taught her from a very early age to work the land.  Evangelina and her husband believed that through years of hard work and by saving their money they could one day have their own farmland so as not to have to rent land.  They now own a patch of land about 15 minutes from their house, and they walk to it every day.  This allows them to be able to supervise their crops and keep animals, birds and plant disease away.

Evangelina is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and other products for maintenance of her corn and bean crops, as well as the coffee nursery.  Now is the season for this and they do not have enough cash to buy the expensive products.  They do not want to use cheap products which could affect the harvest outcome.

Her goal is to give her youngest son a good education so he can lead a better lifestyle, and also to buy more land to grow coffee.  This will increase her production and provide employment for her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other maintenance products for her crops.

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en:
Ms Musarat is a 45-year-old widow and a mother of three. She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. She started her own business after the death of her husband. She knows the techniques of stitching very well. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community, and she earns enough to lead a decent life. 

To help her continue operation of her business, she requested for a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy a stock of threads in different colors along with packs of zippers, buttons and ribbons to meet up with the increasing demand. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend part of the profit on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colors with packs of zippers, buttons and ribbons.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Ms Khalida is 43 years old, married, and a mother of three children. She is very talented and excels in making envelopes. She makes a large quantity of envelopes at home and sells them at the local market. Her husband's income is not sufficient to meet the family expenditures alone so her income helps in providing for the household activities. 

To help her continue operations of her business, Khalida is requesting a loan of 50,000 PKR, which she will use to buy bundles of good quality paper to increase her sales. She expects an increase in her business income as she expands. She intends to use the profits to provide a good quality education for her children.

loans.use: to buy bundles of good quality paper to increase her sales.

loans.name: Farah

texts.en:
Ms Farah is 40 years old, and a married woman. The man shown in the photo is Farah’s husband who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Farah has applied for a loan of PKR 20,000, for her husband. He wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Farah is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Ms Shazia is 30 years old and a married woman and mother of four children. The man shown in the photo is Shazia’s husband who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Shazia has applied for a loan of PKR 20,000, for her husband. He wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Shazia is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Virgeta

texts.en:
Virgeta is 40 years old and married with three children who are all in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Virgeta has a general store business in the Philippines. Virgeta requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her store.

Virgeta has been in this business for four years. In the future, Virgeta would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Jesa

texts.en:
Jesa is 25 years old, married and with two children.

Jesa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling mobile phones and accessories in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to buy additional mobile phone accessories and mobile phones to sell.

Jesa has borrowed and paid for one loan from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. before this loan. She has been running the business buying and selling mobile phones and accessories for four years and also earns an additional income from buying and selling of dry goods.

Jesa aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional mobile phone accessories and mobile phones to sell.

loans.name: Gerson Yovani

texts.es:
El señor Gerson Yovani es soltero, tiene 29 años de edad, curso los 6 años de educacion secundaria, el es comerciante tiene una tienda de venta de productos de consumo diario, inicio este negocio ayunando a su abuelo y hasta la fecha lleva 4 años de experiencia.

Solicita un prestamos que lo utilizara para la compra de articulos de consumo diario para surtir su tienda, en el futuro no muy lejano el quiere tener una tienda mas grande. Tambien cuenta con el apoyo de su familia.
texts.en:
Gerson Yovani is a single 29-year-old man.  He completed six years of secondary education.  He is a merchant and has a grocery store.  He started out in this business helping helping his grandfather and to date has four years of experience.

He is seeking a loan so that he can purchase groceries to stock his store. He hopes to have a bigger store in the not-too-distant future.  He also has the support of his family.

loans.use: to buy groceries for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a fence around her home and put in flooring in the patio of the house.

loans.name: Jennifer De Los Angeles

texts.es: La joven Jennifer, de 23 años de edad es casada y con tres meses de embarazo lo que la llena de emoción por lo que, le inspira continuar con sus estudios universitario para ofrecerle un buen futuro a sus hijos que vendrán, su medio de sobrevivencia es una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación, negocio que empezó con ahorros y ayuda de su padre y poco a poco fue dándole vida. Este primer credito solicitado es para invertir en su pequeño negocio comprando granos básicos, golosinas, lácteos, productos enlatados entre otros, con el apoyo de financiamiento.
texts.en: Young Jennifer, 23, is married and three months' pregnant which fills her with excitement and inspires her to continue with her university studies to offer a good future to her future children.  Her means of support is a home-based grocery store, a business she started with her savings and with help from her father; she gradually brought it to life.  This is the first loan she’s requested and she’ll use it to invest in her small business buying basic grains, snacks, dairy products and canned goods, among others.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Abel De Jesús

texts.es: El señor Abel de Jesus habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe en la comunidad  la Francia, su familia le apoya en todo al  igual su esposa quienes ya tienen un  hijo pequeño. con este  nuevo credito podra darle Mantenimiento a su cultivo de Piña y podra obtener mejores ganancias y sus condiciones de vida cambiaran, el comprara: Urea, Completo, Fertilizante, Triple, etc. asi su cultivo podra combatir las plagas. Agradece el apoyo y la Confianza que Afodenic y Fondos Kiva le  han brindado durante estos años.
texts.en:
Abel lives in the town of Ticuantepe, in the Francia community. His family supports him and his wife in everything and they have a young son. 

With this new loan he will be able to maintain his pineapple farm and will be able to increase his income and improve his quality of life. He will buy fertilisers, urea, etc so his farm will be able to ward off diseases. 

He is grateful for the support and trust that Afodenic and Kiva have given him through the years.

loans.use: to buy supplies to maintain the farm.

loans.name: Francisco José

texts.es:
El señor Francisco Jose vive en la cuidad de Managua, trabaja  en un mercado de Managua en el área de limpieza, se caracteriza por ser una persona honesta, responsable en su trabajo y con su familia.

Está solicitando un crédito a kiva y ceprodel para la compra de zinc para el cambio de techo de su vivienda ya que se encuentra en mal estado y  quiere hacer las mejoras antes que inicie  el invierno.

Don francisco agradece a ceprodel porque gracias a créditos otorgados  ha venido mejorando sus condiciones de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Francisco José lives in the city of Managua and works in a market in Managua in the area of cleaning. He is an honest person who is responsible in his work and with his family. 

He is applying for a loan from Kiva and Ceprodel to buy zinc to change the roof of his house, which is in a bad state, and he wants to make the improvements before winter begins. 

Francisco thanks Ceprodel because thanks to loans he has been granted his family's living conditions have been improving.

loans.use: to buy zinc to replace his roof, which is in poor condition

loans.name: Britania De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
Doña Britania es una microempresaria que tiene aproximadamente diez años de producir tortillas suaves y tostadas, este producto es elaborado a base de maíz y constituye un alimento muy importante en la comida de los nicaragüenses.

Ella necesita un préstamo con el objetivo de comprar maíz y leña, esto con el objetivo de comprar el maíz por quintal y disminuir considerablemente los costos de producir este alimento.
 
Antes de tener su propio negocio trabajaba como empleada domestica en Managua, pero para estar más cerca de sus dos hijos y atenderlos, decide poner su propio negocio en su casa de habitación.

Con los ingresos que obtiene de su trabajo, le brinda seguridad alimentaria a sus hijos, además de los gastos personales del hogar y sus estudios. Es madre soltera y muy esforzada.
texts.en:
Britania is a micro-entrepreneur who has been making soft and fried tortillas for about ten years. This product is made from corn and is an important nutriment in the food of Nicaraguans.

She needs a loan in order to buy corn and firewood so that she can buy the corn by quintal in order to greatly decrease the cost to produce the food.

Before having her own business she used to work as a maid in Managua, but in order to be closer to her two children and take care of them, she decided to open her own business in her residence.

With the earnings she received from her work, she provides food and security to her children, and also the personal household expenses and their studies. She is a single mother and very hardworking.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood to make soft and fried tortillas in her home based business.

loans.name: Velkis Yanex

texts.es:
Velkis tiene 32 años de edad, es casada, tiene 1 hijo y vive con su familia en una colonia del municipio de Choloma, Cortes. 
Velkis tiene un negocio de venta de mercadería. Este negocio lo inicio hace 8 años con fondos propios e iniciativa  propia para obtener ingresos necesarios para su familia, en el cual manifiesta le va muy bien y a logrado solventar económicamente los gastos del hogar. 
Ella  solicitado a Odef su séptimo préstamo de 12,000 lempiras el cual lo invertirá en compra de mercadería para surtir el negocio como Útiles escolares, sandalias, cosméticos etc. Piensa que con esta inversión sus ventas tendrán un incremento  favorable aprovechando la época escolar ya que ofrecerá variedad de productos para atender a sus clientes.
Su meta es ampliar el negocio con mercadería nueva.
texts.en:
Velkis, 32, is married and has 1 child.  She lives with her family in a neighborhood in the town of Choloma, in the department of Cortes.

Velkis has a business selling merchandise.  She started this business 8 years ago with her own money and initiative so that she could obtain the income she needs for her family.  She states that the business is doing very well, and it has given her the resources to cover the household expenses.

Velkis has requested her 7th loan with ODEF for 12,000 Honduran lempiras.  She plans to invest the loan in the purchase of merchandise for her business, including: school supplies, sandals, cosmetics, etc.  She thinks that with this investment her sales will increase, as she will be able to take advantage of the school season and also offer a greater variety of products to her customers. Her goal is to expand her business with new merchandise.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell, such as sandals and school supplies

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
Rosa María de 57 años de edad, se ha caracterizado en su barrio por su amabilidad y generosidad. Siempre soñó con tener su propio negocio, por lo cual inició su actividad comercial con la venta de helados en su vivienda, y gracias a la buena acogida, sus clientes comenzaron a demandarle productos de  la canasta familiar. Así inicio su negocio con el cual lleva más de 12 años.

Su mayor sueño es ver crecer su tienda y convertirla en el primer supermercado autoservicio del sector, razón por la cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito, que destinará en la compra de surtido con el fin de aumentar sus ventas. Su mayor reto ha sido velar por el bienestar de sus cuatro hijos y brindarles educación ya que su situación económica se ha visto marcada por muchos altibajos.
texts.en:
Rosa María is 57 and is known for in her neighborhood for her generosity and friendly personality.  She always dreamed of having her own business, so she started out by selling ice cream from her home.  This was well received, and her customers began to ask for grocery items as well.  This is how her business began more than 12 years ago.

Her greatest dream is to expand her shop and transform it into the first supermarket in her area.  Thus she is seeking a loan so that she can stock her store, with the goal of increasing her sales.  Her biggest challenge has been ensuring the well-being of her four children and providing them with an education, given that there have been many ups and downs in her financial situation.

loans.use: to buy groceries for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabric, synthetic hair, and ribbons

loans.name: Julio

texts.en: Julio is 34 years old, married, and blessed with four children. They are harmoniously residing in the village of Bustamante. He owns and operates a motorcycle transportation business. In this business, he earns a net income of PHP 3,000 a month. He would like to access a loan of PHP 7,000 to pay for repairs and maintenance on his motorcycle. He hopes that his requested loan will be granted, so that he can improve his business.

loans.use: to pay for repairs and maintenance on his motorcycle, which he uses to furnish motorcycle transport services.

loans.name: Josee

texts.en: Josee is a 42 year old woman from Rwamagana District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. She is applying for a loan of $50 to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which she will resell to people in her village who do not have electricity. Every week or so, these customers will return to her to have their lights recharged for just $0.20. Josee started selling lights in July 2012, and she has sold 20 lights to date, providing clean energy to 100 people. She is also a farmer and will reinvest the money she makes into expanding her other business to earn more money for herself and her husband.

loans.use: to pay for 10 low-cost rechargeable LED lights to resell to rural households that have no electricity in her village.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia is a 30-year-old married woman and a mother of two children. They live in Talibon, Bohol. Cecelia has been engaged in a hog raising business for more than three years now. 

Cecelia is asking for a loan to buy  more feeds and supplements for the pigs. In the future, Cecelia dreams of making her business a success and sustainable. In addition to, she wants to save money for future schooling of her children and to repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy more feeds and supplements for the pigs.

loans.name: Joselen

texts.en:
Joselen is married and works hard to support her family.

She has a lechon (roasted pig) business in the Philippines. Joselen is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients and pigs to make lechon.

Joselen has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and pigs to make lechon (roasted pig).

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 51 years old, married and has six children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Josephine is borrowing PHP 20,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Josephine has been farming sugarcane for 30 years and also earns additional income from raising livestock.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream, to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 55 years old and married with eight children. Alicia works very hard to provide for them.

Alicia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Alicia has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as bread, soft-drinks, soap and other groceries. 

In the future Alicia would like to save enough money so that she can build a mini-mart in a public market.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en:
Genalyn is a 28-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. She has been engaged in a rice farming business for more than 10 years now. She helps her husband in tilling their land.

Genalyn is asking for a loan to buy additional fertilizer for the farm and additional piglets to raise. With this, she will be able to improve their business and make it a success. Also, she wants to continually send her children to school for them to have better education and learning.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizer for the farm and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Namakhutu Group

texts.en:
Grace is a member of Namakhutu Group in Chwele District. She is pictured with 14 One Acre Fund farmers, 12 women and 2 men. Grace is standing on the right with her hand raised. She is receiving an input loan for a half acre of maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation. Grace first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2011 Long Rains, and she is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. 
Grace joined One Acre Fund in order to improve her farming techniques through the One Acre Fund methods, and she will use increased profits to send her children to school. Grace reports that, before she joined One Acre Fund, she was able to grow about 2.3 bags of maize per half acre but, with her One Acre Fund input loan during the 2012 Long Rains season, she harvested 7 bags per half acre! She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and to repair her home. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Grace’s group members will take out input loans for half an acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on seven acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet and sorghum on her half-acre farm.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is 46 years old, married, and has one child. With her child currently in school, Evelyn works very hard to provide for the family. Evelyn runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has applied for a PHP 20,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to buy more items to sell in her general store. Evelyn has been in this business for eight years, and she intends to buy a variety of items to sell, including vinegar, biscuits, cooking oil and canned goods. Evelyn would like to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store, including vinegar, biscuits, cooking oil and canned goods.

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en: Guillerma is married and a hard-working entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her restaurant. She successfully repaid her previous loan and is now applying for a new loan to further improve her business. NWTF is re-listing Guillerma's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Kakhaber

texts.en:
Kakhaber is 34 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and two children who go to school in Tbilisi, the capital city of Georgia. Several times, Kakhaber requested a loan from local financial institutions for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected each time because of low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

Kakhaber works as a builder at private company and gets a small income, which is not stable. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the 'subsistence poor' category. 

Kakhaber requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits, with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as 'high risk borrowers' because of low income. 

With the received credit, Kakhaber will open a Georgian bread bakery and start his own business. He will bake bread to sell at a good price. This will increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to open a bakery and bake Georgian bread.

loans.name: Syida

texts.en:
Ms. Syida is a 53-year-old married woman and the mother of four children.  Her husband is a pension holder and it was very difficult for Syida to manage her household needs with the small income from her husband.  Therefore, she decided to help her husband by earning an income.  For this purpose, she started her business of cloth trade, buying cloth of different varieties from the market and selling them in her vicinity.  Now she is playing a very important role for her family.  

Due to low cash availability, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 30,000 PKR.  With this loan, she would be able to purchase a greater variety of cloth in different colors and designs for the summer season to satisfy the taste and needs of her customers.  She is in her third loan cycle with good repayment history. 

She expects to increase her earnings and wants to reinvest part of the profit on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs for the summer season.

loans.name: Zonia Maribel

texts.es:
Zonia tiene 37 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene un hijo.  Ella se ha dedicado a prestar sus servicios como empleada domestica desde hace cinco años; pero por l momento cuida dos sobrinos y plancha, lava ropa de otras personas que solicitan su servicio. De esta manera obtiene unos ingresos adicionales. Ella no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar ya que quedo huérfana de padre y madre cuando tenía 12 años de edad. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar materiales para mejorar su vivienda; comprara teja ya que su casa esta construida en su totalidad de lámina y no es segura. Con la inversión, podrá vivir en mejores condiciones ya que su actual casa no le brinda la seguridad ni la confianza para vivir así.
texts.en:
Zonia is 37, she has a partner and one child.  She has provided services working as a housekeeper for five years, but for now she takes care of her nephews and irons clothing, she washes clothes for people that request her services.  This way she obtains additional income.  She didn't have the opportunity to study because she lost her parents when she was twelve years old.

The loan requested to Fundacion Campo, will be used to buy materials to renovate her home, buy tiles for the roof because her house is built with aluminium sheets and is not safe.  With this investment, she will live in better conditions because her current home doesn't provide the safety or confidence needed to live in it under its current condition.

loans.use: to buy materials to renovate her home, buy tiles for the roof because her house is built with aluminium sheets and is not safe.

loans.name: Benicia

texts.es:
Benicia tiene 57 años de edad, tiene cuatro hijos.  Vive junto a sus hijos y una nuera. Ella se dedica a realizar los oficios domésticos en su casa y a administrar su propia tienda instalada en su casa. También, presta sus servicios de inyectar y a cultivar hortalizas, pero solo para consumo de su familia. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para reconstruir una pila, en donde almacena agua para realizar todos los quehaceres en su casa; ya que es la única que poseen. Con la inversión, evitara el desperdicio y la escasez del vital liquido como es el agua y estará más higiénicamente almacenada.
texts.en:
Benicia is 57 years and has four children.  She lives with her children and her daughter-in-law.  She performs domestic chores at home and manages her own store, which is set up in her home.  She also provides fertilizer injection services and grows vegetables, but only for family consumption.
She is requesting the loan from Fundación Campo to rebuild a trough where she stores water that she uses for all of the household chores.  This is the only trough they have.  With the investment, she will avoid waste and the shortage of water, a vital liquid, and storage will be more hygienic.

loans.use: to rebuild a  water trough.  .

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James' business is doing well. With the financial help he obtained from Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET), he was able to open a retail shop for his wife. 

He is requesting a second business loan to finance his business. He plans to use the loan to purchase stocks of watches, sunglasses, toys, and torches.

He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to have a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of watches, sunglasses, toys, and torches for his business.

loans.name: Ludevina

texts.en: Ludevina, a 40-year-old married mother of three, is a very hardworking entrepreneur. A fish vendor in the Philippines for 20 years, Ludevina has requested a PHP 30000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to buy additional boxes of fish to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Faustin

texts.en: Faustin is a 48-year-old man from the Ngororero District in the Western Province of Rwanda.  He is seeking a loan of $50 in order to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village.  Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just $.20.  Faustin started selling lights in October 2012 and he has sold 20 lights to date, providing clean energy to 100 people.  He is also a farmer and will reinvest the money he makes to expand his other business in order to earn more money for himself and his wife.

loans.use: to pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Ms. Fatima is a 38-year-old active, married woman.  She effectively conducts a business, doing stitching work at her home.  She has been in business for the last three years and her collection is very famous in her town and she has received a lot of appreciation from members of her community. While her husband’s income is not sufficient to meet the everyday expenditures of the household, she earns enough to lead a decent life.  She is a loving mother of five children and is responsible for providing her family with good food, health and education. 

She has slowly but surely improved her business by taking loans from the Kashf Foundation.  At this time, she has requested a loan of 25,000 PKR in order to purchase more spools of thread, packs of buttons, lace and zippers in different colors to complete customers' orders on time.  

She desires to spend part of her income on providing good, quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase spools of thread, packs of buttons, lace and zippers in different colors.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy goats and sheep to sell.

loans.name: Kety Trinidad

texts.es:
Kety es una mujer que tiene 43 años, ella nació en Chone y siendo muy joven se trasladó a otra ciudad en donde se casó con Víctor que ahora tiene 54 años y es jornalero en algunas fincas de la zona. De este matrimonio nacieron 3 hijos a quienes nunca les faltó nada y fueron educados bajo principios y valores éticos que los ayudaría a defenderse honestamente frente a la sociedad. Ahora ya son independientes y cada uno tiene su familia. Kety vive con su esposo  en la Parroquia de Río Verde, un lugar histórico de Santo Domingo, la capital de la Provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, provincia de Ecuador con un alto crecimiento sostenido y cuenta con un comercio considerable  ya que se ha convertido en un puerto terrestre de intercambio comercial entre las regiones Sierra y Costa del país. 
Kety siempre estuvo dedicada a atender a sus hijos y a su esposo en el hogar, sin embargo, ahora que viven la época del “nido vacío” en donde ya los hijos han salido del hogar; Kety decidió dedicarse a la venta de cosméticos por catálogo para ocupar su tiempo ayudando a su esposo con el gasto del hogar. Kety recorre las largas calles de su ciudad ofreciendo sus productos a sus clientes y también cobrando las ventas de los productos ya entregados, también recibe a muchos de ellos en su domicilio, quienes van en busca de productos en stock para solucionar necesidades inmediatas. Es por esto que Kety cree que es indispensable aumentar su oferta de productos en stock para que así aparte de obtener mejores precios por parte de sus proveedores, también pueda ofrecer a sus clientes todos los productos que ellos demanden de manera inmediata y de esta forma sus ingresos puedan mejorar para llevar un mejor estilo de vida con su esposo. Hace un año y medio esta mujer emprendedora  conoció a Fundación Alternativa por varias buenas referencias de colegas y allegados, cuando se entrevistó con su asesor de crédito, quien le dio la confianza para hacer de esta institución una parte importante de su vida laboral. Ahora Kety solicita un préstamo bajo el producto de Kiva para poder comprar productos que incrementen el stock que ella mantiene. Cuando le contamos a Kety sobre la metodología para obtener el financiamiento para su negocio, ella sonrió y les agradece por la confianza que depositen en ella, pues en un futuro ella se ve con un local adecuado y amplio donde se comercialice productos cosméticos y de belleza para todas las edades y todo se dará gracias al financiamiento que cada vez ella pueda obtener.
texts.en:
Kety is a 43 year old woman who was born in Chone. When she was young she moved to another city where she married Victor, who is now 54 years old and works as a day laborer for various farms in the area. Together they have three children who never wanted for anything and were educated with principles and ethical values that help them to honestly stand on their own in society. Nowadays they are all grown and independent and have families of their own. Kety lives with her husband in the Río Verde Parrish, a historical district of Santo Domingo, the capital of the Province of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, in Ecuador. The region boasts a sustained and high level of growth and strong trade because it has become a trade hub for commercial land routes between the mountain and coastal regions of the country. 

Kety was always dedicated to caring for her children and her husband at home, but, now that they have entered an “empty nesters” phase in which her children are out of the house, Kety decided to begin selling catalogue cosmetic goods to keep her busy and to help her husband with the household expenses. Kety travels the long streets of her city offering her products to her customers and collecting on sales for products already delivered. She also receives many customers in her home, who come in search of products they need immediately. For this reason, Kety believes it is very important for her to expand her inventory of available products because then she will obtain better prices from her suppliers and she will also be able to offer her customers all of the products they seek on short notice. This way she will improve her income and be able to provide for a better life with her husband. 

Eighteen months ago this enterprising woman was introduced to Fundación Alternativa through strong references from colleagues and friends, and when she interviewed with her credit advisor it gave her the confidence to make this institution an important part of her working life. Now Kety is applying for a loan through Kiva in order to purchase various products to increase her inventory. When we discussed with Kety the method for obtaining financing for her business she smiled and expressed her gratitude for the confidence that our institution put in her. In the future she will have her own store where she will sell cosmetics and beauty supplies for people of all ages, and all this will be possible thanks to the financing she will be able to receive.

loans.use: to buy items of stock most requested by her customers

loans.name: Yosselin Aminta

texts.es:
yosselin tiene 21 años de edad, esta soltera, vive con sus padres.  Desde muy pequeña se dedica al comercio; desde hace cinco años trabaja como empleada en una farmacia. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para construir una fosa séptica y terminar de instalar las puertas a su casa. La inversión es de suma importancia, ya que le urge construirla, debido a que le permitirá tener más higiene en su casa para desechar las eses de su cuerpo.
texts.en: Yosselin is 21 years old, single, and lives with her parents.  She has been working since she was very young.  For the past five years, she has been working as a clerk in a pharmacy.  She is requesting the loan from Fundación Campo to build a septic tank and to install doors on her house.  The investment is of utmost importance and it is urgent that she build the septic tank because it will enable her to dispose of human waste so that her home will be more sanitary.  .

loans.use: to build a septic tank and complete the installation of doors on her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a fumigation machine and fertilizers.

loans.name: Swaib

texts.en:
Swaib started his business way back in 2007. He lives in Rubare town, Kahaama village. His first wife has been paralyzed for five years now. 

Swaib has come for a loan of UGX 3,000,000/= to enable him to buy manure to add in his banana plantation. He will then be able to boost his production and, therefore, make enough sales to help him raise enough money to cater for his children’s school fees and take care of his wife. He will also be able to raise enough food for his household as well as his dependents. 

He is excited about the partnership with Kiva, through Ugafode Microfinance Limited. In the photo, Swaib (on the left) is with the Ugafode Microfinance Limited staff member.

loans.use: to buy manure for his banana plantation.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas is 55 years of age, married, and has three children. She grows a variety of vegetables in their field and harvests to sell. Felicitas always prioritizes her children's school fees when she gets earnings from vending vegetables. Her two oldest children finished college. She financially supports them through her income from selling. Now, only her youngest child is still in school, at the tertiary level of education. 

Felicitas greatest dreams are to finish her child's education and to find better work someday.  Felicitas is requesting a loan of P20,000 to buy fertilizers and herbicides to apply on her vegetables. She hopes that her planted vegetables produce a good result.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides to apply on her vegetables.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es: Esther de 53 años de edad vive en la ciudad de Cartagena  con su cónyuge y tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 17, 31 y 32 años. Allí en domicilio tiene un negocio donde vende variedades de artículos que compran diariamente sus vecinos del barrio y de sectores cercanos que conocen la calidad de sus servicios. Desde hace 5 años, inició su idea emprendedora con la venta de ropa, inicialmente a la que fue poco a poco agregando artículos de miscelánea, como accesorios femeninos, útiles de cocina, papelería, sandalias, multiusos, toallas, etc. Con ello pudo adicionar un ingreso para beneficiar la educación y el sustento de sus hijos. Su meta es ampliar su negocio y por eso accedió a un crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual logró incrementar su capital de trabajo y hoy está aplicando a un nuevo financiamiento mediante el fondo de KIVA , pues quiere agregar a su inventario, artículos que rotan rápidamente en su negocio y muchas veces no alcanza a tener un stock para resolver los pedidos de su clientela; ella comprará toallas, cubrelechos, multiusos, articulos para el hogar etc Su meta más adelante es tener un local propio con diversidad de mercancías y terminar de apoyar a su hijo menor brindándole estudios, para que tenga un buen potencial de éxito.
texts.en:
53-year old Esther lives in Cartagena with her husband and three children aged 17, 31, and 32. She runs a business from her house selling a variety of goods to her neighbours and people from nearby areas who know the quality of her service. She started out five years ago with the idea of selling clothing. Then gradually she added other items such as women’s accessories, kitchen goods, stationery, sandals,  multipurpose tools, towels etc. In this way Esther earned additional income for her children’s education and support.

Her goal is to grow her business so she received a loan from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation to be used as working capital. Now she is applying for a new loan through KIVA as she wishes to add items that quickly turn over to her inventory. Often she cannot keep enough stock in her store to fulfill her customers’ orders. Esther plans to buy towels, bedding, multipurpose tools, household items etc. 

In the future Esther would like to have her own store selling a range of merchandise. She also wants to help her youngest son complete his education so that he has the opportunity to get a good job.

loans.use: buy towels, bedding, multipurpose tools, household items etc.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
A 39-year-old farmer from Talibon, Bohol, Marites works hard on their farm to support her husband. They have been in the rice farming business for several years now. Her husband also works as a carpenter.

Marites is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve their farming business and eventually augment their harvest and yield.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: To earn a profit and be able to sustain her six children with basic necessities, Josephine engages in selling meat and fish around their village. Her husband is a farmer and her partner in distributing their products. Josephine wants to extend the products she sells to her customers in their village and gain additional income for the education of their children. Thus, she is asking for a loan of 18,000 PHP to buy meat, chicken, milkfish and tilapia. She is looking forward to having a successful business.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, milkfish and tilapia.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients such as yeast, sugar, and she will make some improvements to her kitchen

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a retailing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

Arlene successfully paid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. NWTF is re-listing Arlene's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria works hard to support her family. She is 67 years old, single, and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Maria requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase stock like shampoo, canned goods, bread, etc. to sell in her general store.

Maria has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Maria would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock like shampoo, canned goods, bread, etc., to sell in her general store

loans.name: Gina Group

texts.en:
This group consists of 2 members, namely Georgina and Cynthia. They reside in Dansoman, Ghana.  They decided to form a group to access credit from ID Ghana in August 2012. They sell waakye (a rice and beans delicacy) and tea and indome (a noodle dish) respectively.

Georgina is a 42 year old trader. She is married to Alex who is a 52 year old construction worker. She sells 'waakye' (cooked rice and beans) with 4 years experience and works from Tuesday to Sunday. She gets her goods from the market in the eastern region and sells them in the Dansoman community. 

This is her 2nd loan with ID Ghana and she has requested a loan of GHS 500 to buy more goods to sell to her customers. 

The entire group needs a total amount of GHS 850 to buy more goods to sell to their respective customers.

loans.use: TO BUY RICE AND BEANS TO AND SELL TO HER CUSTOMERS

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita plants and harvest vegetables in her field to make a living. She admits that sometimes she experiences difficulties in the financial aspect of the business but she is doing her best to feed her children.
  
Juanita is 45 years old, married and has two children. Her husband is a farmer and also a carpenter when he has free time. Juanita’s children have already finished their education. She wants to continue to operate the business to provide a source of income. Juanita is requesting a loan of P32,000 to buy seeds to grow and fertilizer to apply to her crops. She hopes to harvest more vegetables, which will provide a higher income for her family's future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy seeds to grow and fertilizer to apply.

loans.name: Arlon

texts.en:
Arlon is a fish vendor from the town of Getafe, Bohol. He has been in the fish vending business for more than five years now. 
This is the source of his income.

Arlon needs additional capital for the expansion of his business. He is requesting a loan to buy more fish to sell . With this, he will be able to sell more thus augmenting his sales and income.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Potenciana

texts.en:
Potenciana is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is requesting to borrow PHP 20000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. Inc. to buy items to sell like biscuits, cooking oil, soy sauce, shampoo, etc. in her general store business.

Potenciana has been in this business for 32 years. Potenciana earns additional income from a welding shop.

Potenciana has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. Inc. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like biscuits, cooking oil, soy sauce, shampoo, etc. in her general store

loans.name: Bidii Group

texts.en:
Adelaide is pictured on the right with her hand raised amongst her Bidii Group members. The 10 of them, 5 women and 5 men, are farmers in Kakamega South District. Farming inputs will be delivered to her on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ acre of maize, millet, and sorghum. Adelaide first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2012 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Adelaide joined One Acre Fund in order to get higher harvests and use increased profits to send her children to school.

Adelaide reports that before One Acre Fund, she was able to grow about 9 bags of maize per acre, but with her One Acre Fund input loan during Long Rains 2012, she harvested 15 bags per acre! She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and save for the future. Adelaide’s group members will each receive input loans of ½ acre during the 2013 Long Rains season. In total they will receive inputs for 5 acres of maize, millet and sorghum.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet and sorghum

loans.name: San Judas Tadeo 2 Group

texts.es:
San Judas Tadeo 2 es el nombre de un grupo integrado por 8 mujeres. Ellas decidieron dar este nombre  a su asociación porque son muy devotas a este santo ya que en México es conocido como el santo de las situaciones difíciles o imposibles. ellas viven en una region cañera y en su comunidad se ubica el ingenio IRSA produce melaza (miel de azucar) de la caña de azucar.

Las integrantes de este grupo son:
Marisela venta de ropa, Claudia venta de paletas heladas, Hilda venta de antojitos mexicanos, Esperanza venta de refrescos,  Reyna venta de antojitos mexicanos, Teresa venta de antojitos mexicanos, Nicolasa venta de antojitos mexicanos y Francisca venta de antojitos mexicanos.

Marisela uno de los miembros de este grupo, desde hace un año realiza ventas de ropa con sus amigas y vecinas de la comunidad, platica que cuando inicio con su negocio fue un poco dificil ya que tenia que ganarse a los clientes  y no sabia si su venta le dejaria ganancias ya que era la primera vez, pero aunque fue dificil logro hacer clientes y poco a poco fueron aumentando y se dio a conocer. Actualmente continua vendiendo casa por casa y en algunas ocasiones sus clientes la buscan para hacerle pedidos especiales o cuando hay una fiesta la buscan comprar algo sencillo para regalar. 

Ella dijo "mi venta me ha dado buenas experiencias he conocido y hecho buenos amigos pero también me ha enseñado no se puede confiar en todas las personas ya que algunos no les gusta pagar y son perdidas para mi pero hay vamos echándole ganas todo se logra".

Un credito de VisionFund le dará la oportunidad de comprar camisas, blusas, calcetines, faldas, pantalones, vestidos, shots y ropa interior.

Marisela tiene la edad de 43 años, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, esta casada con Epifanio y tienen dos hijos. 

A Marisela le gustaria en un futuro poder establecerse rentar un pequeño local en el cual exhibir sus productos.
texts.en:
San Judas Tadeo 2 is the name of this group of eight women. They decided on this name because they are very devoted to this saint as in Mexico he is known as the saint of difficult or impossible situations. They live in a sugar-cane growing area, and their community is the location for the IRSA sugar factory which produces molasses from sugar cane.

The following women are members of the group:
Marisela--sells clothing
Claudia--sells popsicles
Hilda--sells Mexican snacks
Esperanza--sells soft drinks
Reyna--sells Mexican snacks
Teresa--sells Mexican snacks
Nicolasa--sells Mexican snacks
Francisca--sells Mexican snacks

Marisela is one of the members of the group. A year ago she started selling clothing to her friends and neighbours. She notes that when she started out, it was difficult as she had no customers and she didn’t know if she could earn a profit. However, even though it was a difficult time, she did manage to find customers and gradually her customer base grew.

Even today she continues to sell from door to door, and sometimes her customers seek her out to make special orders, or when there is a fiesta, they want to buy something simple from her to give as a present. Marisela says, “I have had lots of good experiences from selling, and I have made good friends, but it has also taught me that I cannot trust everyone. Some people don’t want to pay you and I lose money.”

A loan through VisionFund will give Marisela the opportunity to buy shirts, blouses, socks, skirts, pants, dresses, shorts, and underwear.

She is 43 years old, didn’t go to school, is married to Epifano, and has two children. In the future she would like to rent a small business in which she can display her merchandise.

loans.use: buy shirts, blouses, socks, skirts, pants, dresses, shorts, and underwear

loans.name: Progreso Group

texts.es:
La Señora Dulce María es otro de los integrantes del grupo "Progreso". Ella tiene 30 años, estudio la preparatoria, es madre soltera de un hijo asiste primaria.

Doña Dulce María nos comenta que desde hace 6 años decidio iniciar con su propio negocio de venta de ropa y que hace poco de 3 años para tener mas entradas de dinero decidio iniciar con su venta de carne de cerdo porque queria sacar adelante a su pequeño hijo y ofrecerle una mejor oportunidad de vida. Ella realiza su venta de ropa, saliendo a caminar casa por casa enseñando a sus amigos y vecinos su ropa para que puedan comprarle, y vende la carne de cerdo durante los fines de semana (vienes, sabados y domingo); un dia antes la ofrece a sus vecinos o vecinos de la comunidad y al siguiente dia ella se levanta muy temprano a alinear su cerdo y después entrega sus pedidos. Doña Dulce María necesita este credito para la compra de ropa para dama y caballero como son blusas, pantalones, camisas, camisetas, vestidos y compra de carne de cerdo y bolsas de plastico para la venta de la carne. Ella espera que con este credito su negocio prospere y pueda ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida y educacion a su hijo.

las demas integrantes del grupo son:

Laura venta de calzado
Rita venta de comida
Susana venta de mole,
Martina venta de antojitos mexicanos
Ruperta venta de maiz y molino 
Virginia venta de comida
Isabel venta de calzado 
Araceli venta de comida 
Lizbeth venta de ropa
texts.en:
Dulce María is one of the members of the group "Progreso." She is 30 years old, she studied at a college-prep school and she is a single mother of one son who goes to elementary school. 

Dulce María told us that 6 years ago she decided to start her own business selling clothing and 3 years ago, she added selling pork to her business as well. She wants to improve her son's life and to offer him more opportunities in life. She began selling clothing by going door to door and selling her merchandise to friends and neighbors and she sells pork on the weekends (Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays). The day before, she first offers the meat to her neighbors and other members of the community and the next day she wakes up very early to get her product ready and then she delivers the orders. Dulce María needs this loan in order to purchase more men's and women's clothing like blouses, pants, shirts, T-shirts, dresses and purchasing more pork as well as plastic bags. She hopes that with this loan, her business will prosper and she will be able to offer a better quality of life and an education to her son. 


The other members of the group are: 

Laura  who sells shoes. 
Rita who sells food. 
Susana who sells mole.
Martina who sells Mexican snacks. 
Ruperta sells corn and flour 
Virginia sells food. 
Isabel sells shoes. 
Araceli sells food. 
Lizbeth sells clothing.

loans.use: purchase men's and women's clothing as well as purchasing pork and plastic bags.

loans.name: Emma Group

texts.en:
The Emma Group is made up of two partners, namely Emmanuel and Francisca, both residing at Glefe in Dansoman. They have been together since 2008 and are doing very well. Both sell CDs and Lacoste T-shirts.

Emmanuel is a 29-year-old CD seller. This has been his work for the past seven years and he is doing very well. Because of his integrity and frankness, all his customers trust him. He has been with ID Ghana for the past five years and wants to stay with the organisation for all his life. 

He has taken eight loans and has fully repaid all.  On his 9th loan, he is requesting 800 GHS to help him meet the demand from his customers.

loans.use: to buy more movie CDs and DVDs to sell

loans.name: Erwin

texts.en:
Erwin is a 30-year-old marred man and father of three young children from Talibon, Bohol. He is a carpenter who also runs a sari-sari, or variety store, selling various goods to the people in his community.

Erwin is asking for a loan to buy additional stock to sell, such as canned goods, rice, soda, soap and toiletries. In the future, he hopes to make his business a success.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell, such as canned goods, rice, soda, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Luz De Luna Brillante Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LUZ DE LUNA BRILLANTE”  iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Alicia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de mantas, tienda de barrio, trenzado de mantas, trenzado de abarcas de goma, elaboración de picotas, chuntillos, venta de golosinas, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Alicia es integrante, ella indica que hace seis años y medio que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una de las asesoras de crédito de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de golosinas; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió desde que ingreso a un colegio como portera.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de golosinas) que adquirirá de las ferias de la cuidad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto fijo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones del área de salud.
texts.en:
The “Luz de Luna Brillante” [Light of the Shining Moon] communal bank will begin their fourth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as a part of the Collpani regional office. The group is composed of ten members and is led by a board of directors headed by Alicia. The businesses that the members of the communal bank carry out are varied, such as weaving blankets, braiding blankets, making rubber sandals, making ‘picos’ and ‘chuntillos’ [rustic tools], selling sweets, and running a neighborhood store

The loan they will take out will benefit small business owners, one of whom is Alicia. She says that she joined Pro Mujer six and a half years ago on an invitation by one of the group’s credit counselors who went to visit her at home. Currently she has a small business selling sweets. She says she launched this business ever since she entered a school as a caretaker. 

The loan that Alicia will take out is to increase her working capital (through the purchase of sweets) that she will get from the fairs in the city of El Alto, and later, sell in her fixed store location. This type of work allows her to generate resources to take care of her home as well as she can. She is married and has four children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health training. 

In the photograph, Lucila is missing since she was at a doctor’s appointment in the clinic.

loans.use: purchase sweets to sell

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 55 years old and married with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy more fish to sell.

Rebecca has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is 53 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

She has a sari-sari, or variety store, in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 11,000 Philippine pesos through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy canned goods, noodles and other groceries.

Felicidad has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy canned goods, noodles and other groceries.

loans.name: Tegemeo Group

texts.en:
Dianah is a member of Tegemeo Group in Chwele District. She is pictured with 17 One Acre Fund farmers, 13 women and four men. Dianah is standing on the right, with her hand raised. 

She is receiving an input loan for 0.5 acres for maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation. Dianah is a new One Acre Fund farmer and is excited for the 2013 Long Rains season. She joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and gain fame by reducing hunger in the society.

Last year, Dianah harvested two bags of maize on an acre of land. She is excited to improve her harvest as a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and to buy a cow. 

Tegemeo Group members will each receive input loans of 0.5 acres during the 2013 Long Rains season. In total, they will receive inputs for 8.5 acres of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy grocery items for grocery-selling business

loans.name: Nely

texts.es: Nely tiene 23 años ,esta casada con  Julio de 26 años y actualmente se encuentra embarazada de su primer hijo .Ambos poseen una vivienda construida a base de material noble cuya construcción fue posible con el fruto de muchos años de trabajo. Se dedica desde hace 3 años a la venta de diversa variedad de comidas en el mercado de abastos de su localidad.Se inicio en el negocio gracias a la idea de su madre quien desde niña la instruyo en la preparación de diferentes platos de la localidad.A manera de cuidar y llevar un embarazo sin contratiempos optó por dejar de lado dicha actividad hasta despues de su embarazo y es desde entonces que Julio quien se desempeña como obrero municipal es el encargado de brindar todo lo necesario para mantener sólida su económia familiar .En esta oportunidad esta solicitando S/ 500 nuevos soles para contratar a un obrero de construcción y asi mejorar la calidad de su vivienda , ya que su familia merece toda la seguridad del caso a su vez se encuentra muy agradecida por el apoyo financiero que le brinda MFP y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual .
texts.en:
Nely is 23 years old. She is married to Julio who is 26 years old. She is pregnant with her first child. They have a home together built with good materials whose construction was made possible through the fruit of many years of work.

She has been working for three years selling a mixture of various foods in the neighborhood public market. She began the business thanks to her mother who had the idea of teaching her when she was young to prepare different local dishes. In order to take care and carry a full-term pregnancy she decided to put aside her activities until after her delivery and since then Julio has been working as a municipal worker and is in charge of providing everything necessary to maintain solid family finances.

At this time she is asking for 500 nuevos soles to contract a construction worker in order to make improvements to the condition of their home, as her family is worthy of housing security and she is grateful for the financial support that MFP has provided and she agrees to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to pay a construction worker to make improvements to her home

loans.name: Estrellitas Group

texts.es:
Otro miembro del grupo "Estrellitas" es doña Rosa María quien tiene 55 años de edad, estudio hasta secundaria y esta casada con el señor Moises que se dedica al trabajo del campo. 

Ella platica que desde hace 3 años puso en su hogar una pequeña taqueria con la intencion de ganarse su dinero y ayudar a don Moises con los gastos de su hogar ya que cada dia la situacion econica esta peor y no rinde el dinero ella dijo "En estos tiempos tenemos que trabajar los dos, si quiere vivir uno mejor hay que buscarle porque ni el dinero, ni la comida llegan solos a tocar puertas".

Ella realiza sus ventas los fines de semana(viernes, sabado y domingo) por las noches, en un pequeño corredor que tiene afuera de su casa, sus vecinos dicen que tiene buen sazón y que hace unos tacos muy ricos. 

Doña Rosa dice que le ayuda mucho que casi no tiene competencia y que ahorita es tiempo de zafra(cuando los ingenios producen azucar) hay mas trabajo  y mas dinero las familias salen a cenar fuera de casa. 

Ella invertira este credito en la compra de carnes, variedad de chiles, refrescos, tomastes, cebolla, aceite, tortilla, col, rabanos, pepinos, servilletas, papel aluminio y gas para continuar realizando sus ventas.

Le gustaria comprar con sus ganancias algunas sillas y unas mesas para que sus clientes puedan estar mas cómodos mientras comen o esperan su pedido.


Los demas integrantes del grupo son:
Zacarias venta de abarrotes
Ines venta de refrescos
Deysi venta de ropa
Nancy venta de calzado 
María Isabel venta de ropa 
Maria de los Ángeles venta de tortillas
texts.en:
Another member of the group "Estrellitas" is Rosa María, who is 55 years old and married to Moises, who works in agriculture.  She completed primary school.

She reports that three years ago, she started a small taqueria in her house with the intention of making her own income and helping Moises with the  household expenses, since every day the economic situation is worse.  She says "In these times we both have to work.  If you want to work, you have to take initiative, because neither money nor food will come knocking at your door."

She sells her goods on the weekends (Friday, Saturday and Sunday) in the evenings in a small alleyway outside her house.  Her neighbors say that her tacos are very tasty.

Rosa says that it helps very much that she has almost no competition.  Also, it is currently the sugar harvest season and the mills are refining the sugar.  Thus, more people have work and are able to go out for dinner.

She will invest this loan in meat, cabbage, cucumbers, tomatoes, onions, radishes, chili peppers, tortillas, oil, soft drinks, napkins, aluminum foil and gas so that she can continue making sales.

With her earnings she would like to buy some chairs and tables so that her customers can be more comfortable while eating or waiting for their orders.

The remaining members of the group are: 

Zacarias - sells groceries
Ines - sells soft drinks venta de refrescos
Deysi - sells clothes
Nancy - sells footwear 
María Isabel - sells clothes 
Maria de los Ángeles - sells tortillas

loans.use: to buy meat, cabbage, cucumbers, tomatoes, onions, radishes, chili peppers, tortillas, oil, soft drinks, napkins, aluminum foil and gas.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a 60-year-old, married woman and a mother of nine children, from Talibon, Bohol. Together with her husband, she has been engaged in a fishing business for more than 15 years now. This is the source of their income.

Lolita is requesting a loan to buy new fishing nets and storage buckets. In the future, Lolita hopes of improving their livelihood and their income.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and storage buckets for her business.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 48 years old, married and supports a family of five. His four children are ages 3 to 18. He sells buys and sells fresh milk in Chemundu and has been in the business for one year, earning an income of KES 12,000.

He is now requesting a third loan of KES 20,000 from KADET LTD and wishes to use this amount to pay the milk suppliers and also increase the milk quantity he sells.  

The anticipated amounts he earns will be used to pay school fees for his children. His dream is to improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To pay the milk suppliers

loans.name: Temur

texts.en:
Temur is 60 years old. He lives in Makhinjauri District with his wife, son, daughter in-law and two grandchildren who are going to school. Temur requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up but without any success. His loan request was rejected each time because of low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

Temur has a three-flour house. His whole family lives on the second floor of the house and the third floor is rented seasonally. That’s the family's only income which is not enough to feed its six members. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Temur requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. His loan request was approved in the framework of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. Start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's  rural poor. They do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit, Temur will renovate the first floor which can’t be used for living now. After renovating, he will be renting it out seasonally. Because of tourism development in Makhinjauri district, Temur believes that renovating the rooms will help him to earn more income. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To renovate first floor of three-floor house for renting out seasonally

loans.name: Paula

texts.en:
Paula is a Roma woman from the vulnerable ethnic minorities of central Albania. She lives in a major city within her community and is married with two young children. 
For the past three years, Paula has been selling used items in the Roma market just like the majority of other Roma members. In addition to this activity, she has been working as an on-call cleaner. Whatever she has been generating from both of her activities, "I have been able to cover for the basics of my family,” Paula said. “Yet, I want to generate some more. I want my kids to get an education, because I never had such an opportunity myself. Should I achieve this, I would be very happy, “ she said.

loans.use: To stock up on second-hand inventory items

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 28-year-old married mother of three young children from Getafe, Bohol. Josephine earns a living through her sari-sari or variety store business. This is the source of her income.
Josephine is asking for a loan to buy additional stocks to sell like canned goods, rice, bread and biscuits, soap, shampoo and toiletries. With this, she will be able to improve her business and make it productive and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell like canned goods, rice, bread and biscuits, soap, shampoo and toiletries

loans.name: Evi

texts.en: Evi runs a small stall which sells soft drinks, snacks, cell phone accessories, and mobile phone airtime credits. She is an entrepreneur who has four persons living in her house. She joined Ruma five months ago because she wanted to increase her income and she feels really excited to expand her business of selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments for her customers. For the last three months, she has made around $ 90/day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business gets up and running, she needs more working capital in order to be able to do transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions

loans.name: Odonchimeg

texts.en:
Odonchimeg, 26 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a traditional Mongolian ger (portable felt dwelling). Her husband has been working as a railroader at the train station. Also, in wintertime, her husband renders taxi services to local people.

Odonchimeg has been working as a train hostess at the train station since 2010. Her elder son studies at first grade. 

The ger the family lives in has deteriorated over the past years and needs some renovation by changing its felt and by building a barn which will be joined with the door. So, Odonchimeg is requesting a loan of MNT 1,500,000 to purchase felt and planks. 

During harsh winter times, the family is chilled down to their cores and they burn lots of coal in order to heat the ger. By changing its old felt with new felt, their home will have a better defense against strong storms and frosts. Building a barn conjoined with the door will decrease the force of incoming winds and will be used for storage of food and wood. 

As a result of the loan, the family will burn less coal, thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution, due to the warm and insulated traditional Mongolian ger. Odonchimeg is a very hard-working individual who wants to improve her family's living standard.

loans.use: to renovate her family's home.

loans.name: Dalhatu

texts.en: Dalhatu is a 48-year old husband, father and farmer from Pampaida Makaranta Village in Kaduna State who wishes to improve his maize farming business in order to provide a better life for his family and give his 7 children a better future through education. By accessing a Babban Gona loan, Dalhatu will have access to improved seeds, fertilizers and other inputs and technologies that will not only increase his yield but ensure that his harvest is free of toxins that make the maize unsafe for his children’s consumption. In addition, he will have the capacity to store his maize and have it sold in premium markets at a premium price, increasing his profitability. As a Babban Gona member, Dalhatu has the opportunity to get yields up to three times as much as the national average and earn up to three times as much as the average Nigerian farmer. In the future, Dalhatu would like to move from subsistence farming to commercial farming and hopes his children will also become successful Babban Gona member farmers like himself.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds and agricultural technologies to increase maize yields and subsequently, profits.

loans.name: Dauda

texts.en: Dauda is a happily married 29 year old maize farmer from Katsinawa Nakunne village in Kaduna State. As Dauda grows his family, he is excited about the opportunity that Babban Gona gives him to triple his yield and profit compared to the average farmer.  As a hard working family man, Dauda plans to use his Babban Gona loan to access  necessary inputs, such as fertilizer and improved seeds,that will increase the productivity and profitability of his farm so that he can provide for his family of three, achieve better health for his children and improve his family’s standard of living. In addition, this loan will give him the capacity to store his maize and have it marketed in premium markets at a premium price, increasing his profitability. Dauda hopes to eventually diversify his farm business by also raising livestock along with his maize farm.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds and and agricultural technologies that increase maize yields and subsequently profit.

loans.name: Samaila

texts.en:
Samaila is a 36 year old farmer and father of 10 who is unable to afford to send all of his children to school due to the cost of school fees and the consistently low profits he has earned from his maize farm.  Since joining Babban Gona, Samaila has seen his farm improve and has been able to produce greater yields during harvest.  By receiving a Babban Gona loan, Samaila has the opportunity to reap yields three times as high as the national average and earn at least three times as much as the average Nigerian farmer.  Now Samaila would like to continue the momentum of success with his crops this year.  A Babban Gona loan would help Samaila by providing him with the seeds and fertilizers he needs to increase his harvested yield of maize this planting season, and access to technologies to treat the maize to ensure that it is healthier to eat.  Also, a Babban Gona loan will allow Samaila the means to store his crops as well as the ability to sell them at a premium market price. 
 
With higher profits from a better harvest, Samaila would have the funds necessary to pay for his children’s school fees.  He would also be able to invest in starting a trading business selling packaged, non-perishable foods in his village with his two older children, Laazaru and Lawrence, during the dry season so he can add to his income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds, and agricultural technologies to increase maize yields

loans.name: Ayuba

texts.en:
Ayuba, 30, is a maize farmer in Katsinawa Nakunne village in Kaduna State.  In the past, Ayuba struggled with the task of working his farm without any inputs or tools and found life difficult for his wife and young daughter. Now that Ayuba has joined Babban Gona, he has seen an improvement in the quality of his crops and knows that the fertilizers that he has been able to access through Babban Gona’s credit have made a huge difference in his farming.  By receiving a Babban Gona loan, Ayuba has the opportunity to reap yields three times as high as the national average and earn at least three times as much as the average Nigerian farmer.  This year, Ayuba hopes to access a Babban Gona loan to continue planting maize and earn even greater profits. The loan will provide him with the fertilizers, seeds and technologies he needs to reach his goals.  In addition, a Babban Gona loan will allow Ayuba the means to store his crops as well as the ability to sell them at a premium market price.

Ayuba is grateful that Babban Gona has come into his life and hopes he can bring more of his family members into the program.  Even though his daughter is less than a year old, he and his wife hope to have more children. Ayuba would like to work with Babban Gona to expand his farm into livestock, rearing goats and cows in the future to provide additional income.  He would like to become a role model for other farmers, encouraging them to invest in their land, their future and the future of their children.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds, and agricultural technologies to increase maize yields

loans.name: Inusa

texts.en:
Inusa, a 30-year old maize farmer from Pampaida Dutse village, has plans to improve his life and the lives of his four children in the future.  Inusa dreams of expanding his small farm beyond maize once he has mastered the crop, and diversify his farm with yams, cassava and rice.  By receiving a Babban Gona loan, Inusa has the opportunity to reap yields three times as high as the national average and earn at least three times as much as the average Nigerian farmer.  A Babban Gona loan will help Inusa achieve his goals by providing him the  seeds, fertilizers and technologies to grow healthier maize crops.  In addition, a Babban Gona loan will allow him the means to store his crops as well as the ability to sell them at a premium market price. 
 
Since joining Babban Gona, Inusa has learned the difference a healthy maize crop can make, especially when it comes to what his four young children are eating.  The future of his children is the most important concern for Insua and his wife, he strives to provide the best for them.  He currently cannot afford to send his children to a good school and struggles to make enough money to pay for their school uniforms and books.
