He also worries about their childhood development as the free public school offers no activities or extra classes for the students after school.  With help from the loan and increased profits from his farm, Inusa hopes that this will change and he will soon be able to provide a better life for his children, giving them more to do both in and out of school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds, and agricultural technologies to increase maize yields

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds, and agricultural technologies to increase maize yields

loans.name: Saade

texts.en:
Saade, 50, from Kwatau village, is a mother of 10 and provides for her family with what she earns from her farm.  Saade joined Babban Gona because she was tired of getting low crop yields year after year and of not being able to earn enough to provide for her family and their needs. Of her 10 children, only two are currently in school because Saade lacks the resources to pay for all 10 of their school fees.  

Saade is excited to be a member of Babban Gona as she now has better tools and instruments to work her land.  By receiving a Babban Gona loan, Saade has the opportunity to reap yields three times as high as the national average and earn at least three times as much as the average Nigerian farmer.  As a Babban Gona member, she understands the importance of using the right inputs to obtain better yields from her farm and appreciates the fact that she now has a means to access them.  A Babban Gona loan will provide her with seeds, fertilizers and technologies to increase the productivity of her land and treat her maize so that it is toxin-free.  In addition, a Babban Gona loan will allow Saade the means to store her crops as well as the ability to sell them at a premium market price.  The larger profits from a better harvest will enable Saade to send more of her children to school.  She looks forward to the day when she is earning enough money to be able afford for all of her children to receive an education.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds, and agricultural technologies to increase maize yields

loans.name: Ummaru

texts.en:
Ummaru, 60, a maize farmer from Garangaramai village, understands that in order for his farm to financially support his family of 15, he will need to make smart investments in his land so that it provides a greater yield.  Ummaru, a father to 13 children, hopes that with the help of Babban Gona, his farm will grow to provide larger profits for him to meet the needs of his large family. By receiving a Babban Gona loan, Ummaru has the opportunity to reap yields three times as high as the national average and earn at least three times as much as the average Nigerian farmer. A Babban Gona loan will provide him with seeds, fertilizers and technologies to treat his maize, as well as the means to store his crops and the ability to sell them at a premium market price.

Ummaru wants to use his Babban Gona profits from this years planting season to rear goats for sale during the  dry season. Ummaru also plans to build a larger home that is well constructed, to ensure the safety of his family and limit his children's exposure, especially the youngest, to toxic materials and bad weather. They are forced to bear these conditions as a result of an ill constructed home that they currently live in.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds, and agricultural technologies to increase maize yields

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds, and agricultural technologies to increase maize yields

loans.name: Leatu

texts.en:
Leatu, 50, lives in Kwatau village with her seven children who she hopes will one day be succesful farmers and encourage others not only in the community but in all of Kaduna state, to see farming and the agricultural sector as a viable career opportunity. Before Babban Gona, Leatu was unable to access most types of seeds due to lack of funds. However, by receiving a Babban Gona loan, Leatu has the opportunity to access high quality hybrid seeds that are guaranteed to increase her yields. A Babban Gona loan will provide Leatu with high-quality seeds as well as fertilizers and technologies to eliminate the toxins from her maize.  In addition, a Babban Gona loan will allow Leatu the means to store her crops as well as the ability to sell them at a premium market price. As a Babban Gona member, Leatu has the opportunity to reap yields three times as high as the national average and earn at least three times as much as the average Nigerian farmer. She is excited about the profits she will earn this year from reaping a large quantity of high quality maize.  

Leatu has big plans for the future; with her Babban Gona profits and new found knowledge on the importance of seed selection, which she acquired through Babban Gona, she wants to open a seed store where she can sell high-quality seeds to other farmers in her village. She plans to run this business during the dry season to supplement her income.  Leatu takes pride in her work as a farmer and being a member of Babban Gona has renewed her love for working on her land.  Now she hopes to see her older children become members of Babban Gona and her younger children take advantage of the added income and health effects of toxin free maize to focus on their education before becoming involved in the family business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds, and agricultural technologies to increase maize yields

loans.name: Yakubu

texts.en:
Yakubu is a 40 year old husband and father of seven who works on his small maize farm in Katsinawa Naakune village.  Yakubu appreciates the training and education he has received from Babban Gona and wants to apply it to his farm in order to increase his profits and turn his farm into a business that can support his entire family.  By receiving a Babban Gona loan, Yakubu has the opportunity to reap yields three times as high as the national average and earn at least three times as much as the average Nigerian farmer.  A Babban Gona loan will provide Yakubu with the fertilizers and seeds he needs to produce a better yield from his maize farm; technologies to eliminate toxins from his maize and the means to store his crops as well as the ability to sell them at a premium market price.   

Like any good father, Yakubu’s main priority is how to best improve the lives of his children and he wants to use the profits from his farm to help support the futures of his three oldest, Tabitha, Salome and Yosia, who want to study medicine, business and acting.  Yakubu’s ultimate goal is to fully mechanize his farm so as to alleviate the burden of manual farming on his family to allow his children to focus solely on their education and to follow their dreams.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds, and agricultural technologies to increase maize yields

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds, and agricultural technologies to increase maize yields

loans.name: Nura

texts.en: Nura, a 28 year old farmer, husband and father from Kwatau village is unable to pay school fees for his three children, Anas, Barawo and Patience. He believes that their future rests on the success of his farm.  By receiving a Babban Gona loan, Nura has the opportunity to reap yields three times as high as the national average and earn at least three times as much as the average Nigerian farmer.  With the help of Babban Gona, Nura has benefited greatly from the education and training and now understands the importance of the right inputs and technologies for getting better crops from his land.  A Babban Gona loan would provide Nura with seeds and fertilizers to use on his farm as well as technologies to create toxin free maize that is healthier for his children. In addition, a Babban Gona loan will allow Nura the means to store his crops as well as the ability to sell them at a premium market price.  Knowing that a better harvest means more profits earned, Nura wants to invest in his farm not only for himself but for the future of his three children.  With the extra profits from an successful harvest, he will be able to pay the school fees to send his children to school, where they can study business.  Nura hopes that with the help of his children, he can turn his family farm into a thriving commercial business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds, and agricultural technologies to increase maize yields

loans.name: Indo

texts.en: As a farmer and mother in a family of 4, Indo, 40, understands the importance of good nutrition in her children's well-being and development.  She and her family live off the profits and food provided by her small maize farm in Kwatau.  To ensure that she will be able to feed her family of four, Indo needs to ensure that she can maximize profits from her 1.1 Hectare plot of land.  This planting season, Indo has set a personal goal to achieve a yield of 5Mt/hectare, which is 3.5 times higher that the national average. As a member of Babban Gona, she is on the path towards achieving this goal. Indo, like every Babban Gona member, has the unique opportunity to reap yields at least three times as high as the national average and earn at least three times as much as the average Nigerian farmer. A Babban Gona loan will make all the difference to Indo because it will give her access to the criticial inputs, such as improved seeds and fertilizer, that she needs to reach her goal of 5Mt. In addition, a Babban Gona loan will allow Indo the means to store her crops as well as the ability to sell them at a premium market price.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds, and agricultural technologies to increase maize yields

loans.name: Halliru

texts.en:
Halliru, 40, is an experienced maize farmer from Pampaida Makaranta village, Kaduna State. This will be Halliru’s second year as a Babban Gona member. Last year, Halliru, with the help of a Babban Gona loan, was able to access high quality fertilizer, improved seeds and mechanization services, which all increased his productivity and profits. This year, a Babban Gona loan will ensure that Halliru has access to the high quality inputs such as hybrid seeds, fertilizers and mechanization services that he needs to cultivate high yields and  high quality of maize. Halliru is very dedicated to his Babban Gona maize business and as a leader in the community he is constantly encouraging other farmers to become members. His children, like many of the children
in the community have come to refer to Babban Gona as the solution to hunger. Halliru has dreams of one day owning a successful commercial farm that will be able to supply large companies like Nestle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds, and agricultural technologies to increase maize yields

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim, 30, is a hardworking maize farmer in Pampaida Makaranta village in Kaduna State. This season, Ibrahim has set a personal goal to achieve 5Mt/Ha, which is approximately 3.5 times higher than the national average yield.  As a Babban Gona member, this is possible; like every Babban Gona member Ibrahim has the opportunity to achieve at least three times the yield and earn three times as much as an average farmer. A Babban Gona loan will help Ibrahim access high quality inputs such as seeds, fertilizers and technologies to remove the toxins from his maize. Ibrahim hopes to continue to grow his farming business through Babban Gona and eventually earn
enough to fully mechanize some of his farming operations. By doing so, he will be able effectively cultivate his land without relying on labor from his children, giving them more time for their studies.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds, and agricultural technologies to increase maize yields

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds, and agricultural technologies to increase maize yields

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim, 48, is a maize farmer from Pampaida Makaranta village in Kaduna State. This will be Ibrahim’s second year as a Babban Gona member. Ibrahim is pleased with the opportunity that Babban Gona provides him to meet the needs of this family of 17. Last year, Ibrahim, with the help of a Babban Gona loan, was able to access high quality fertilizer, improved seeds and mechanization services, all of which improved his productivity and profits. This year, like all Babban Gona members, Ibrahim has the opportunity to increase his yield and profit to 3 times as much as the average farmer. Through a Babban Gona loan, Ibrahim will be able to access seeds, fertilizers and other critical inputs to improve the quality of his agricultural business and increase the quantity of maize that it yields. In addition, Ibrahim hopes to maintain the health of his children by using the Babban Gona loan to access technologies to treat the maize he grows and eliminate the toxins in it so that it is safe and healthy for his children to eat. In the future, he would like to expand his maize farming business to include livestock and irrigation farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds, and agricultural technologies to increase maize yields

loans.name: Markus

texts.en: Markus is a 58 year old maize farmer and father in a family of 20 living in Katsinawa Nakunne village, Kaduna State. Markus needs a Babban Gona loan to access the high quality inputs, such as improved seeds and fertilizer, that he needs to increase his yields. Through these inputs ,that he will receive on credit, Markus has the opportunity to achieve yields three times higher than those of the average Nigerian farmer. In addition, this loan will give Markus the capacity to store his maize and sell in premium markets, allowing him to earn up to three times more than the average Nigerian farmer. Markus hopes to remain a member of Babban Gona and expand his farm throughout Kaduna State, moving from subsistence farming to commercial farming. His goal is that the earnings from his farm will provide his children with a meaningful education and improve the overall lifestyle of his family. He is also pleased with the benefits of the toxin-free maize that he grows as a member of Babban Gona and is excited for the impact this will have on his children’s health.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds, and agricultural technologies to increase maize yields

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds, and agricultural technologies to increase maize yields

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds, and agricultural technologies to increase maize yields

loans.name: Saade

texts.en:
Saade, 45, is a proud female member of Babban Gona. As a maize farmer in Kwatau village in Nigeria, prior to Babban Gona Saade was struggling to support her family of five with her low yields from her land. As a member of Babban Gona, she has experienced an increase in yields and profitability. This year Saade, like all Babban
Gona members, has the opportunity to increase her yield and profit to 3 times as much as the average farmer. A Babban Gona loan will ensure that she is able to access the high quality inputs she needs to increase her yield this season as well as the storage services that give her the opportunity to sell her produce in a premium market. Saade is proud that she can set a good example for her children and hopes to work hard and to grow her business to make her children proud. Through her membership in Babban Gona, Saade has recognized the importance of health and hopes to see her children acquire health education as well as maintaining good health through the toxin-free maize that she now grows. Looking towards the next five years, Saade hopes that she can
work to support other small-scale farmers in rural areas similar to her village.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds, and agricultural technologies to increase maize yields

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds, and agricultural technologies to increase maize yields

loans.name: Sule

texts.en: Sule, 47, has dreams of becoming one of the largest maize producers in the country, expanding his farm to cover his entire community. Sule is happy to be a member of Babban Gona as the loans he receives give him access to high quality inputs such as seeds and fertilizer which improve his productivity. In addition, the Babban Gona loan gives Sule access to storage services that give him the ability to serve his maize at a premium, thus increasing his profitability. This year, Sule plans to grow his Babban Gona maize crop business. He is excited by the training and education provided to farmers, as well as the Babban Gona loans that will help him expand his business and improve the quality of his maize. As the head of a household of 13, Sule also hopes to use the profits from his farm to educate his children with the wish that they will one day be Babban Gona members as well.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds, and agricultural technologies to increase maize yields

loans.name: Abubakar

texts.en: Abubakar is a member of Babban Gona. By receiving a Babban Gona loan, Abubakar has the opportunity to reap yields three times as high as the national average and earn at least three times as much as the average Nigerian farmer. Last year, Abubakar benefited from a Babban Gona loan and this year he is eager to expand his business. This upcoming season, a Babban Gona loan will help Abubakar access the necessary inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds to increase his productivity. He also wants to purchase agricultural technologies that can treat maize to remove the toxins. With an expanded business and more profitable output, Abubakar hopes to grow his farm throughout the Kaduna State into a commercial farming business.  Abubakar hopes that through his Babban Gona earnings, he can better provide for his family. He is excited that his children now eat healthier maize and he would like to see his children grow up to become members of Babban Gona and valuable members of the community. In particular, he would love for his children to contribute to improving the water situation in their community.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds, and agricultural technologies to increase maize yields

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds, and agricultural technologies to increase maize yields

loans.name: Matta

texts.en: Matta, 45, is a mother to a family of four living in Kwatau village. Matta needs a Babban Gona loan to access the high quality inputs such as improved seeds and fertilizer that will help increase her yields. Through these high quality inputs that Matta will receive on credit, she has the opportunity to achieve yields three times higher than those of the average Nigerian farmer. In addition, this loan will give Matta the capacity to store her grain and sell in premium markets, allowing her to earn up to three times more than the average Nigerian farmer. This year, Matta is determined to achieve record yields on her farm. Matta is consistently encouraging other farmers in her community, especially women, to become Babban Gona members. She is excited to see her children’s nutritional health continue to improve as a result of the toxin-free maize that she now grows as a Babban Gona member. Matta hopes that in the next five years, she will be able to improve her family’s life in every aspect including; health, nutrition, education and housing.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds, and agricultural technologies to increase maize yields

loans.name: Usman

texts.en:
Usman, 45, is in his second year as a Babban Gona member. Last year, with the help of a Babban Gona loan he was able to access high quality fertilizer, improved seeds and mechanization services, which all improved his productivity and profits. This year, like all Babban Gona members, Usman has the opportunity to increase his yield and profit 3 times as much as the average Nigerian farmer through a Babban Gona loan which gives him access to high quality inputs such as improved seeds and fertilizers as well as storage services that give him the ability to sell his maize at a premium price. Usman is looking forward to growing his business in Pampaida village, Kaduna, and has his sights set on reaching a record yield 10 Mt per hectare this year.

Usman is confident that in addition to providing financial support for his family of 16 and improving their livelihood, his improved crops will benefit his children's health; by eating toxin-free maize they can lower their chances of contracting harmful diseases. In the next five years, he hopes the success of his farm will have brought about a permanent improvement in his family's standard of living through access to better education and a healthier lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds, and agricultural technologies to increase maize yields

loans.name: Judite

texts.pt:
Solteira sem filhos e sustenta 3 sobrinhos
É comerciante e com o presente empréstimo pretende adquirir a mercadoria (cerveja e refrescos) para a revenda de forma a reforçar o seu negócio
A sua expectativa é do crescimento e expansão da sua actividade comercial pelo q sua primazia será o reembolso rápido de forma a ceder a outros empréstimos.
Factor de saúde como a doença é o desafio para o sucesso da sua actividade
texts.en:
Judite is single and doesn't have any children. She supports three nephews.
She's in retail and intends to use the current loan to purchase merchandise (beer and refreshments) for selling, in order to boost her business.
She hopes to see her business grow and expand, and for that reason she will make it a priority to promptly repay this loan so she can apply for other loans.
Health factors such as illness pose a challenge to the success of her business.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise (beer and refreshments) for selling in order to boost her business.

loans.name: Verano Group

texts.es:
El Grupo "Verano" esta conformado por cinco mujeres y dos hombres todos son personas muy responsables se conocen desde hace varios años han crecido en la misma comunidad, El nombre del grupo lo eligieron ellos mismos porque querian tener un nombre de alguna estacion del año. Los integrantes del grupo estan muy contentos y agradecidos con la institucion porque gracias al credito van a poder invertir en sus actividades como Doña Victorina, Doña Nicolasa y Don Cirilo invertirán en pollos, Doña Josefina invertira en colchas, Abimael inverira en su taxi y Silvia invertira en dulces para su venta. 

Claudia quien ha quedado como representante del grupo cuenta que tiene 19 años esta casada desde hace un año con Fernando quien trabaja en la contruccion aun no tienen dependientes, por el momento se encuntran viviendo en la casa de los padres de Fernnado, Claudia platica que los dos han decidido solicitar un credito para comprar pollos chicos de los cuales Claudia se encargara de cuidar para cuando ya esten grandes y gordos los pueda ofrecer a sus vecinos de su propia comunidad Claudia Argumento "Para mi es muy facil venderlos ya que los mismos vecinos preguntan si no tengo pollos que les venda porque a las personas de aqui les gusta el pollo criado en casa y no los que se vende en el mercado" Claudia ya tiene experiencia en la cria de pollos solo que su unica dificultad por la cual esta atravesando es la falta de un buen corral para establecer sus pollitos aunque con su primera ganacia tendra que hacerlo para que esten mejor y asi no enfermen y mueran.La meta de Claudia es llegar a tener su propia casa y hacer crecer su negocio. Al igual que Claudia los otros integrantes del grupo estan muy agradecidos con Vision Fund y KIVA por el credito otorgado.
texts.en:
The group "Verano" ("summer") is comprised of five women and two men.  All of them are responsible people who have known each other for several years, having grown up in the same community.  They chose the name of the group because they wanted to name it after one of the seasons of the year.  The members of the group are very happy and grateful to the institution, since thanks to this loan, they will be able to invest in their businesses.

Victorina, Nicolasa and Cirilo will invest in chickens. Josefina will invest in quilts, Abimael will invest in her taxi and Sylvia will invest in sweets for resale.

Claudia, who is a representative of the group, is 19 years old and has been married to Fernando for one year.  Fernando works in construction.  At this point they do not have children.  For the time being they are living in the house of Fernando's parents.  Claudia says that the two of them have decided to seek a loan in order to buy chicks that Claudia will be in charge of raising.  When they are grown and fattened, they will be able to sell them to their neighbors in their community.

She adds, "For me it is very easy to sell them since the same neighbors already ask us if we have chickens to sell them. In this area, people prefer home-raised chickens over those that are sold in the market."  She already has experience raising chickens.  Her only difficulty, which she is now in the process of overcoming, is the lack of a good corral for her chicks.  However, with her first earnings she will be able to make improvements to her corral so that no chicks will get sick and die.  Her goal is to have her own home and grow her business.  Like the other members of the group, Claudia is very grateful to Vision Fund and Kiva for this loan opportunity.

loans.use: to buy more chickens.

location.town: Santa Ana Nichi, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase clothing for re-selling.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel tiene 43 años de edad, es casado, tiene 2 hijos y vive en la ciudad de Choloma, Cortes.
Don Manuel desde hace 30 años su fuente de ingreso ha sido la venta de medicinas, ofreciendo variedad como la acetaminofen, panadoles, vitaminas en general, jarabes para la tos etc. la venta la hace de manera ambulante en los alrededores y en las afueras de la ciudad. Manifiesta que por el tiempo que lleva en este negocio tiene sus propios clientes y le ha ido bien, sus ganancias son rentables y le han permitido estabilidad.
en la actualidad esta solicitando su cuarto crédito de 8,000 lempiras que piensa invertirlo en surtir de mas medicamento como panadoles, jarabes, acetaminofen, antiacidos y de otros medicamentos que tiene mayor demanda.
su meta es seguir incrementado sus ventas para  seguir teniendo ingresos que le ayuden al sostenimiento de su familia.
texts.en:
Manuel, age 43, is married and has 2 children.  He lives in the city of Choloma, Cortes.

Manuel’s source of income for 30 years has been selling medicines.  He offers a variety like acetaminophen, Panadol, general vitamins, and cough syrups, etc.  He sells in an itinerant manner around the city and in its outlying areas.  He states that because of the time he has spent in this business, he has his own customers.  It has gone well for him, his income is profitable, and it has allowed him to have stability.

He is currently requesting his fourth loan for 8,000 lempiras.  He plans to invest in stocking more medicines like Panadol, syrups, acetaminophen, antacids, and other medications that have a greater demand.

His goal is to continue increasing his sales in order to continue having income that helps him to support his family.

loans.use: to buy more medicines like Panadol, syrups, acetaminophen, antacids, and other medications that have a greater demand.

loans.name: Cherli

texts.es:
Cherli, de 38 años, es una mujer muy activa, esta casada y tiene tres hijos con quienes vive en la casa de sus padres .Cherli tiene como actividad económica la venta de productos de primera necesidad, ofrece todo tipo de verduras, tubérculos, arroz, azúcar, pan, huevos, entre otros. Adquiere su mercadería comprando al por mayor en el mercado principal de la ciudad y ya en su establecimiento se encarga de distribuirlos a los pobladores de su localidad. Lleva un año en este negocio y le está yendo muy bien, tiene una buena cartera de clientes y eso le ayuda a tener siempre buenas ventas y obtener considerables ganancias, recibe el apoyo de su hija mayor y de su mamá quienes atienden cuando ella está ocupada o no se encuentra en casa. Le gusta mucho su trabajo ya que puede dedicarle el tiempo necesario a cada una de ellas para cumplir a cabalidad con todos sus clientes, lo que no le gusta es que a veces las personas se retrasan en sus pagos, pero aprendió a ser muy paciente y al final siempre consigue que le paguen el monto total de sus deudas y además la experiencia le ha enseñado a reconocer a todo tipo de clientes, le gustaría más adelante poner una tienda de venta de joyas y mejorar su economía. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2000 soles, por tanto agradece la oportunidad y confianza que ponen en ella para recibir éste crédito, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con el monto solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, pan, aceite, leche entre otros.
texts.en:
Cherli, 38, is a very active woman; she is married and has three children who she lives with in her parents' house. Cherli sells staple goods, offering all kinds of vegetables, tubers, rice, sugar, bread and eggs, among others. 

She gets the merchandise wholesale at the city's main market and through her establishment is responsible for distributing it to the people of the town. She has been in business for a year and is doing very well; she has a good customer base which helps her have good sales and earn a significant income. She gets help from her eldest daughter and her mother who tend the store when she is busy or is not at home. 

She loves her job and can dedicate the necessary time to adequately supply her customers. What she doesn't like is when people fall behind on their payments, but she has learned to be very patient and in the end always collects their debts in full. In addition, the experience has taught her to recognize all types of customers. In the future, she would like to open a store selling jewelry and improve her income. 

At this time, she is requesting 2000 soles. She is grateful for the opportunity and the confidence placed in her to receive this loan, and she is committed to paying her dues on time. With this loan, she will buy a larger quantity of groceries like rice, sugar, bread, oil, milk and others.

loans.use: to buy products like rice, sugar, milk, among others.

loans.name: Flor De Puyas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE PUYAS”  iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Celia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de mantas, tienda de barrio, trenzado de mantas, elaboración de picotas, venta de golosinas, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Celia es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de un asesor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de ganadería (compra y venta de animales) y agricultura (siembra de quinua, haba, cebolla y cebada); da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace años comenzando con la comercialización de carne de oveja y posteriormente paso al ganado vacuno.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de animales) que adquirirá de las ferias la comunidad de Batallas, ciudad de La Paz, y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en unión libre.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta le gusta el ahorro y las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The community bank "Flor de Puyas" is starting its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer through its regional office in Achacachi. The group is comprised of eight members and is overseen by a board of directors, whose president is Celia. The members are involved in various businesses, including the knitting and braiding of blankets; the fabrication of pick axes; and the sale of food, groceries and cookies.

The loan they are seeking will benefit these small businesses, one of which is Celia's. She reports that one year ago she joined Pro Mujer at the invitation of an outreach worker who visited her home. Currently she works with livestock (buying and selling animals) and agriculture (growing quinoa, fava beans, onions and barley.  It is worth noting that she started this business years ago, starting out by selling sheep and later added cattle.

The loan she is now seeking will be used to purchase animals, which she will acquire in the markets in the community of Batallas in the city of La Paz. She will then sell the animals from her stall. This form of work enables her to generate resources to support her household in the best way that she can. She lives with her common-law husband.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the savings and the trainings they provide in the areas of health and finance.

loans.use: to buy animals.

loans.name: Vicente Guerrero Group

texts.es:
Mirna es miembro del grupo Vicente Guerrero, ella es una mujer muy 

trabajadora, alegre y emprendedora por mas de 6 años se ha dedicado al comercio 

vendiendo moldes de plástico para comida, cosméticos y zapatos por catalogo. 


"A mi me gusta estar activa siempre haciendo algo que se que va dejar una ganancia y es bonito conozco 

gente, visito a mis amigos y gano dinero. Con los prestamos que nos han dado me 

ayudo porque tengo el dinero junto y de jalón me surto después voy acomodando y 

va saliendo para todo"

Ella realiza sus ventas casa por casa, con sus amigos y vecinos de la comunidad, 

atraves de estos 6 años ha ganado buenos clientes lo que ayuda a que venda mas y 

sus ganancias sean buenas.

cuando ella inicio esta actividad fue porque quería trabajar y ganar su propio dinero 

pero sin descuidar su hogar, entonces la invitaron a vender por catalogo y decidió 

intentarlo probo, le gusto la venta.

ella invertirá este crédito en la compra de cosméticos(esmaltes, labiales, 

delineadores, sombras, maquillajes, desodorantes y perfumes ), variedad de zapatos 

y trastes.

Mirna tiene la edad de 41 años, solo estudio preparatoria y esta casada con Daniel 

que trabaja como profesor y tienen dos hijas.

ha futuro le gustaría poder establecerse rentar un local en el cual vender pero sin 

dejar de vender por las casas y que sus hijas puedan estudiar una carrera 

profesional.

las demás integrantes del grupo:
Paulina venta de abarrotes, 
Vianey del Carmen venta de abarrotes, 
Juana Maria venta de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Mirna is a member of the group Vicente Guerrero. She is a hard working, happy, and enterprising woman. For more than 6 years she has worked in the sale of plastic molds for food, cosmetics, and shoes by catalog. 

“I like this activity. It has always been something that creates an income and it is nice knowing people. I visit my friends and I earn money. The loans that they have given us have helped me to put the money all together and with one go allowed me to supply products. Later I rearrange products and I get ahead. “

She completes her sales house by house with her friends and neighbors from the community.  Across these 6 years she has gained good clients that have helped her to sell more and have good earnings. 

She began this work because she wanted to work and earn her own money, but without neglecting her household.  They invited her to sell by catalog and she decided to try it out.  She ended up liking sales.  

She will invest this loan in the purchase of cosmetics (nail polish, lipsticks, liners, shades, makeup, deodorants, and perfumes), variety of shoes, and dishes. 

Miran is 41-years-old, she only studied in High school, and is married to Daniel who works as a teacher. They have two daughters.

In the future she would like to be able to rent a space where she can sell her products, but without leaving her sales made by going to homes.  Also, she would like that her daughters be able to study a professional career.  

The other members of the group: Paulina sells at a food shop, Vianey Del Carmen sells at a food shop, Juana Maria sells at food shops.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of shoes, cosmetics and dishes

loans.name: Juan Ramon

texts.es:
Juan, DE 50 años de edad, casado, padre de 4 hijos. Él es originario de la comarca El Potrillo en las afueras de Teustepe. Se dedica a la crianza de Ganado y venta de granos básicos. Tiene más de 20 años trabajando en la agricultura en especial con la crianza de animales. Adicional tiene una mini pulpería donde vende granos básicos y gaseosas. De sus 4 hijos solo mantiene a su hija menor la cual está por finalizar la secundaria el resto de sus hijos viven independiente.
Su principal actividad en la venta de leche, la producción que obtiene la vende en su misma comarca . Su esposa y su hija menor son las que ayudan con la pulpería  mientras el sale a vender la leche.  
Él está necesitando el financiamiento para comprar granos básicos, aceite, papel higiénico, jugos, gaseosas y compra  de alambre para reparar las cercas y tener en mejores condiciones a sus animales. Sus expectativas en este año son mejorar la producción de leche, tener más ganado, hacer crecer su pulpería y continuar ayudando a su hija con sus estudios.
texts.en:
50-year-old Juan is married with four children. He is originally from the region of El Potrillo, on the outskirts of Teustepe. He makes a living by breeding livestock and selling staple foods. He has worked in agriculture for more than twenty years, particularly in the area of animal breeding. He also has a mini grocery store where he sells staple foods and sodas. Of his four children, he only looks after his underage daughter, who is finishing secondary school. The rest of his children have left home. His main activity is selling milk; he sells what he produces within the same region. His wife and his underage daughter help in the grocery store while he goes out to sell the milk.

He needs financing in order to buy staple foods, oil, toilet paper, juice, and sodas, as well as wire to repair his fences and keep his animals in better conditions. His expectations for this year are to improve his milk production, have more livestock, make his grocery store business grow, and continue helping his daughter with her studies.

loans.use: to buy staple foods, oil, toilet paper, juice, soda, and wire.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sand, blocks, cement, iron, and zinc laminates, among other things

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es: Marlene tiene la edad de 25 años, es casada y tiene dos hijos. Ella el crédito lo quiere para la compra de una vaca de leche. El negocio del ganado le ayudará a ella y a su familia a salir adelante. Es la primera vez que Marlene se financia con FUDECOSUR. Ella espera que con este proyecto crezca y logre sus objetivos y así pueda en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Marlene is 25 years old. She is married and has two children. She is asking for this loan because she wants to buy a cow for milking. The livestock business will help her and her family to get ahead. This is the first time that Marlene has asked for funding from FUDECOSUR.

With this project she hopes to grow her business and achieve her goals, and so in the future will be able to offer her family a better quality of life and more economic stability. This is the first loan she has received from FUDECOSUR. She has not previously taken out any loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered her the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: buy a cow for milking.

loans.name: Delmy Elizabeth

texts.es: La Sra Delmy Elizabeth, de 38 años, se dedica al cultivo del maiz y el sorgo, es responsable y trabajadora, conocida por su buen record crediticio. Ella vive en compañia de sus 5 hijos, 2 de los cuales aun dependen de ella. Solicita financiamiento para comprar insumos agricolas para su cultivos.
texts.en:
Ms. Delmy Elizabeth, 38 years old, works growing corn and sorghum. She is responsible and hard-working, and known for her good credit record. 

She lives with her five children, two of whom are dependent on her. She is asking for the loan to buy agricultural supplies for her farming.

loans.use: compra de insumos agricolas

location.town: CANTON LOS TOLES, CASERÍO LA ANGOSTURA

loans.name: Mabel Ismary

texts.es:
La Sra. Mabel  vive Guayaquil. Ella empezó su negocio vendiendo cosméticos como perfumes, cremas, maquillaje, etc.  Es una mujer soltera con dos hijos menores de edad por quien se esfuerza diariamente para darles lo mejor, ella ha sido padre y madre para sus hijos, ellos estudian en escuela fiscal.

A pesar que en donde hace sus ventas van muchas personas y hay buena oportunidad de vender. Ella realiza su negocio sola desde la mañana hasta las 5:00 de la tarde vendiendo sus productos. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar perfumes, cosmeticos, cremas para poder incrementar mas en sus ventas y crecer el negocio y asi mejorar su vivienda para así darles un mejor vivir y educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mabel lives in Guayaquil.  She started a business selling cosmetics like perfumes, creams, and make-up, etc.  She is a single woman with two minor children.  She puts forth great effort daily in order to give them the best.  She has been father and mother to her children.  They go to a public school.

There are a lot of people where she makes her sales, and it is a good sales opportunity.  She works in her business alone, and she sells her products from the morning until five in the afternoon.  

She wants to use the loan to buy perfumes, cosmetics, and creams in order to be able to increase her sales and to make her business grow.  This way she will improve her housing in order to live better, and she will give her children an education.

loans.use: to buy perfume and cosmetics.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La Cliente; empezó el negocio por medio de una amiga que le sugirió en hacerlo, lo cual lo logro y no tiene ningún problema hasta ahora. 

Lo realiza sola vendiendo los productos de Nature's Garden, su dificultad son las enfermedades ya que es PVVS (Paciente viviendo con Vih Sida) que puede llegar a tener en un futuro .Es casada, su esposo realiza la labor de guardia, tienen hijos pero todos son mayores de edad.

Su sueño es poder seguir mejorando con su negocio con mas productos, por eso quiere comprar con el prestamo vitaminas, energisantes y asi porder continuar con su vida y poder vivir mejor junto con su familia.
texts.en:
This client started her business by way of a friend who suggested she do this.  She managed to do it, and so far she has had no problems.

She works alone selling Nature’s Garden products.  Her difficulty is illness because she is a “PVVS” (patient living with HIV/AIDS), which she could come to have in the future.  She is married, and her husband does guard work.  They have children, but they are all grown.

Her dream is to be able to continue improving her business with more products.  Therefore, she wants to use the loan to buy vitamins and energy drinks.  This way she will be able to continue with her life, and she will be able to live better with her family.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and energy drinks.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en: Ana runs a small stall selling snacks, drinks, etc., and mobile phone airtime credits. Recently, she has been working as a private employee and has five persons living in her house. She joined Ruma four months ago and still feels really excited to expand her business selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments for her customers. For the last three months, she has made around $20 - $50 per day on average for sales (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business grows, she needs more working capital in order to be able to do transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions

loans.name: Margarita

texts.ru: Маргарита занимается выращиванием овощей в теплицах. Выращивает огурцы, помидоры, редис, капусту. Недавно построила дополнительную теплицу. Денег потратила больше, чем рассчитывала. Поэтому теперь нужны дополнительные средства для бизнеса. За счет кредитв в 20,000 гривен Маргарита сможет вовремя посеять качественные семена в хорошую удобренную землю, подремонтировать старые теплицы, привести их в порядок.
texts.en: Margarita cultivates vegetables in greenhouses.  She grows cucumbers, tomatoes, radishes and cabbage.  She recently built an additional greenhouse and ended up spending more money than she had expected.  This is why she needs additional funding for her business.  With her loan of 20,000 hryvnia, Margarita will be able to promptly sow good-quality seeds into a nicely fertilized soil, and to repair her old greenhouses and make them work.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer, and to repair an old greenhouse.

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.es:
Cesar tiene 35 años de edad, es soltero y vive con su madre en una aldea de Peña Blanca, Cortes.
Cesar desde hace 15 años se dedica a la compra y venta de pescado, el hace las ventas las hace de manera ambulante, dice que este negocio es bastante rentable ya que la demanda del pescado es muy buena.  Como otro ingreso extra Cesar vende también artículos para el hogar.
En la actualidad el solicita el crédito numero once de 21,000 lempiras y lo necesita para la compra de pescado fresco para la venta, con este crédito aumentaran las ganancias y podrá seguir invirtiendo en el negocio.
La meta es seguir trabajando y expandir su negocio a otros lugares.
texts.en:
Cesar is 35 years old, single, and lives with his mother in a village near Peña Blanca, Cortes. Cesar has been buying and selling fish for 15 years. He sells as a street vendor. He says that this business is quite profitable, as the demand for fish is very good. 

As an extra source of income, Cesar also sells articles for the household. Currently he is applying for his 11th loan, in the amount of 21,000 lempiras, and needs it to buy fresh fish to sell.  

With this loan he will increase his earnings, and be able to continue investing in the business. His goal is to continue working and to expand his business to other locations.

loans.use: To buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Sebastian

texts.es: Sebastian tiene 24 años, es soltero y con una gran responsabilidad que es su pequeña Geraldine de 9 años, posee una vivienda construida  base de adobe .Sebastian se  dedica a la producción de cacao y café orgánico desde hace 5 años, ya que obtuvo  unas parcelas  a un precio cómodo de parte de la asociación de productores de cacao.En sus tierras recibe la ayuda de trabajadores del lugar quienes le brindan todo el apoyo del caso en cuanto a actividades colectivas se refiere logrando así culminar las labores cotidianas en menor tiempo. No obstante la temporada de lluvias es una época en donde las tareas de mantenimiento se ven afectadas por el lodo y caminos resbalosos y al  estar próximo a finalizar con la compaña productiva desea contar con el apoyo de su entidad financiera y preparar capital para la cosecha de las mazorcas las cuales deben hacerse de manera fluida para completar el último paso en cuanto a la secuencia de tareas en busca del resultado deseado.Sus objetivos a largo plazo apuntan a la compra de un vehiculo para ser usado en el transporte de sus granos de cacao logrando de esta manera disminuir los costos adicionales que le generan el transporte.Requiere para esta ocasión contar con 1,000 nuevos soles y contar con trabajadores para la temporada de cosecha que esta por iniciarse.
texts.en: Sebastian is 24 years old.  He is single and his main responsibility is his little girl, Geraldine.  He has a house built of adobe. For the past five years, Sebastian has been growing organic coffee and cacao on plots of land he bought at an affordable price from the cacao producers association.  On-site laborers help him on his land, and with their collective efforts, they complete the daily tasks in less time.  However, the rainy season is a time when maintenance tasks are affected by mud and slippery roads. As he is close to ending with a profit, he wishes to have the support of the financial institution and be financially prepared for the corncob harvesting, a process which must be performed smoothly in order to complete the final step in the sequence of tasks and achieve the desired result.  His long-term goal is to purchase a vehicle to be used for the transport of cacao grains thereby reducing the additional costs for transport. At this time, he needs 1,000 nuevos soles to hire laborers for the harvest season that is about to start.

loans.use: to hire on-site laborers.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es:
Don Jorge tiene 63 años de edad, es casado, tiene un hijo y vive con su familia en una aldea de San Juan Pueblo.
Don Jorge estableció un negocio de una pequeña pulperia en donde vende productos de la canasta básica, abarroteria,  refrescos, carnes, embutidos etc. Este ha sido su fuente de ingreso desde hace 16 años donde ha podido mantener a su familia. Ayudado por su esposa trabajan juntos casi todo el día  con su esposa. Y esta muy agradecido con Odef por la oportunidad  financiera que le brindaron para poder invertir en su negocio.
Ahora solicita el quinto préstamo de 25,000 lempiras para la compra de producto que le hacen falta en el negocio como, abarrotes, frijoles, harina, refrescos, medicinas carnes y otros productos de primera necesidad en el hogar. Para ofrecer variedad de productos a sus clientes.
Su meta es seguir trabajando en el negocio e incrementar las ventas
texts.en:
Jorge is 63 years old, married, and has a son.  He lives with his family in a village near San Juan Pueblo.

Jorge started up his own grocery store business, where he sells staple consumer goods such as groceries, drinks, meat, sausages, etc.  This business has been his source of income for 16 years, and it has enabled him to support his family.  His wife helps him with the business, and they work together almost all day long.  Jorge is very grateful to ODEF for the financing opportunity that they are providing him which will enable him to invest in his business.

He is now requesting a loan for 25,000 Honduran lempiras to buy products that he lacks for his business, such as groceries, beans, flour, drinks, medicines, meat, and other basic household products.  This will allow him to offer a greater variety of products to his customers.  

Jorge's goal is to continue to work in the business and increase his sales.

loans.use: to buy staple consumer goods such as beans, flour, rice, cornflour, butter, etc.

loans.name: Adda Lidia

texts.es: Adda, es originaria de la comarca Las Canoas, Teustepe, casada tiene una niña de 2 años de edad, tiene una pulpería de venta  de arroz, frijol azúcar, aceite, gaseosa ,refrescos la cual la inicio hace un año con un dinerito que tenía ahorrado ya que trabajo en Costa Rica como como empleada doméstica donde laboro por 4 años. Hoy Adda también obtiene ayuda de su marido quien trabaja en Costa Rica y con lo cual  ha mejorado su casa, pero está solicitando este crédito ya que necesita comprar una refrigeradora para su negocio  lo cual le ayudara mantener los refrescos y gaseosas  bien fríos sobre todo ahora durante la época de verano ya que la refrigeradora que tenia se le daño  y no tiene con qué helar el producto  y con el nuevo activo piensa mejorar sus ventas. Dentro de sus  planes futuros es ahorrar un poco de dinero a través de los ingresos de su venta  así como de las remesas que le manda el marido desde Costa Rica para poner una línea de venta de muebles.
texts.en: Adda is a native of the Las Canoas district of Teustepe. She is married and has a daughter who is 2 years old. She has a grocery store where she sells rice, beans, sugar, oil, soft drinks, and beverages. She set up her store a year ago with a little money that she had saved, since she worked in Costa Rica as a domestic employee for four years. Now Adda also has help from her husband, who works in Costa Rica, and with it she has improved her house, but she is applying for this loan since she needs to buy a refrigerator for her business. This will help her keep the beverages and soft drinks well chilled, especially now during the summer season, since the refrigerator that she has is damaged, and she doesn't have anything to chill the products. With the new asset, she thinks she will improve her sales. Among her future plans is to save a little money through the income from her sales, as well as from the remittances that her husband sends her from Costa Rica, to set up a line of furniture sales.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Weoya Group

texts.en:
Weoya is a group of 16 farmers in Chwele District represented by Robert. The group has 10 women and six men. Robert is on the right of the photo with his hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to him on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant half an acre of maize, millet and sorghum. Robert first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2010 Long Rains season and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Robert joined One Acre Fund in order to access the best input prices and use the increased profits to send his children to school. 

Robert reports that before One Acre Fund, he was able to grow about 0.75 bag of maize per acre, but with his One Acre Fund input loan during Long Rains 2012, he harvested 18 bags per acre! He plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and grow enough food for the family. 

For the 2013 Long Rains season, Robert’s group members will take input loans of half an acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 8 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for cultivation of maize, millet and sorghum.

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is 28 years old. She lives in Ozurgeti District with her husband, her two infant children and her parents-in-law. Nino requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan requests were always rejected because of her low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have a vineyard, a plot of land where 400 nut trees are grown and a milk cow. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Nino requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit, Nino will rent a place to open a plastic shop. She plans to purchase stock of plastic dishes to sell in her shop. Nino will work as a saleslady and will do her best to increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to open a plastic shop.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando is a married man with nine children. He is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rolando is 45 years old and has four children who are in school.

Rolando has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. He requested a 50,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of his motorcycle.

Rolando has been in this business for nine years. He would like to save enough to provide a secure future for his family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of his motorcycle.

loans.name: Mwichina Group

texts.en:
Washington’s group has 12 farmers and is located in the Kakamega South District of Kenya. Washington is pictured on the right of Mwichina Group with his hand raised. Washington is pictured amongst the eight men and four women of his group. His loan will allow him to plant ½ an acre with sorghum, millet, and maize. Washington first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2011 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Washington joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and to grow enough food for the family.

Washington reports that before One Acre Fund, he was able to grow about 2.6 bags of maize per acre, but with his One Acre Fund loan during Long Rains 2012, he harvested 15 bags per acre! He plans on using future profits from the harvest to buy a cow. Washington’s group members will each receive loans to support a ½ acre during the 2013 Long Rains season. In total they will receive supplies for 6 acres of maize and sorghum.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet and sorghum.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es: Pilar, de 51 años, esta casada y tiene 2 hijos de 25 y 12 años de edad respectivamente , vive en su casa propia y actualmente vive únicamente con su nieto quien es su principal motivo para seguir adelante. El trabajo de Pilar consiste en la compra y venta de madera de distintas especies forestales. Trabaja vendiendo a sus clientes previa solicitud o coordinación con ellos. Principalmente trabaja con las especies mas solicitadas como bolaína, cedro, capirona y catahua, ya que son las especies maderables de mejor precio. Lleva en este trabajo recién 1 año, trabaja con el apoyo de su hija y de su yerno quienes la apoyan en la ubicación de la madera en otras ciudades. Aprendió a realizar este oficio hace poco ya que anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de pollos pero decidió cambiar al rubro forestal porque considera que percibe mayores ganancias por ello.Le gusta su trabajo, pues le da tiempo para realizar otras actividades en su vivienda, cada día se convence mas que la actividad a la que se dedica es muy buena ya que tiene muchos clientes fijos quienes están a la espera de su producción.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 4000 soles y está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero para  continuar aumentando su capital de trabajo . El monto solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de madera de diversas especies que luego se encargará de vender y enviar a otras ciudades.
texts.en: Pilar, who is 51 years old, is married and has two children, ages 25 and 12. She lives in her own house and now lives with only her grandson, who is her principal motivation to continue advancing. Pilar's work is buying and selling wood of various types. She sells wood to her customers on request or by coordinating with them. She mainly works with the species that are most requested, such as bolaína, cedar, capirona, and catahua, which are the best lumber species at a good price. She has been in this work for one year. She works with the support of her daughter and her son-in-law, who help her in placing the wood in other cities. She learned to do this work a little while ago, since in the past she sold chickens, but she decided to change to the forestry sector because she thought that she would receive better earnings in it. She likes her work, since it gives her time to do other activities in her home. Every day she is more convinced that the activity in which she is working is very good, since she has many regular customers who wait for her products. At this time she is applying for 4000 PEN, and she is very happy to know that she has financial support to continue increasing her working capital. She will invest the amount she has applied for in purchasing wood of different types that she will sell and send to other cities.

loans.use: to buy wood

loans.name: Robert John

texts.en:
Robert John is a 37 year old married man and a father of five young children from Talibon, Bohol, in the Philippines. He sells cold snack foods, for example: coconut ice popsicles.

Robert John is asking for a loan to buy more coconut ice popsicles and other cold snacks. With this, he will be able to improve his sales and income.
In the future, Robert John hopes to make his business sustainable and profitable.

loans.use: to buy more coconut ice popsicles and other cold snacks.

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.en:
Rosanna is 43 years old and married with three children.

Rosanna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to buy snack food, bread, sugar, canned goods, and other stock for her general store.

Rosanna has borrowed and repaid two previous loans from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and earns additional income raising hogs.

Rosanna aspires to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy snack food, bread, sugar, canned goods, and other stock for her general store.

loans.name: Deo

texts.en:
Deo is a 52-year-old married man with nine children living in Kasese, Uganda. 

Six years ago he joined the police force, driven to serve by his love for the country. Poor work policies and low pay affect his morale at work, and his dream is to venture into commercialized agriculture in order to meet the basic needs of his family. 

Deo intends to use the loan to pay school fees for his children

loans.use: to pay for school fees.

loans.name: Intan Ii Group

texts.en:
Intan II Group has been running for one year and six months. The group is located in a small town in Indonesia called Cilacap. The group consists of 15 people. Their businesses include selling bed linens, wallets and handbags; selling snacks; selling fried snacks and soy milk; opening a small diner; selling phone credit, LPG, pastries, and vegetables. Because they have been a group together for a long time, they are very close to each other and always look out for each other. When one of them was sick, they collected donations to help pay for the medical expenses and they visited her often.

Intan II Group is headed by Turyati. Turyati is a single parent with two children – one still in school. Turyati has a business selling various items like bed linens. Her customers purchase the products through credit and pay back in small installments. With this loan, Turyati wants to add other products like clothing and bags. Since there is a lot of competition in the field, she's hoping that she can have her own stall in the next five years. 

Other members of the group also plan to add products to their inventory. Hopefully this will increase the business earnings for each of the group members.

loans.use: to add other products like clothing and bags

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Hilaria works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transportation business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming vegetables. Hilaria is borrowing 11,000 PHP through NWTF to buy spare parts for her motorcycle transportation business.

Hilaria has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her motorcycle transport.

loans.name: Vilma Lisseth

texts.es: Vilma es una excelente microempresaria de éxito tiene 46 años de edad, casada y con dos hijos mayores, desde hace 11 años se dedica a comercializar ropa nueva, cosméticos de la Avon, Zermat, y artículos de bellezas, de estar con la institución tiene 7 años consecutivos que ha demostrado puntualidad en sus pagos, es una mujer casada con muchos ánimos de salir adelante con su negocio. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de toallas, chinelas, pantalón de varón, camisetas, shores, bóxer de varón, tobilleras de varón, bóxer de mujer etc.
texts.en:
Vilma is an excellent microfinance entrepreneur. She is 46 years old, married, and has 2 older children. For the past 11 years she has worked selling new clothing, Avon cosmetics, Zermat fragrances, and beauty products. She has been with this institution for 7 consecutive years, during which she has demonstrated punctuality with her payments. She is a married woman with much energy to move forward with her business.

She will invest the loan in the purchase of towels, slippers, boys' pants, shirts, shorts, boys' boxers, ankle braces, women's undergarments, etc.

loans.use: to buy slippers, boys' pants, shirts, shorts, boys' boxers, ankle braces, women's undergarments, etc.

loans.name: Od Group

texts.en:
The Od Group is made up of 2 partners, Ophelia and Mariam, who have been together since 2012.  They trade food items and perform hairdressing, respectively.  They reside at Lartebiokorshie in Dansoman.  

Ophilia is a 53-year-old trader who is living with her grandson.  She has been with ID Ghana for the past year and is doing very well in her business.  She has been doing this food business for 15 years now.  She is grateful to ID Ghana for the training on savings which motivated her to save to achieve her dream.  This is her 3rd loan and she needs GHS 400 to buy more items to sell.  

This group needs a total amount of GHS 800 to buy more goods to sell to their customers in the community.

loans.use: to buy food to sell, such as cassava, plantains, and groundnuts.

loans.name: Naa Aku

texts.en:
Naa Aku is a 36 year-old woman married to Theophilus, a 41 year-old trader. They are blessed with 3 children. She belongs to a group located at Opetekwei in Dansoman.

She is a seamstress and has been trading for the past 6 years. She gets her products from Makola and sells to her customers in and around Dansoman. She is very dedicated to her customers.

She has been a member of ID since 2012. This is her 2nd loan and she needs an amount of GHS 700 to expand her business.

She will buy materials to sew children's clothing to sell to customers

loans.use: to buy materials to sew children's clothing to sell

loans.name: Karen Del Carmen

texts.es: Karen de 29 años de edad vive al sur de la ciudad con su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 4 a 13 años; ella tiene 6 años de dedicarse a la actividad comercial, pues lo aprendió de su madre quien se dedicare a ello y le daba mercancía para que Karen vendiera. Una vez estuvo preparada para independizarse adquirió un crédito con el cual compró mercancía y poco a poco creó su propia clientela a la que hoy le debe sus ingresos con el que apoya el bienestar de su hogar. Sus principales artículos son ropa para dama cubrelechos, toallas y ropa interior, los cuales solicitan sus clientes para pagárselos a crédito. Su día de trabajo comercial empieza a las 9 de la mañana y lo termina las 4 de la tarde combinando estas actividades con las de su hogar.  Sus principales clientes son sus vecinos del barrio y referidos que poca a poco se convierten en sus fieles compradores y amplían su mercado. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará artículos para el hogar ropa interior y exterior para darle gusto a su mejor clientela y con ello generar nuevos ingresos que van destinados a complementar los gastos de su hogar, porque su propósito es lograr que sus hijos se eduquen y puedan ser muy exitosos para ella y su cónyuge sentirse satisfechos por el deber cumplido.
texts.en: Karen is 29 years old and lives in the south of the city with her husband and their three children aged between four and 13. She has been working in retail for six years after learning the trade from her mother, who also worked in retail and used to give Karen merchandise to sell. Once she was ready to work on her own, Karen got a loan which she used to buy merchandise, and, little by little, she formed her own clientele who now maintain her business. She uses the income she earns to contribute towards household expenses. She mainly sells women’s clothing, comforters, towels, and underwear to her customers who pay her on credit. Her working day begins at 9 a.m. and ends at 4 p.m., after which she concentrates on the housework. Her main customers are the people from her neighborhood and their contacts, who have gradually become her loyal customers and allowed her business to grow. She is currently requesting a Kiva loan, her first funding from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy household goods, underwear, and other clothing to create more income to pay the household expenses. Her aim is to ensure her children's education so that they are successful and her and her husband can feel satisfied with their work.

loans.use: to buy household goods and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mentari Group

texts.en:
For six years, this women's self-help group has been working together. The name of the group is “The Mentari”. The group has 12 women members and is located in the city of Cilacap, Indonesia. The group members have various businesses including grocery store, catering, boarding house, selling traditional herbal medicine, tailoring, soup kiosk, selling refreshments and selling hand-knitted items. The group members are very close to each other. They complement and trust each other. They meet every month at each other’s home.

Heriyani is the leader of this group. She has three children. She often encourages the other members. She has a stall selling snacks to schools. She also opened a juice stall. The loan from Kiva was very meaningful to her family. Heriyani will use this loan to buy a cart to sell juice around. She hopes to increase her daily revenue and be able to meet the daily needs of her families. 

The other members of the group plan to add different products to sell in their businesses.

loans.use: to buy a cart to sell juice around

loans.name: Irakli

texts.en:
Irakli is 37 years old.  He is married and lives in the Baghdati District with his wife, two infant sons, and parents.  Irakli requested a loan from the local financial institutions several times for a family start-up business, but without any success.  His loan requests were always rejected due to low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is from agricultural activities.  In particular, they have 3 milk cows, a pig, and a vineyard.  They sell cheese products and wine locally.  It is hardly enough to provide food for the family.  According to Credo estimates, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Irakli’s loan request to Credo was approved in the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo.  The start-up loan program envisages the provision of credits with soft conditions to country rural poor.  This group does not have access to credit products, as they are regarded as “high-risk borrowers” due to low income.  

With the received credit, Irakli will build a greenhouse.  Irakli plans to sow tomatoes and greens in his greenhouse, which will be sold locally at a good price.  This will increase the income of their family.  The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse in order to grow tomatoes and greens.

loans.name: Jeleta

texts.en:
Jeleta is 56 years old and widowed with nine children. She is in the agricultural business raising livestock in the Philippines. Jeleta requested a loan of 19,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional livestock. She has been raising livestock for three years now, and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF (and more recently, from Kiva) to sustain her business.

Jeleta works tirelessly to attain her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to raise.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 56 years old and married, and she runs an agricultural business fattening pigs in the Philippines. Angelina has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Angelina has been in pig fattening for ten years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to sustain the operation.

In the future, Angelina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Aleksandre

texts.en:
Aleksandre is 42 years old. He lives in the Gurjaani District with his parents, brother, sister in-law, and an infant nephew. Aleksandre requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected each time,because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

His family owns a vineyard and small plot of agricultural land. Aleksandre and his father harvest grapes to make wine that they sell locally at the markets. They earn a small monthly income which is the only source of income of the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Aleksandre has requested loan from Credo to start-up a family business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products as they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit Aleksandre will purchase melon saplings. He and his father will cultivate land to sow melons to harvest and sell locally at the markets. The profit will be used to reinvest in the same business and he will sew more melon which will increase the family income. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan will give Aleksandre a chance to improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To purchase melon saplings

loans.name: Yehya

texts.en:
Yehya is a 41 year-old married man living with his wife and three children. Two of his children are studying while his youngest child is working. 

Yehya is a hard worker looking to satisfy his family needs. He has many years of experience in his present job.  He’s an independent painter who works upon client’s requests. He works on different projects and always tries to offer his customers the best results. He’s known for being well-organized and punctual. Today, he’s asking for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase added painting tools. Yehya is grateful for all the good things God has given him. In the near future, he looks to take more projects maybe outside the country if this will help him learn new designs and how to better develop his business.

loans.use: to purchase added painting tools

loans.name: Alex

texts.es: Alex ha incrementado su producción desde el último crédito que obtuvo de Fundación Alternativa. Su esposa Diana de 30 años ha podido seguir con los quehaceres de su hogar y con el cuidado personalizado de sus dos hijos, uno de los cuales, gracias a su propio esfuerzo y al de sus padres ya pudo ingresar a una escuela particular de mejor calidad. El negocio de la ganadería Alex lo heredó de sus hermanos mayores con quienes desde muy niño iba a la feria. Como su negocio ha crecido hoy requiere un crédito para que sus animales puedan estar bien cuidados y así puedan ser vendidos en un buen precio en la feria de animales del pueblo. Éste lo utilizará en la compra de insumos de aseo, vitaminas, medicinas y alimentos que hagan que el ganado se mantenga sano y no haya complicaciones al ofertarlo frente a los compradores. Su sueño de tener una vivienda propia poco a poco va tomando forma, pues en la actualidad ya tiene un lote de terreno que es el inicio de la obtención de este sueño, sobre el cual empezará la construcción de su vivienda ya que el terreno donde actualmente vive es de su madre y él quiere tener algo propio que sus hijos puedan heredar.
texts.en:
Alex has increased his production since the last loan that he obtained from Fundacion Alternativa. His wife Diana, who is 30 years old, has been able to continue with the household chores and with the personalized care of their two children. One of their children, thanks to his own efforts and that of his parents, already was able to be admitted to a particular school of the best quality. 

Alex inherited the business of stockbreeding from his older brothers, with whom he went to the town fair since he was a boy. As his business has grown, today he requires a loan so that his animals can be well taken care of, and be sold at a good price in the town's fair. He will use the loan to buy cleaning supplies, vitamins, and food which allow the cattle to stay healthy, and so that there are not complications upon offering them to buyers. His dream is to have a home of his own. Little by little the dream is taking form. Currently he already has a plot of land which is the start of obtaining this dream. On this land he will start the construction of his home. The land where he currently lives belongs to his mother and he wants to have something of his own that his children can inherit.

loans.use: to buy supplies, food, and medicine for the care of his animals.

loans.name: Teodula

texts.en: Teodula is 52 years old and married with two children, one who is currently in school.  She works very hard to provide for them.  Teodula runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for 10 years.  She requested a 15,000 PHP loan to purchase more items to sell in her general store, such as bread, snack foods, canned goods, and candies.  In the future, Teodula would like to save enough money to send her child to college.

loans.use: to purchase food items for her general store.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
This is Martha, from the Adom Nhyira loan group. She is 30 years old. She is a hairdresser. She has been doing this business for the past six years and does well. 

In July 2009, Martha was introduced to ID Ghana by another beneficiary of the credit organization. She has many good things to tell others about ID Ghana and how it has helped her grow her business. 

Martha is a committed and hardworking individual who is also innovative in all she does. This is her 6th loan, and she needs 600 GHS to buy more products to satisfy the customers in her community.

She will use the loan to purchase wigs, weavons (hair extensions), and hair cream to serve her customers.

loans.use: to buy wigs, hair extensions, and hair cream.

loans.name: Janipher
