texts.en: Janipher is a 44-year-old married lady with six children between the ages of 8 and 27 years old.  She owns an auto parts shop and a chemist in Kaiboi, earning a monthly income of 60,000 KES.  She is servicing her 5th loan of 70,000 KES with KADET LTD and intends to use this amount to buy more spare parts and to pay school fees for her children.  The profits she receives will be invested back into her businesses.  Her dream is to see her children receive the best education and also to prosper in both of her businesses.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, doors, and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Shidha's Group

texts.en: Shidha is a forty-one year old dryland farmer and mother of seven children; her husband is a farmer too. They grow maize, cowpeas and cassava. Shidha and her husband's agricultural business is affected by insects and pests, but they do not have the money to buy insecticides. She is joining the KOMAZA microforestry program to earn money to support her family. With the proceeds from her tree farm, Shidha plans to provide the best education possible for her children, who are all currently attending school. She would also like to open a retail shop and buy land for her family.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training, and plantation maintenance support

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
Sheila is a married woman and is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 38 years old and has two children who are in school.

Sheila has a direct selling business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to buy more items like lotion, slippers, sandals, soap, etc. to sell.

Sheila has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Sheila would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items like lotion, slippers, sandals, soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Jumwa's Group

texts.en: Jumwa is a 37-year-old dry land farmer and a mother of nine children.  She grows maize and cassava, but her maize crop is often infested with a stalk borer as she does not have enough money to buy insecticide.  Jumwa is joining the KOMAZA micro-forestry program because "KOMAZA is helping people to make investments in trees."  She says her village is doing the project and she does not want to be left out.  Jumwa plans to use the profits from her tree farm to educate her children, six of whom are currently in school.  She aspires to be "a woman who can open a business and build a good home."

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training, and plantation maintenance.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a 37-year-old farmer.  She is a single mother of one child (age 10).  She has been practicing farming for the past twelve years, receiving a monthly income of 15,000 KES, which she uses to support her family.  Nancy is applying for her first loan term with KADET LTD after being recently introduced by a KADET staff member.

She will use the loan to purchase fertilizer, pesticides, and seedlings for her farm.  With the anticipated profits from this business she will start a pig-keeping project.  Her hopes and dreams are to educate her child.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, pesticides, and seedlings.

loans.name: Jose Del Carmen

texts.es: El señor José de 44 años de edad, habita en las afueras de Teustepe municipio de Boaco, de oficio agricultor padre de tres hijos de 15,13 y 8 años de edad respectivamente. Su principal actividad es la siembra de maíz y frijol desde hace 18 años por su propia cuenta. Pues antes de casarse trabajaba junto con su padre, después trabajo como obrero en otras fincas limpiando y cuidando animales para ahorrar y comprar sus propias herramientas para cultivar. La mayor parte de su cosecha la vende en la misma comunidad, también tiene sus vaquitas las cuales le sirven a él para producir leche aunque la producción es baja pues no tiene muchos animales. El ciclo de siembras de arroz está por comenzar, es por eso que está necesitando el financiamiento para comprar abono, fertilizante, semilla, pago de mano de obra. El crédito le ayudara a tener los insumos necesarios para sacar su producción de arroz a tiempo y con calidad. Uno de sus siguientes pasos es tener más ganado para vender leche y fortalecer las siembras de frijoles y arroz para mejorar los ingresos y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
José, 44, lives on the outskirts of Teustepe, a municipality of Boaco. He is a farmer by trade and the father of three children, aged 15, 13, and 8 respectively. His main activity has been growing corn and beans on his own for 18 years. Before he got married, he worked together with his father. Afterwards, he worked as a laborer on other farms, cleaning and caring for animals in order to save and buy his own tools for farming. He sells the majority of his harvest in the same community. He also has cows which produce milk, but the production is low since he doesn't have many animals. 
The growing season for rice is about to begin. It's for this reason that he needs this loan to buy manure, fertilizer, seed, and to cover labor costs. The loan will help him to have the necessary supplies to have his rice production on time and with quality. One of his next steps is to have more livestock to sell milk and to strengthen his rice and bean farming to improve his income and provide his children with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer, seed, and to cover labor costs.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is married with four children, and one currently goes to school. She also takes care of additional family members (grand children). She has a retail shop business and sells smoked fish. She has been in this business for five years. She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Uganda shillings from   MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, cooking oil and baskets of fish. She also generates additional income through selling piped water and dry cleaning. She works at the market seven days a week and sells to all categories of people on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She aspires to build rental rooms and to become a wholesaler. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity, but not piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and paying for electricity.

loans.use: to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, and bags of smoked fish

loans.name: Sergei

texts.ru:
Сергей занимается выращиванием овощей в теплицах в с Водяное. Он живет с женой и тремя детьми в своем доме. Старшему сыну 14 лет, среднему 11, оба учатся в школе; младшей девочке 5 месяцев. Жена со старшими детьми помогает Сергею в работе. В основном, они выращивают помидоры, огурцы, редис.

В этом году от снега упала большая теплица. Сергею срочно понадобился кредит для ее восстановления. Хорошо, что Сергей - сварщик, будет делать работу сам. Деньги нужны на материал, а также на укрепление еще двух теплиц, а то они не выдерживают наших снегопадов.

Сергея можно охарактеризовать как трудолюбивого, честного, семейного человека. У него большая тепличная ферма, которую он постоянно развивает.
texts.en: Sergei is involved in growing vegetables in greenhouses in Vodyanoye.  He lives with his wife and three children in their house.  The oldest son is 14 years old, the middle is 11, and they both attend a school; the youngest daughter is 5 months old.  The wife and older children help Sergei with the work.  They primarily grow tomatoes, cucumbers and radishes.  A large greenhouse fell this year due to snow.  Sergei urgently needs a loan to repair it.  It is good that Sergei is a welder and can do the work himself.  The money is needed for the parts and for reinforcing two more greenhouses because they are not surviving our snowfalls.  Sergei can described as a hardworking and honest family man.  He has a large greenhouse farm, which he constantly develops.

loans.use: to repair greenhouses

loans.name: Vasiliy

texts.ru: Василий - сварщик-рихтовщик с большим стажем. Он занимается ремонтом и восстановлением легковых автомобилей. Когда у Василия мало заказов, он находит и покупает старую машину, восстанавливает ее и продает. Это бизнес помогает Василию содержать свою семью. Василий просит предоставить ему кредит для покупки автомобиля российского производства ВАЗ21099 и материалов для ремонта.
texts.en: Vasiliy is a welder with extensive experience.  He is involved in repairing and restoring passenger cars.  Vasiliy finds and buys an old car whenever he does not have many work orders, restores and sells it.  This business helps him to support his family.  Vasiliy is requesting this loan to purchase a Russian-made VAZ21099 car and parts for repairs.

loans.use: to purchase an old car for restoration and resale

loans.name: Larisa

texts.ru: Лариса продает женскую одежду на рынке. Благодаря предыдущему кредиту Лариса закупила свитера, брюки, кофты и получила дополнительную прибыль с продаж. В этот раз Лариса просит предоставить ей кредит для закупки весеннего товара - легких блуз и кофт. Лариса с оптимизмом ожидает прихода весны, а с ней и увеличение торговых оборотов, как как люди переодеваются и покупают весенние вещи. У Ларисы много постоянных клиентов, которые покупают вещи у нее, а Лариса предоставляет им хороший товар и хорошие скидки.
texts.en: Larisa sells women's clothing at a market.  Thanks to the previous loan, she purchased sweaters, pants, blouses and earned an additional profit from sales.  This time, Larisa is requesting a loan to purchase spring merchandise - light blouses and shirts.  Larisa is optimistically awaiting spring and an increase in turnover because people update their wardrobe and buy spring goods.  Larisa has many loyal customers, who buy goods from her, and she provides them with good merchandise and good discounts.

loans.use: to purchase spring merchandise - light blouses and shirts

loans.name: Clodouard

texts.en:
Clodouard is a 50-year-old man from Rulindo District in the Northern Province of Rwanda. He is seeking a loan of $50 to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just $0.20. 

Clodouard started selling lights in October 2012, and he has sold 20 lights to date, providing clean energy to 100 people. With the money he makes from selling and recharging lights, he will pay for the school fees of his four children (Victoire, Marie Grace, Isidore, and Fidele).

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia has already repaid her first loan, and she is happy with it since her business is doing fine and having many customers. She wants to take the second loan to restock her shop with a variety of products like washing detergents, cooking fat and other stock.

Virginia's shop was very attractive after adding some stock to her shop, and it attracted so many customers. Her family has succeeded in life, and their two children are educated to higher levels.

loans.use: to buy washing detergents, cooking fat and other stock.

loans.name: Karine

texts.ru:
Карине  родилась в городе Капан , живет в селе Гетишен Сюникской области вместе с мужем и дочерью . Сын Карине находится на заработках в Российской Федерации и часто помогает семье в Армении. Карине 47 лет.   Карине занимается сельским хозяйством  почти как 20лет,они вместе с мужем  имеют в селе Гетишен собственную землю, пчел, крупный рогатый скот ,кроликов. 
Карине сельскохозяйственную продукцию  которую с семьей с трудом получают от их хозяйства  реализует в городах  Капан и Каджаран. Она  имеет знакомых, друзей родствеников  , которые помогают им по реализации сельскохозяйственной продукции у которых есть  собственные  магазины и лавки в капане и Каджаране . 
Последние годы Карине усердно занимается пчеловодством. Она прочла много литературы про пчел и исследовала сама как надо правильно ухаживать за пчелами чтобы получить качественный  и экологически чистый мед. Как Карине призналась во первых надо любить пчел и надо иметь  много терпения чтобы достич хорошего результата. 
Карине нуждается в кредите на суммы  700,000 Армянских драм для покупки пчел и улeй для развития своего пчеловодства .
texts.en: Karine was born in the city of Kapan and lives together with her husband and daughter in the Getishen village of the Syunik district.  Her son is working in the Russian Federation and often helps his family in Armenia.  Karine is 47 years old.  She has been involved in agriculture for almost 20 years.  She and her husband have land in the Getishen village, bees, cattle and rabbits.  Karine sells the agricultural products, which her family works hard to produce, in the cities of Kapan and Kadjaran.  She has acquaintances, friends and family, who help her with selling agricultural products because they have stores in Kapan and Kadjaran.  Karine has been diligently involved in beekeeping the last few years.  She read a lot of literature about bees and researched how to correctly care for them in order to obtain quality and ecologically-clean honey.  As Karine confessed, one has to first love bees and have a lot of patience to get a good result.  Karine needs a loan in the amount of 700,000 Armenian dram to purchase bees and hives to develop her beekeeping business.

loans.use: to purchase bees and hives to develop her beekeeping business

loans.name: Monilyn

texts.en:
Monilyn is married to a farmer and they live happily in a rural community. She is 26 years old and has no children yet therefore, she took care one of her nephew. Together with her husband, she plans to earn and save more income to satisfy their necessities and to build their own house someday. 

For this purpose, Monilyn aims to improve her small variety store to generate sufficient income. She is asking for an additional capital of P10,000 to improve the business. She intends to use the loan in buying more stocks of soft drinks, snack foods, rice, beverages, seasonings and farm inputs to sell. She hopes that someday, she will make the business more viable and profitable.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of soft drinks, snack foods, rice, beverages, seasonings and farm inputs to sell

loans.name: Liana

texts.ru:
Лиана  родилась и живет  в городе Капан Сюникской области. Она училась  в Капанском строительном техникуме на экономиста. 
Лиана  вышла замуж в раннем возрасте. Лиане  сейчас 37 лет  она вдова , муж умер во время автокатастрофы.
У Лианы есть сын с которым она  проживает вместе с ее родителями . мать Лианы больная а отец преподает в Капанском строительном коледже.Так как Лиана одна воспитывает сына она делает все чтоб он вырос достойным гражданином своей страны, получил хорошее образование и жил без трудностей и счастливо.   
После смерти мужа Лиана  открыла свой бизнес и почти как четыре года продает продукты питания , одежду и посуду в арендованном магазине в Капане. Раз в месяц она покупает товары на оптовых рынках Еревана  и перепродает их в своем магазине в Капане. У нее уже много клиентов которые предпочитают покупать одежду , посуду и кухонные аксесуары из магазина Лианы. Она очень счастлива что со своим тяжким трудом может содержать семью, помогать отцу в хозяйстве и оплатить лечение больной матери. 
Лиана в 2009 году уже сотрудничила с Кива и это уже ее второй кредит с помощью которого Лиана хочет купить большую партию весенней одежды из Еревана и много кухонных аксесуаров и посуды. Скоро большой Христианский праздник Пасха и она надеется получить хорошую прибыль от предпраздничных распродаж.
texts.en: Liana was born and lives in the city of Kapan of the Siyunik district.  She studied to become an economist at the Kapan construction college.  Liana got married at an early age.  Liana is now 37 years old and a widow; her husband died in a car accident.  Liana has a son, who lives with her along with her parents.  Liana's mother is ill, and father teaches at the Kapan construction college.  Because Liana is raising her son by herself, she does everything to make sure that he grows up to be a deserving citizen of his country, obtains good education and lives happily and without difficulties.  After her husband's death, Liana opened her own business and has been selling food products, clothing and dishware in a leased store in Kapan for almost four years.  Once a month, she buys merchandise at wholesale markets in Yerevan and resells it at her store in Kapan.  She already has many customers, who prefer to buy clothing, dishware and kitchen accessories from Liana's store.  She is very happy that her hard work can support her family, help her father with the household and pay for her ill mother's treatment.  Liana worked with Kiva in 2009, and this is her second loan, with which help she wants to purchase a large inventory of spring merchandise from Yerevan and many kitchen accessories and dishware.  A large Christian holiday of Easter is coming up, and she hopes to make a good profit from holiday sales.

loans.use: to purchase a large inventory of spring merchandise from Yerevan and many kitchen accessories and dishware

loans.name: Juleta

texts.ru:
Джулета родилась в 1953г. в  городе Капан  Сюникской области.Сейчас проживает вместе с мужем в поселке Багабурдж(Baghaburj) Сюникской области. Джулета окончила Ереванский торговый техникум. Она долгие годы занимается сельским хозяйством. В огороде у Джулеты  растет картофель,огурцы,помидоры,бакладжан и много других овощей , а так же много фруктов. Но особенно Джулета ухаживает за курами и индейками. У нее большой курятник рядом с домом где держит много кур. У нее уже много клиентов которые прямо с ее дома покупают яйца и куриное мясо. В хозяйстве ей помогает муж который в свободное от его работы время помогает жене реализовать фрукты и овощи в рынках Капана . 
Джулета решила умножить количество кур и купть корм для кур  на весенний период и для этого просит кредит на сумму 200,000 Армянских драм.
texts.en: Juleta was born in 1953 in the city of Kapan of Siyunik district.  Now she lives together with her husband in the Baghaburj village of the Siyunik district.  Juleta graduated from the Yerevan retail college.  She has been involved in agriculture for many years.  She grows potatoes, cucumbers, tomatoes, eggplant and many other vegetables in her garden, and also many fruits.  But Juleta especially cares for chickens and turkeys.  She has a large chicken farm near her house, where she keeps many chickens.  She already has many customers, who buy eggs and chicken meat right from her house.  Her husband helps his wife to sell fruits and vegetables at markets in Kapan during his free time.  Juleta decided to increase the number of chickens and buy feed for them for the spring period and this is why she is requesting a loan in the amount of 200,000 Armenian dram.

loans.use: to increase the number of chickens and buy feed for them for the spring period

loans.name: Jenebeba

texts.en:
A $1000.00 loan is offered to Jenebeba to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to shop every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as biscuits, noodles, sugar, coffee and bread. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2012. She feels comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Jenebeba independent because she can be responsible for herself and her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy noodles, coffee, sugar, salt, shampoo, and bread.

loans.name: Lulalane

texts.en:
Lulalane manages a retail store and a rice field. She has been running her retail store for five years. With the help of her husband, she is able to increase her profit. Now, she still hopes for continuous progress of her retail store, that’s why she is seeking a loan of PHP 40,000. This amount will be used to buy cases of soft drinks, eggs, three cans of cooking oil, two boxes of fish sauce, soap and 20 containers of assorted biscuits for her store.  

Lulalane believes that her success depends on her wise management and strong determination to uplift her living situation out of poverty. She expects the continuous smooth flow of her income so she can make her retail business a viable source of income.

loans.use: to buy  cases of soft drinks, eggs, three cans of cooking oil, two boxes of fish sauce, soap and 20 boxes of assorted biscuits for her store

loans.name: Victoriano

texts.en:
This is Victoriano. He previously accessed a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan that he used to buy spare parts and accessories and pay for the maintenance of the Jeepney unit. His earnings were a big help for the education of his children and in his personal, household and business expenditures. 

He would like to apply for a new 13,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and pay for the maintenance of the Jeepney unit and also to buy some equipment for his repair shop. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain his daily needs and the educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Victoriano hopes to have more jeepney units and dreams to give his children a good life and education. Every week, he meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of the jeepney unit.

loans.name: Joselyn

texts.en:
Early marriage is not a hindrance for not performing the responsibilities in the family well. Joselyn shares that she was only 17 years old when she got married. They have been blessed with four children and three of them are already professionals, only the youngest is still studying in college level of education.

Joselyn is 46 years old; her business is selling 'red eggs' and 'balut' that comes from their ducks' eggs. She has been in this business for 19 years. Her income from the business serves to cover her children's fees and allowances in school. Joselyn dreams of seeing her youngest child finish her education. She wants to continue operating the business to support her child's needs in school. Joselyn is requesting a loan of P50,000 to buy feed for her ducks.

loans.use: to buy feed for her ducks.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Leocadia

texts.en: Leocadia, who is 42 years old, is a native of Ybanag. She lives with her partner and is a mother of five. She owns a small store. She started out in the same business, selling a variety of vegetables. But she needed a way to subsist and to generate income for herself. Today, with a lot of effort and hard work, she has made her business a success. With the earnings generated from her store, Leocadia was able to start another business, selling different fruits and vegetables. Leocadia feels quite satisfied with her store because it makes money every day. Leocadia's hope is to continue growing her business. She needs the loan to purchase basic supplies like rice, beans, corn, sugar and cooking oil. She has as a goal expanding her business and improving her store's appearance in order to attract more customers.

loans.use: to purchase basic supplies like rice, beans, corn, sugar, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Arceli

texts.en: Arceli is 60 years old and lives with her husband in their home in the Pilitan community, 25 kilometers from the town of Tumuini. They work cultivating maize (corn) intended purely for feed for their pigs. They also breed pigs in a small shed they have. The revenue they get from the sale of their pigs covers their children’s education, clothing, food and other costs. She is requesting a loan to purchase feed and piglets. They need nutritionally balanced feed in order to fatten the pigs so they can be more profitable. This will allow them to lead a more comfortable life and cover the costs of all their necessities.

loans.use: to purchase two piglets and feed for them.

loans.name: Illuminada

texts.en: Illuminada is married and has four children. She is 42 years old and lives in Tumuini. She is an entrepreneur and manages her own store to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase stock for her store such as shampoo, toothpaste, salt and vinegar. In the future, Illuminada hopes to expand her general store business.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her store such as shampoo, toothpaste, salt and vinegar.

loans.name: Otiliana

texts.en: Otiliana, age 57, operates a vulcanizing service to earn an income. She has run her business for the past five years. "I was lucky," she says, "because from the very beginning this service went very well, and I have been developing a steady clientele since then." She adds, "In the near future, probably in a year or so, I plan to open a second service of this kind and hire someone to help me out." She is requesting a loan in order to buy wire and a machine for her vulcanizing shop.

loans.use: to buy wire and a machine for her vulcanizing shop.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en: Mildred is 37 years old and married to a driver. They are harmoniously residing together with their four children in the village of Calaoagan. Together with her husband she bought a motorcycle to use for their transportation business. She has managed a motorcycle transport business for almost seven months, and is earning a net income of PHP 9,000 a month. She would like to request a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to pay for the repairs and maintenance of their motorcycle. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can continue to improve her business.

loans.use: To pay for the repairs and maintenance of their motorcycle

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Jerry works hard to support his family. He is single and has a fishing business in the Philippines. Jerry has been in this business for seven years now.

He requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase materials for the repair of his fishing boat. In the future, Jerry would like to save money to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the repair of his fishing boat.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is 52 years old and married with six children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting corn for sale. She has been in this business for more than 10 years and earns 3,000PHP every month. Erlinda joined GDMPC in 2011. She has requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is 55 years old and married with two children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a farmland, planting and harvesting banana for sale in the local community to earn a living. She has been with her business for more than four years and earns 5,000 PHP every month. Erlinda joined GDMPC in 2011. She has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en: Liezel is 34 years old and married with one child. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. To earn a living, Liezel operates a business raising pigs for sale in the local community. She has been in this business for a while. She earns more than 4,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2011. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase feed for her pigs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Conrado

texts.en: Conrado is 55 years old, married, and has three children. He lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. To earn a living, he owns and operates farmland, where he plants and harvests rice for sale. He has had his business for more than 10 years and earns 16,000 PHP every month. He joined GDMPC in 2010. Now he has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Kristine

texts.en:
Hard work and perseverance have been Kristine's guiding principle in running her footwear business. She has been running this kind of business for one year. Aside from footwear, she also owns a home-based store. Kristine is 22 years of age and married to an Overseas Filipino Worker (OFW).The couple has been blessed with two children. Kristine's husband work is computer technician.

Kristine's earned income goes to their daily necessities, investment in some appliances such a washing machine, a rice cooker and some goes toward the rental of her footwear stall. She wants to keep her footwear store profitable and productive and that's the reason why she's asking for additional capital of PHP 15,000. She will be using this loan to buy stocks of sandals, shoes and slippers. She knows that through this loan, she can help her husband in generating funds which will enable her to improve her financial stability and give her two children quality education someday.

loans.use: to buy stocks of sandals, shoes and slippers for her footwear business

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina is from the village of Centro 3, Angadanan. She is 48 years old,  is married, and has four children. 

To make a living, Faustina is engaged in a sari-sari store. She has been running her business for almost 20 years. She earns about a minimum of PHP 350 a day. 

Right now, she is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 6,000 to buy canned goods, beverages, condiments and assorted bread to sell.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages, condiments and assorted bread to sell.

loans.name: Juliet's Group

texts.en: Juliet is a 36-year-old mother of six and a businesswoman. She sells potatoes and porridge, but does not have enough money to diversify the food products she offers her customers. Juliet is joining the KOMAZA microforestry program because she knows that when "the trees are sold, I will get money to expand my business and send my kids to school." She aspires to be able to provide a university education for her children and install electricity and running water in her home.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support

loans.name: Godelio

texts.en: Godelio is 49 years old and single. He lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He owns and operates a beauty salon in the community to earn a living. He has had his business for more than five years and earns 10,000 PHP every month. He joined GDMPC last year to gain access to financial services in order to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase additional tools for providing hair services. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional tools for providing hair services

loans.name: Bella

texts.en: Bella is 43 years old, married and has two children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns a farmland where she plants and harvests rice for sale. She has been in this business for over three years and earns 10,000 PHP every month. She has joined GDMPC in 2009 and now she has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en: Pacita is 67 years old, married, and has seven children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns farmland where she plants and harvest rice for sale in the local community to earn a living. She has been in this business for over 10 years and earns 8,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living and business situation. And now she has requested a loan of 10,000PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Charita

texts.en:
Charita is 50 years old, married, and has four children. She lives in Tambulig, Misamis Occidental. 
She owns farmland where she plants and harvest rice for sale in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over nine years and earns 30,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in year 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 35,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en: Marcelina is 54 years old, widowed, and has one child. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a business selling fish in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over six years and earns 10,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in year 2010 and now she has requested a loan of 11,500 PHP to purchase additional fish to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma is 40 years old, married with five children. She lives in Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a business vegetables for sale in the local community to earn a living. She has been with her business for almost three years and earns 5,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in the year 2009 and now she has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Reymunda

texts.en: Reymunda is 56 years old and married with four children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a banana production in the local community to earn a living. She has been with her business for more than six years and earns 10,000 PHP every month. She has joined GDMPC in 2007. Now she has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Maniyn

texts.en: Manilyn is 20 years old and separated.  She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental.  To earn a living, she owns and manages a banana production business in the local community.  She has been with her business for over two years and earns 3,000 PHP every month. She has joined GDMPC in 2011 and now she has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers, such as manure.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from this loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is from  Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 51 years old. Erlinda is married and has six children. To make a living, Erlinda owns and operates a specialized general store. She has been engaged in her business for five years and earns 20,000  PHP (Philippines pesos) a month for these activities. 

In 2007, Erlinda joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items such as candies, Milo, shampoo, soaps, canned goods and rice. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, Milo, shampoo, soaps, canned goods and rice.

loans.name: Iris

texts.en: Iris is 33 years old and single. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a food production business to earn a living in the local community. She has been with her business for over two years and earns 8,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Now she has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional items such as longanisa (pork sausages) and dried fish. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase food items such as longanisa and dried fish.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en: Zeinab is a 23-year-old Lebanese engaged woman living with her parents. Her father is the one looking to satisfy his family needs. But since his income is not enough to cover the family expenses, Zeinab decided to start working as a hairdresser receiving customers at home. She’s a brave young woman who is running a business and at the same time taking care of her family. With her requested youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l, she will purchase new hairdressing tools and supplies to better serve her clients. She hopes her business will grow so she is able to collect money and get married soon.

loans.use: to purchase new hairdressing tools and supplies

loans.name: Wafa

texts.en:
Wafa is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her brother appears in her Kiva profile photo next to the refrigerator Wafa bought.

Wafa is a married woman from Rafah city and a mother of four children. Wafa and her husband work full time jobs to cover the family's needs, but the income is still not enough.

Wafa is requesting a Murabaha loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing a new refrigerator and washing machine. This will allow her to improve the living conditions for her family.
 
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to buy a new refrigerator and washing machine

loans.name: Favourite Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 30-year-old Shelly from Mutare. She is married with two children, both attending school.  Shelly runs a retail business selling clothes, blankets and footwear. The business has been in operation for five years. She says the main challenge faced is lack of capital to meet demand. Shelly has requested a loan of $400 to purchase more stock for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the general family welfare. In the future, Shelly plans to employ other people, create employment and own a boutique shop in town.

loans.use: To buy clothes, blankets and footwear for resale

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
This is Arlyn, 32, a resident of Tondo, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Noel, a vendor, and is a mother to her children. She and her husband manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Arlyn sells different vegetables. She buys different vegetables and then sells her products to markets and vegetable stores that she regularly supplies, and to the local community. She also sells charcoal for additional income.  She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy different vegetables needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Arlyn dreams to expand her business and have her own stall for her growing business. She hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her *co-fellowship members every week to share stories of her life and business and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for different vegetables needed in her business.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling rice grains in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice grains to sell for her business.

Nenita has been in this business for eight years. Nenita earns additional income from farming rice.

Nenita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Angie

texts.en:
Angie is 36 years old and married. She has four children.

Angie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like bread, candies, soft drinks and other groceries needed in her business.

Angie has borrowed and paid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport, ice vending and food vending.

Angie aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like bread, candies, softdrinks and other groceries needed to her business.

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda is 50 years old and married with six children. All of her children are in school, and she works very hard to provide for them.

Gilda runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 10000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries like sardines, soap, sugar and other miscellaneous items.

Gilda has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, noodles, and school supplies. 

In the future, Gilda would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like sardines, soap, sugar and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is 45-years-old, married and has five children who are all in school. Leonida works very hard to provide for them.

Leonida runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. Leonida has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future, Leonida would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more items like snack foods, canned goods and school supplies.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
This is Julieta. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help cover her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Julieta dreams for continuous growth in her business and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies with the group.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Carmelo

texts.en: Carmelo is a fisherman from Bien Unido, Bohol. He is a married man and a father of three children. Carmelo has been engaged in the fishing business for more than 4 years now. This is the source of his income. He is asking for a loan to buy fuel for the boat. In the future, Carmelo hopes to expand his business and make it a success. Moreover, he wants to save money for the schooling of his children and to repay his loan.

loans.use: to buy fuel for the boat

loans.name: Mamela

texts.en:
Mamela is 43 years old, married, and she has five children, of whom three are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a furniture-making business in the Philippines. 

Mamela requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF, to purchase additional materials for building furniture. She has been in this business for 20 years.

She would like to save money, so she could expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for making furniture

loans.name: Venus

texts.en:
Venus is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business making and selling peanut butter in the Philippines. 

He is borrowing 30,000  PHP(Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase more stock of peanuts to make peanut butter.

Venus has been in this business for 20 years. Venus earns more income from a variety store.

Venus has been sustaining his business activities through his own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. He dreams to save enough money to expand his business and repair his family home.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of peanuts to make peanut butter.

loans.name: Rita's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of three members: Rita, Vicentia and Regina. Rita and Vicentia sell smoked fish while Regina is a seamstress. They reside at Bortianor in the Dansoman community. They have been together since 31 January 2012 and are still doing very well.

Rita is a 26-year-old smoked fish seller and married to George, a 29-year-old teacher. They have a child to the glory of the Lord. Rita has been with ID Ghana for the past one year and she is doing very well. She has been in this business activity for five years now. She works from Monday to Saturday. 

This is her third loan and she needs GHS 500 to buy more fish to sell to her customers. She is grateful to ID Ghana. 

Rita, Vicentia and Regina need a total amount of GHS 1,150 to buy more stock and sell to their customers in the Dansoman community.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Teimuraz

texts.en:
Teimuraz is 40 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and retired mother in Gurjaani district. Teimuraz requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Teimuraz is working as an artisan on privet construction and as a security guard. His wife and mother are working as cleaners. His wife works at the hotel and his mother at the local police station. They all get small monthly payments, which are not enough for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Teimuraz requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. His loan request was approved in the frame of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, which do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit, Teimuraz will purchase piglets. He will raise them and, in the future, sell them as meat locally at the markets. They will use the profit to buy more piglets.  He considers his business to be profitable, as it generates a good income that enables him to improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To purchase piglets

loans.name: Elsa's Group

texts.en:
Elsa is 41 years old and lives in Lusot, Baliangao. She is married and has three children. Elsa has a mat- and rug-making business, and she earns approximately PHP 3,500 each month doing this work.

She has a requested a loan to acquire a parcel of coco land. Elsa has been a member of PMPC for five years. She is the leader of a two-person group. Although they are borrowing this loan as a group, each member of the group has her own business.

loans.use: To acquire a parcel of coco land

loans.name: Claudio

texts.en: Claudio is a 44-year-old married man and father of three children, ages 18, 15 and 12.  Claudio is engaged in the motorcycle transport business.  He is asking for a loan to buy spare parts for his motorcycle (nuts and bolts) and fertilizer for his farm.  With this, he will able to improve his business and make it a success.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and fertilizer.

loans.name: Miralin

texts.en:
Miralin is a 28-year-old married woman and the mother of 2 young children from Talibon, Bohol. She has been engaged in a hog-raising business for more than 5 years now.

She is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets and feeds for the pigs. In the future, Miralin hopes of improving her hog-raising business and saving money for the future schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and feed for the pigs

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila is a 58 year old farmer from Talibon, Bohol. Teofila has been engaged in a rice-farming business for more than three years now. 

Toefila needs a loan for the improvement of her farm. For this, she joined CEVI to gain access to the loan services offered by the organization to micro-entrepreneurs like her. With a loan, Teofila will be able to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. 

In the future, Teofila has hopes of making her farming business sustainable and profitable.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Kunthea

texts.en:
Kunthea, age 48, sells tamarind to earn an income. This allows her to supplement the income provided by her husband, who works as a vet in their village. She is a rural villager residing in the Ponhea Leur district of Kandal Province and has five children, two of whom are students. Her business allows her to help overcome the daily financial hardships experienced by the family.

Kunthea has been with VisionFund for the past three cycles and she has completely and successfully repaid her loans. The loan funds have enabled her to gradually improve her family's living conditions. 

She is currently dealing with a significant challenge because her son is just starting as a freshman at the local university in Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. He is specializing in law. To overcome this challenge and to help her son to pursue his studies, Kunthea has applied for an education loan with VisionFund. 

She wants this loan to provide financial support for her son so that he can focus on his studies and obtain a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay for her son's university fees

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is 58 years old, married, and has three adult children.  She is from Talibon, Bohol and is engaged in a food business, selling home cooked foods to the people in her area.

Josie is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy additional ingredients, such as meat, vegetables, cooking oil, and seasonings. Josie believes that this loan will help her improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Judith's Group

texts.en: Judith is a 22-year-old businesswoman. She buys and sells sisal, but is faced with high transport costs when moving her product from the rural production area to the urban market, resulting in low profits. Judith is joining the KOMAZA microforestry program because she says, "Since I am a farmer, I found it beneficial to plant trees provided by KOMAZA since they will be sold." With the proceeds from her tree farm, Judith wants to build a permanent house. She says, "I see myself to have change financially so that I can say it's because of KOMAZA."

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 21-year-old Lebanese engaged man living with his only parent and two siblings. He is the one taking care of the family and covering their needs. Not to forget Ali’s big and important role in maintaining and supporting his father in every single, small detail concerning their family, Ali opened an internet cafe in his town in 2008. People also meet at his place to enjoy their time with friends, play internet games and take a coffee. Today, he needs to borrow a youth loan from Kiva's Partner Vitas s.a.l to change his café’s interior design. In that way, he will be able to receive more clients and surely earn higher revenues. In the near future, he’s planning to open a snack shop near his internet cafe.

loans.use: to change his café’s interior design

loans.name: Kitsao's Group

texts.en: Kitsao is a 55-year-old dryland farmer and father of 10 children. His agricultural endeavors are largely challenged by pests and insects. Kitsao is joining the KOMAZA microforestry program because it is a long-term investment and he knows he has a guaranteed market for his trees. He plans to educate his children with the proceeds from his tree farm.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is 50 years old and a tailor in Mwaroni Ukunda, Mombasa, Kenya. He is married and his wife earns additional income. Together, they support three people. He has been in the tailoring business for the last 15 years and he has done great.

This marks his second borrowing from KADET LTD, after paying the first loan successfully. He will purchase cloth materials for making school uniforms and dozens of spools of sewing thread. He will use the anticipated profit to expand his workshop. He hopes to be the best uniform dealer in Ukunda.

loans.use: to purchase cloth material and thread

loans.name: Gulnaz

texts.en: Ms Gulnaz is a 28-year-old married woman and a mother to one child. She has been running a business of clothes selling for many years. She buys a variety of kids clothes from the main city market and sells them to people in her local community. She started her business because it was very difficult for her to meet her family's household needs with only the small income of her husband. Therefore, she decided to help initiate her own business to contribute to the family income. Now, she plays a very important role in supporting her family. She has been in association with Kashf for the past two years. Currently, she is requesting a loan of amount of PKR 25,000, which will allow her to purchase a greater selection of clothes in various colors and designs to attract more customers. Gulnaz expects a boost in her net income through her large sales and wishes to spend part of profit on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase a greater selection of clothes in various colors and designs to attract more customers.

loans.name: Alphonse

texts.en: Alphonse is a 47-year-old man from Rulindo District in the Northern Province of Rwanda. He is seeking a loan of $50 to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just $0.20. Alphonse started selling lights in October 2012, and he has sold 20 lights to date, providing clean energy to 100 people. With the money he makes from selling and recharging lights, he will pay the school fees for his three children (Desange, Fitina, and Merisa).

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en: Ms Nazia is a 25-year-old, married woman and a mother of three kids. She has been running a business of cloths trade for many years. She purchases a variety of cloths from the main city and then sells it to the people in her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality cloth in her community. Nazia requested a loan of PKR 30,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different cloths for the summer season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through her greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different cloths for the summer season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers.

loans.name: Nafi Group

texts.en:
The group is made up of two members who have been accessing loans from ID-Ghana since 2012. They are Nafisah and Sabama. They both sell charcoal.

ID Ghana has been of great service to them since they have been able to grow their small businesses through the credit scheme. Nafisa is a 29-year-old trader. She has six years of experience. She works six days a week (from Monday to Saturday). She is constantly working to improve her business capital. 

This is her second loan with ID-Ghana and she is requesting an amount of GHS 700 to buy more charcoal to sell to her customers in the community.

The entire group needs a total amount of GHS 1,100 for business expansion and to meet customers’ demand.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and sell to customers.

loans.name: Hameeda's Group

texts.en:
Hameeda is 32 years old and is a very hardworking lady. She is a responsible mother of four children. 

She is an efficient and excellent tailor by profession. She provides tailoring services in her community. Her customers always appreciate her work. Her tailoring machine stopped working recently, so she can't continue her business. Therefore, as a member of a 7-person lending group, she has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a new tailoring machine. It will help her to continue her business as her income plays a vital role in the family's net income. 

She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.  

Note: In the picture Hameeda raises her hand and one borrower is holding her baby.

loans.use: to purchase a new tailoring machine to continue her business.

loans.name: Kpanah

texts.en: Kpanah lives in Sinkor, an area where the living conditions are almost like they are for people who live in the center of Monrovia. She is 38 years old, married with five children between ages of 13 to 23 who are in school and live at home. She is a 12th-grade graduate. From 2001, she has been involved in sales of rice, oil, pepper, etc. Sometimes her customers use credit and don’t pay. She learned this way of selling from her friend who she calls a motivator. She likes her business because it makes her self-sufficient. She is requesting a loan to purchase rice, pepper, oil, etc. for her business. Her plan is to become a international businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase rice, pepper, oil, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Shamsia

texts.en:
Shamsia is a 33-year-old salon proprietor in Mariakini, Kenya. She is a married mother of three children who is supported by her husband. She has been in this business for the last three years and she has done great.

This marks her second borrowing from KADET LTD, to finance her business. She will purchase women's hair weaves for her salon and add plastic chairs, and will use the anticipated profit to expand the business. She hopes to open a massage parlor in future.

loans.use: to purchase hair weaves and add plastic chairs for her salon.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a 40-year-old carpenter who specializes in making handcarts. He is married. He has been running his carpentry business for the past three years successfully. Robert earns a monthly income of KES 20,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his second business loan from KADET LTD to finance his business. He will use the loan to purchase timber, which he will use to make handcarts for sell.

He anticipates to get profit from the sales, which he will use to educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to have an established carpentry business.

loans.use: to purchase timber.

loans.name: Ismayil

texts.en:
Ismayil is 54 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and son, who is aged 19. His family, wife and son are engaged in trading. His wife imports clothes, and their son sells them at the bazaar. 
 
Ismayil has a car and works as a taxi driver. He has been a driver for 19 years. He serves local people and earns income.
 
With a previous loan he received from VFAC, Ismayil repaired his car, as it was damaged and had long distance service problems.
 
Ismayil now needs to improve his home, so he is applying for a loan from Kiva and VFAC to buy cement, bricks and sand. With this he will be able to cover the necessities of improving the house and giving his family a healthier life.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks and sand to improve his house.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a 31-year-old business lady in Ruiru. She is married to Dickson and are blessed with two school-going children. She has been buying and supplying green vegetables and fruits and selling them to the residents of Ruiru. She has been doing this for the past two years with a monthly income of KES. 5,000, which she uses to support her family. Pamela is applying for her first loan with KADET LTD. 

She will use the loan to purchase more kale, cabbages, mangoes, and spinach for sale and pay the school fees for her children. With the anticipated profit she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to be the biggest supplier of vegetables in Ruiru.

loans.use: to purchase more kale, cabbages, mangoes, and spinach.

loans.name: Garmai

texts.en: Garmai lives in Montserrado County, home to the capital city of Liberia. It is well known as the commercial city of Liberia. She is 48 years old, married with seven children between 22 and 29 years old. They all live on their own. For the past 10 years now, she has been running a table market where she sells potatoes and greens. She started this business with help from her father and learned this way of selling from her mother. She likes her business because it gives her more profits and makes her popular. She is requesting a loan to buy more potatoes and greens for her business. She want to get more money to build her house since she has a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy more potatoes and greens for her business.

loans.name: Inga

texts.en:
Inga is 23 years old. She lives in Senaki district with her 25-year-old husband, Zviad, and two infants. Inga requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for her family business startup, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time because of low income and her family’s poor living conditions.

The family has one pig and nine piglets, which are to be sold as meat. Also, they own an agricultural plot of land. Zviad cultivates the land and sows different kinds of vegetables. Harvested products are sold locally at the markets and the family gets a small monthly income. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category.

Inga requested a loan from Credo to start up the family business. Her loan request was approved in the frames of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The startup loan program envisages provisions of business startup and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor who do not have access to credit products and are regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit, Inga will purchase a milk cow. She will milk it to make dairy products and sell it at the local markets. Inga hopes to develop their farming to have more income. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Startup loan, will help her to significantly improve their living conditions and to be able to provide for her children's future.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow and, with the received milk, make dairy products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Mehman

texts.en:
Mehman is an auto mechanic and rents a small garage; he established his business in 1997. He has built good experience in this field, and he is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation. He has worked in a several places and he dreams to build his own auto mechanic shop.
He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better life conditions. Mehman is the main provider of the family.

Mehman is married and a father of two little boys. His wife works as a kindergarten teacher. Their two sons are suffering from the cramp disease and due to this reason attend the kindergarten where their mother works, to be under her control. 

Mehman's parents live with him. His father is cancer patient. The loan he has applied for will support his father's treatment expenses.

loans.use: to support his father's treatment expenses.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en: Olivia is married with four children. All of her children are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (orphans). She has a business of selling old bras and has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 1500000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) to buy more bales of used bras. She doesn’t have any other income-generating activity. She moves door to door selling used bras and works six days out of every week but on a retail basis only. Her major business challenge includes seasonality and defaulters. She aspires to get a permanent business premise and also to become a wholesaler.  She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used bras.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 38-year-old married man. He is a father to three girls and a boy. Mohammad works in a school as a cleaner in the day time. After that he goes to his small business selling accessories and children toys. He is applying for a loan to redecorate the shop.

loans.use: to redecorate the shop.

loans.name: Ahlam

texts.en: Ahlam is a 43-year-old mother of seven. Her husband is a bus driver. To be able to support the family, Ahlam opened a small business at home selling home products. Now Ahlam is applying for a loan to increase the quantity she has of home products, and register her business officially.

loans.use: register her business officially

loans.name: Mahenzo's Group

texts.en: Mahenzo is a 47-year-old father of eight. To earn income for his family, he takes jobs as a casual laborer, makes bricks for building, and works on other people's farms. However, Mahenzo faces the challenges of low payment or no payment when working for other people, or a lack of market when making his own bricks. Mahenzo wants to make the long term investment in the KOMAZA microforestry program so that one day he can educate his children and buy land on which he can settle his family with the proceeds from his tree farm.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a 38-year-old lady with four school-going children. She runs a hair salon that she started in 1997, when she was 22 years old. She realized that she had talent in plaiting hair and decided to start a salon. Since then she has gained more experience and has become an expert. Sarah's salon is on the outskirts of town. To supplement her income, Sarah also sells air time cards on a small scale.

Sarah wants this loan to buy more treatments, creams, lotions, shampoos, dyes and hair weaves. Sarah's major challenge is high taxes. Also, the months of January and February are months when schools begin so most people have no money to spend on a salon, so business is usually low.

Sarah's dream is to see her salon grow into a renowned business that attracts people from far and wide. In the photo is Sarah with the Ugafode credit officer.

loans.use: to buy hair oils, creams and treatments for the salon

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en: Jihad is a 43-year-old woman. She has two sons and one married daughter. Jihad has a home business buying and selling birds to bring another source of income to the family. Now Jihad is applying for a loan to bring new types of birds and more birds’ cages and food.

loans.use: to buy more birds with new cages.

loans.name: Haya

texts.en: Haya is a 47 year old divorced woman, who is the mother of two children.  Haya is living on her retirement salary as she served in the military.  Now Haya has started a small business to be able to support herself and her children.  She opened a small snacks stall in her house.  Now Haya is applying for a loan to bring more snacks and to add some food products.

loans.use: to bring more snacks and add some food products.

loans.name: Sylvester's Group

texts.en: Sylvester is a thirty-nine year old carpenter, husband and father of three children.  He wants to invest in a tree farm with the KOMAZA microforestry program so that he can eventually invest more capital into his carpentry business and improve his family's living standard.  Sylvester says, "KOMAZA has brought us together in the community."

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support

loans.name: Alu Buga

texts.en:
Alu Buga is a 45 year old businesswoman who lives in Juba.  She is married and has 6 children between the ages of 5 and 20.  All of them go to school.

Alu Buga runs a general store, and has been in business for 7 years.  She has no employees.  She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. She is taking a loan of 3,000 SSP to purchase beans, kejje, and many other items.  Besides this business, there is no other source of income.

In 5 years Alu Buga would like to expand her business.  Her major challenges include high prices in the market.  Alu Buga says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: for buying more items like bean, kejje etc

loans.name: Robert's Group

texts.en:
Robert is a forty-seven year old father of seven children.  To earn income for his family, he resorts to charcoal burning and selling firewood.  Sylvester says, "I decided to join KOMAZA since I have young children.  In the future I will be able to educate them when I harvest the trees."  

He also wants to build a permanent house and buy a milk cow with the proceeds from his KOMAZA tree farm.  Sylvester shares, "My favorite part in KOMAZA is how the trees grow fast in this dry area and how KOMAZA takes care of its farmers."

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: The school fees loan given to Mary will help her to pay tuition for her two children in higher institution.  She thinks this will help her to give her children a better future by educating them.  She thanks Kiva lenders through UGAFODE Micro finance for taking interest in financing her children's  education. She will strengthen the partnership by meeting her loan repayments on time.  She is a hard working and committed woman.

loans.use: To pay tuition for her children

loans.name: Sebastião

texts.pt:
Casado maritalmente a mais de 12 anos, e vivem com dois sobrinhos
É carpinteiro de profissão e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar meios circulantes (madeira) para o fabrico de portas para revenda
No futuro pretende adquirir mais equipamento para a carpintaria e empregar mais duas pessoas para responder a dinâmica da procura.
O seu maior desafio trabalhar no sentido de é vencer a concorrência no mercado
texts.en:
Sebastião has been married for more than 12 years and lives with two nephews.

He's a carpenter by profession and with this loan he plans to buy wood to make doors for resale.

In future he intends to acquire more carpentry equipment and hire another two people to respond to market demand.

His biggest challenge is to work hard to beat his competition in the market.

loans.use: buy wood to make doors for resale.

loans.name: Izdihar

texts.en:
Izdihar is a 41-year-old married woman. Her husband is a plumber.

Izdihar has a small food market at home that brings an additional income to the family. She is applying for a loan to bring in more food products and expand her shop in the future.

loans.use: to bring in more food products

loans.name: Racheal's Group

texts.en:
Racheal is a forty-four-year-old mother of twelve; her husband is a mason. She earns income for her family by fishing but lacks customers for her fish.

Racheal is joining the KOMAZA microforestry program so that she can improve her standard of living when she harvests her trees. She plans to use the profits from her tree farm to educate her children and build a permanent house for her family.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is a thirty-one-year-old married woman with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. For six years she has been teaching and with her meager salary she has been able to start an apiary project to earn more income.  She was inspired into service by the fact that she likes interacting with children.

Inadequate capital poses a challenge to her business plan, while her dream is to become the leading honey supplier in the region. Eva intends to use the loan to buy more beehives so as to have more bees.

loans.use: to buy more beehives so as to have more bees

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en:
Sanaa is a 30-year-old married woman and is the mother of one daughter. Her husband is a farmer.

Sanaa helps in adding another source of income to the family by selling blankets to friends, relatives and neighbors. People are starting to know her by the word of mouth of her customers, which raised the demand on the blankets she sells. Now Sanaa is applying for a youth loan to bring more blankets and bed covers of different sizes.

loans.use: to bring in more blankets and bed covers

loans.name: Charo

texts.en:
Charo is a 76-year-old livestock trader in Mariakani, Kenya. He is married and he supports eleven people in his family. He has been in this business for the last forty-two years and he has done great.

This marks his fifth borrowing from KADET LTD to buy goats and sheep for trade. His previous loans were repaid successfully and he will use the anticipated profit to service his loan. 

He hopes to teach his sons and give them capital to continue with this business.

loans.use: to buy goats and sheep

loans.name: Binnat

texts.en: Binnat is married and has 4 children. He lives in the Fuzuli region with his family. This is Binnat's second loan. He is very thankful to Kiva and lenders for the first loan, but now he needs 2,000 AZN to buy calves for improving his agriculture business. Binnat has been raising calves for 15 years.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Adel

texts.en: Adel is a 47-year-old father of four. He is a blacksmith working in his own shop to provide his children with the best education. He wants to enhance his business to increase his revenue, being the only supporter in the family. For that he is applying for a loan to bring new tools to his shop.

loans.use: to bring new tools to his shop.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is a forty-nine-year-old widow with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. Eleven years ago, after the death of her beloved husband, she realized that she could not support her family without an income source; hence she ventured into clothing sales. The ever-changing customer preferences, coupled with limited finances, affect her business. Lydia intends to use the loan to buy clothes to sell ahead of the Easter season.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell ahead of the Easter season.

loans.name: Ilarion

texts.en:
Ilarion is 39 years old. He lives in the Vani District with his retired mother. Ilarion requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Ilarion has two milk cows and a plot of agricultural land where they have a vineyard and grow nut trees. They milk the cow and make dairy products. Harvested grapes and nuts are sold with the dairy products locally at the markets, and the family gets a small amount of monthly income. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Ilarion requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. His loan request was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit, Ilarion will purchase a quick payment machine (which is used for paying communal taxes and different service fees). This business is newly developed in the country and he hopes that it will be successful and will increase his family income. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To purchase a pay box machines which are used for paying communal taxes

loans.name: Engjellushe

texts.en:
Engjellushe is in her early sixties and a member of the Egyptian vulnerable ethnic minority community. She lives in a rural area of southern Albania and has chosen livestock as her primary activity, unlike other members of the same community. They usually live in the suburbs and sell second-hand items as it’s something that they have been known for.

Engjellushe is married and doesn’t have children. For the past fifteen years, she has been taking care of her animals and sells their products to the local dairy farm. She also plants and sells veggies and mostly grains. 

The loan she is requesting for the first time will be used to buy an additional dairy cow.

loans.use: to buy an additional dairy cow

loans.name: Sara Angeline

texts.fr: Sara Angeline est une dame âgée de 48 ans, séparée de son époux et mère de 05 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 05 et 28 ans et parmi lesquels un seul va à l'école. comme activité, elle vend du pain, des biscuits, détergents et de l'huile de palme depuis 21 ans dans un marché de la ville. sa longue expérience dans le domaine lui a permis de se constituer un portefeuille clientèle considérable malgré l'arrivée progressive de la concurrence. elle voudrait avec ce crédit acheter 20 bidons d'huile de palme et un cajou de tomate afin de renforcer son stock de marchandise par pouvoir faire face à la concurrence. c'est avec les revenus générés par cette activité qu'elle parvient à supporter les charges domestiques.
texts.en: Sara Angeline is a 48-year old woman who is separated from her husband and is mother to five children, ranging from five to 28 years old; only one of the children goes to school. She has been selling bread, biscuits, detergents and palm oil in one of the town's markets for the past 21 years. Her long experience in this field has enabled her to build up a considerable customer portfolio despite the progressive arrival of competition. With this loan she would like to buy 20 containers of palm oil and a crate of tomatoes so that she can boost her stock of goods in order to be able to cope with the competition. With the income she generates from this business she manages to cover her domestic expenses.

loans.use: to buy oil and tomatoes.

loans.name: Alice

texts.pt:
Viúva vivendo com 3 filhos em Umbeluzi – Boane
É professora e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (areia, blocos e cimento) para iniciar a sua obra.
Futuramente deseja terminar sua residência apetrechar e comprar bens para os filhos.~
Seu maior desafio é encontrar soluções financeiras.
texts.en:
Alice is a widow and lives with her three children in Umbeluzi, Boane. She is a teacher.

With this loan she intends to buy construction materials (sand, blocks and cement) to start building her home. 

In the future she wishes to complete the construction of her home, furnish it and buy goods for her children.

Her biggest challenge is finding financial solutions.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (sand, blocks and cement) to start building her home
